Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites - Perfect hotel for our vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Heaprime
Reviews.Content: Perfect! Friendly staff. Clean and comfortable rooms. Delicious breakfast buffet and nightly Managers Reception a nice touch. A great choice when traveling with 3 teenagers. Not disappointed at all, will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and great value!!”
Reviews.Author: AJ1375
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week while on a mix business and pleasure trip. The location is terrific as you are literally within steps of Old Montreal. It is also across the subway station and rental car company which I used during my stay. The front staff were terrific and very friendly. I can't recall a hotel where the front staff says hello to you every time they see you. The room itself was spacious. I got a one queen bedroom suite with pullout sofa bed on the 3rd floor. One issue I had was that the bathroom door wouldn't close properly. They were sliding doors and it just wouldn't lock. The wait staff during the free breakfast hours could also be more friendlier. For the four mornings I had breakfast there, they wait staff had sour puss looks except for the chef!!! Not really what you want to see in the morning while eating your eggs and bacon. Overall, I'd definitely come back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: MachuPichu24
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooms! Apart from that nothing special. There was no free tables for breakfast. Very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good deal overall”
Reviews.Author: Christine A
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The location was great- walking distance (only a few blocks) to Notre Dame and Old Montreal. Great big spacious room. Happy hour and breakfast included- really can't beat it for the price in that location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: allyt322
Reviews.Content: We knew this place had good reviews, but we weren't expecting such AMAZING value from the low price (I think we paid around $120 per night over Easter long weekend). Friendly staff, very spacious rooms, great location, lots of perks! LOCATION: Excellent! Quick walk to the subway station, right on the edge of Old Town. Convenience store a 5 minute walk away. ROOMS: Very big. Ours had a very comfy bed, a nice big TV, and a kitchen (huge fridge, microwave, dishwasher). Great water pressure in the showers. Gorgeous sheets with a high thread count. SERVICE: Very friendly staff! Helpful, welcoming, happy to speak either French or English. PERKS: We got two vouchers each for a drink during the Manager's Cocktail Hour. Generous pours of wine, beer, and soft drink! Ample snacks - corn chips, pretzels, vegies. This was a nice little touch and we enjoyed having a pre-dinner drink in the evenings. We also got a free newspaper on Saturday morning, which was nice. BREAKFAST: Great! Big selection - crepes, oatmeal, cereal, gorgeous fresh fruit, yoghurt, eggs, sausages, potatoes, omelette station, pastries, OJ, coffee. GYM: Huge gym! Free weights, several treadmills/bikes/etc. Lots of floor space. CONS: It's sort of irritating having such a big space for a kitchen, yet no hot plate or cooking utensils...but oh well. The internet could also be bad at times in the room. Other than that, this was a great hotel! I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “March Break at The Embassy”
Reviews.Author: micmikmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites for March Break with 3 tweens, and it was excellent. Loved the complimentary buffet breakfast they provided, started the day off right, the choices were great, they had bacon, sausage, eggs, fruits, pancakes, omellettes, etc. something for everyone. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and well decorated, felt like we were staying in a condo. The tweens had their own room with a TV. The piece de resistance, was the jacuzzi tub, soaking in that tub at the end of day was just superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, walk to Old Montreal, Metro across the street”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Canucks16
Reviews.Content: I travel to Montreal several times a year, in the winter and summer months and attend a few events at the Bell Centre. I usually book a king suite with whirlpool and fireplace or the Presidential suite when travelling with family. The sofa in the livingroom is a sofabed, just request for more beddings and pillows if needed. Rooms are comfortable and kitchen convenient especially when travelling with kids. See other TA reviews about location. Sometimes we use taxis to get around and rates are very reasonable. When there's traffic - its faster to walk than take the cab. This hotel is not in party central, if you're looking for something more lively stay closer to St. Catherines area. Metro is a bit hidden, go across the street to the post office. There's a concourse area, go towards the convenience store and the Metro is behind there. All in all, great value and buffet breakfast is included. A lot of variety and omellete station can get busy. The hotel is geared more for business and family travel. During Peak travel/season times it's a good idea to make your reservations (especially New Years Eve) early as this hotel fills up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: jen0111
Reviews.Content: Got a pleasant surprise when we checked in, we got upgraded to the corner Presidential Suite. It was a nice large suite, 1200 SQFT. The bedroom was large, with a Flat Screen TV, a fireplace and a comfortable King Bed. Down the hall, a kitchen with stove top, microwave, full size fridge and a dishwasher. A dining room that seats six table at the table. A large living room with a sectional couch, a flat screen TV and a fireplace. They also provide us with a roll away crib, as requested. They also invite you to a managerâ€™s cocktail hour from 5:30-7:30 and give you a voucher for free drinks. It was great! They also offer you complimentary breakfast buffet with a omelette bar. Parking is a little expensive, $23 for the day but this is Montreal, and itâ€™s the going rate. The hotel is situated right across the street from the convention centre, a short walk to downtown. I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great rooms, easy parking, happy hour”
Reviews.Author: brooklintravel
Reviews.Content: very nice rooms, some have a fire place, very clean and comfortable. If facing the main street can hear street traffice especially snow removal equipment. Ask for rooms facing the side streets or the back alley. 15 min walk to the "Bell Centre".

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Mirkham
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms, common spaces and staff. They have thought of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded All My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: hafman99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located only a few minutes from the VIA Rail train station. I was allowed to check-in about an hour early and the hotel accommodated my requests (high floor, corner room). The room was SPECTACULAR! At the entrance, there's a small area to store your luggage, hang your coat, and stash your shoes. The kitchen had 3 appliances (yes, even the fake dishwasher as a previous reviewer mentioned!). The living area had a sofa bed, 2 chairs, coffee table, work desk/chair, and TV. The bedroom had another TV and ample closet space. The bathroom was amazing because of the size and the jacuzzi tub. The complimentary breakfast was superb! Just enter the dining area downstairs, proceed to an empty table, and help yourself to anything you want. Same goes for complimentary snacks/drinks in the evening. I cannot wait to return to Montreal. If this hotel is available for a decent price, I would not hesitate to stay there again. The only down point was the cost of parking ($26 per night, even on weekends).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: AlleghenyJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter and I, along with another family, all went to Montreal together from February 18 to February 22, 2012. We all stayed at the Embassy Suites. What a great hotel! From the effortless check-in, the free parking and the warm greetings by every staff person we met, to the beautifully appointed suites each of the two families had, the Embassy Suites was a perfect place to stay while visiting Montreal. The suites are large and decorated with beautiful wood accents and wonderful paintings; our suite had a gas fireplace (which was a surprise to us) which provided just the right extra warmth after a day exploring Montreal in the cold weather. Our suite actually felt very homey. The beds were superb, and the fold-out couch was also very comfortable. The internet access was flawless, much to my daughter's delight. Not to be repetitive, but the staff were all terrific, warm, friendly, knowledgeable and professional with nearly all being being bilingual and fully able to accomodate us both in English and in our (unfortunately) poor French. The location of the Embassy Suites is incredible; a couple blocks from Notre Dame Cathedral and the Old City, a couple blocks from Chinatown, and just a ten minute walk to the sites of "Montreal En Lumiere", the Winter Festival. There is a Manager's Reception every evening with two drinks per person free, and a full breakfast with a great buffet menu every day. The lobby and restaurant area are beautiful and spacious, the furnishings are stylish, and the clientele is a pleasant combination of business travelers, and tourist couples and families. Fantastic place! We had no problems and a wonderful time. I can't imagine going to Montreal and staying anywhere else. I heartily recommend the Embassy Suites to anyone who wants a truly comfortable place from which to explore a truly interesting world-class city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug6277
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. just a few blocks from Notre Dame and Old town Montreal by foot. they were very accommodating with my dog which i highly appreciate. The breakfast every morning is great - it definitely saves you money eating out. Also, the free drinks during Manager's Happy Hour is good, but you have to get there fairly early if you want to get a seat... the patrons definitely take full advantage of this offer :) so it can get pretty crowded. All in all, a great stay. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT GET AWAY”
Reviews.Author: elewisOttawa_On
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel from Feb. 18 - Feb. 20, 2012. The check in process was a breeze. The suite that we got is gorgeous. It's like a 1 bedroom condo. The jacuzzi was the star of the room. Very large and powerful. The king size bed is comfortable. There is free breakfast in the restaurant in the lobby but it was very crowded. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Montreal comfort”
Reviews.Author: tarynpeter
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed the Embassy Suites.great location. Large rooms even if some of the furniture was nicked and worn. Nice bathroom and wonderfull beds, especially after the long drive.

Reviews.Title: “Valentines Day surprise”
Reviews.Author: NikCalgary
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked a queen two room suite for us for an early valentines surprise. They upgraded us to a king suite upon arrival. The lady at the reception also gave us coupons which included 2 drinks EACH! in the evening along with snacks and 2 coupons for a full breakfast. The suite was clean and pretty but we were missing utensils in the kitchen. We didn't bother calling the front desk since we were only there for a night. The bathroom had a jacuzzi which I enjoyed ! The bed was very very comfortable and it was hard waking up in the morning.In the evening we went to the bar for drinks and they had chips, dip, vegetables and dip out in the open for everybody which was very nice. The breakfast next day had sausages, scrambled eggs, bacon, pastries, amazing banana bread, juices, coffee, pancakes, cereal and cook to order eggs where we can choose our filling! I had a really good time at this hotel and I will definitely be back !

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: Mortaric
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers very spacious suites at a reasonable price for a downtown location. It really has a luxury feel. The room was very well kept, I could tell they steam cleaned the carpet. The kitchen was nice to look at but there is no cooking range and only one place setting. The fridge is nice. I liked the fireplace to warm up. The bathroom is big, I didn't Ty the tub but it looked inviting. The bed was very comfortable. We received two free drink vouchers as a welcome gift. Parking is $26, yikes! The included breakfast offered a lot a selection with hot and cold choices. This is one of the nicer hotels I've stayed in. I enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: WJC50
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites is probably different than others you may have visited. They all are good value, known for their spacy rooms, big buffet breakfast and happy hours. This is all of those things plus the service and location of the 5-star hotels nearby. This location is in the downtown area, right on the edge of old town, providing an excellent location for business or leisure travel. The service is friendly, while being professional and effecient. The informal restaurant is a good value, but there are also many alternatives of all types and prices within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: Chula_Banana
Reviews.Content: I got a rate of $149 which I think was a killer deal for what we got. The suite is huge and excellent for a longer stay or if you are doing work in your room or doing business. The living room opens to the kitchen and bar stools so a group of 4 or 5 could easily converse. The "custom" bathroom with the 2-person jacuzzi rocks. The cocktail reception is a nice touch, you get 2 free drinks per person per night, true there is really nothing in the way of finger food. We were able to exchange 5 drink coupons for a bottle of wine which we took up to our room to continue our business conversation. Not all the waiters were as friendly or accomodating, but overall service was good. Personally, I thought breakfast was very good and I was impressed by the variety. I love the personalized omeletes but if you can't eat those every day, you can still have a beautiful breakfast. Over the usual toast and pastries there was yogurt, plenty of fruit, boiled eggs and cheese. The location is perfect for tourists as it it right on the corner of Old Montreal. Good for business travellers too as it is very easy to access the Autoroute Ville-Marie. Parking is a nightmare and the hotel's rate was actually ok for the neighbourhood. I've been to all the Hilton hotels in Montreal and this was the best one in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: htravelbug
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable & very clean. The kitchen had a full size fridge, microwave & dishwasher. Utensils & plates are available upon request. There was a very good hot breakfast buffet included in the room price. The staff were very helpful, polite & professional. It was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money on a suite with a kitchen.”
Reviews.Author: koldriana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for business during the Montreal Auto Show. We requested a room with a kitchen expecting that we would be able to use it during our 5 day stay in order to avoid having to eat out constantly. We couldn't have been more disappointed with the 'amenities'. I have stayed in many properties that advertised kitchens and in all but this one there were at least provided SOMETHING to cook with. There was not a scrap of cookware, knives to prepare food, cutting board, can opener, utensils or anything else one could use to prepare a meal. We called the desk and asked them to bring some cutlery and a dish so we could at least have something to eat with. Unfortunately the kitchen was not even equipped with dish soap to wash our plates! and the 'dishwasher' is NOT a dishwasher - it's just a decorative door that looks like one. This was a colossal failure as a kitchen and a waste of money for the company. If you plan to use the kitchen pack accordingly. The bathroom was very large - unfortunately the space was wasted by the tub. The shower 'stall' reminded me of a locker room. It was absolutely tiny with no real space to do anything at all. Bathing in a big Jacuzzi tub daily is not only a waste of water but considering that the tub takes almost half an hour to fill it is also not practical when one is on a schedule. As members of the honors program we were also provided with vouchers for the breakfast buffet. The quality of the food and service was lackluster. The 'cook to order omelet' was made with boxed egg product and the toppings were just dumped into the middle of the mass of egg without ever being cooked. The result was an omelet with raw crunchy filling in the middle - our associate was presented with one that was so undercooked it was running on his dish. The rest of the buffet was of the same quality and the staff were completely dis-interested in anything at all. The first day we were 'accosted' for our ticket and then not even provided with any instruction as to where we could find coffee, what was available, where it was..nothing. We sat for 5 minutes waiting for a server to come over but got nothing at all. The location is nice, the bed was very comfortable. Everything else.. well, I wouldn't book the room again given the choice.

Reviews.Title: “A favorite in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: OttawaFans
Reviews.Content: Our family simply loves this hotel. Its location, service and staff are very outstanding. You are a few steps from old Montreal and its awesome restaurants. Accommodations are spacious with excellent and state-of-the-art facilities such as modern kitchen. Kitchen will vary in size depending on the unit chosen (tip: if serving ware is needed, please advise during your reservation as plates, cups, etc are not automatically made available in the rooms). Customs bathrooms with large jacuzzi feature a separate shower stall - very nice!!! We have been renting a two-bedroom unit for the last few years to host a family New Year's Eve Party. The large accommodation, the Manager's Cocktail Party along with the complimentary Hot & Cold buffet makes this hotel ideal for such gathering. We have seen positive improvement over the years in the space allocated and in the handling of the morning breakfast. Kudos to the Embassy Suites Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for Auto Show”
Reviews.Author: seawaykicker30
Reviews.Content: We are at the Embassy Suites for the Montreal Auto Show. What a great choice -- sparkling clean with wonderful decor and all the amenities you expect at an Embassy. The property is quite new and is situated right across from the Auto Show venue. Beds and furnishings are new and crisp. There are wonderful restaurants and lots to do in the city. The breakfast at the Embassy is great and the drink tickets much appreciated. Highly recommend this hotel for a stop in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, will go back!”
Reviews.Author: Sofija1
Reviews.Content: Stay was good, rooms were clean and updated. Staff was nice. Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic suite...Disgusting breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: yorom
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel....for its location and for the wonderful 1-bedroom suite i stayed in. The staff at check-in and check-out were outstanding. I hated the restaurant/bar/breakfast staff....they were ALL rude and careless. Breakfast was cahotic, tasteless and a mess!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kimjaeb
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for tourist nearby old montreal scenic sights with comfort parking plus complimentary drink and breakfast. Jaccuzi was very nice and also spacious living room with kitchen. Surely will come back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “WE WILL BE BACK!”
Reviews.Author: motherjanegoose
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Gold Member, I stay in lots of hotels. ( I suggest anyone reading Tripadvisor take into consideration how many reviews an individual has posted to determine their travel experience). I was able to cash in points for a 3 night stay. It was our first visit to Montreal. We could not have picked a better place. The front desk and concierge were so helpful. Mike was able to book us a tour and suggest dining options. We took a taxi from the airport, flat rate of $38. Check in was smooth and we were upgraded to a wonderful room. The evening reception was the only disappointment: chips/salsa/veggies and dip plus drinks. I have been in other Embassy locations ( such as Boston) that offer a broader option on the food but this is not why we booked this hotel. The breakfast was good: food plentiful and the waiters were efficient. The location was perfect and we walked to everything we needed. It was cold...so wear appropriate clothes! We did not take the train but saw that it was very close by. Everyone was pleasant about speaking to us in English. I managed to communicate in French ( very rusty) as I took it in HS, over 30 years ago. I was told that while my vocabulary was limited my pronunciation was excellent. We will certainly return to enjoy this charming city! Loved our trip!

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: WJY
Reviews.Content: Our stay after Boxing Day was our fifth one as a family and each has been exceptional. This Embassy Suites is the most modern and up to date one that I have stayed at, and not like the others which seem to be older, with huge atriums and dated decor. The promixity to Vieux Montreal is fantastic while the walk to St. Catherines Street for shopping is about fifteen minutes. Our experiences with staff have generally been excellent and we have been allowed an early check-in on at least a couple of occasions. The made-to-order breakfast with fresh fruit is great and without the massive crowds and huge line ups that exist at other ES Hotels. Same with the evening reception which tends to be a lot more relaxed. The fitness facility is also very good with cardio machines, a universal and a good selection of barbells; in the summer, running through the Vieux Port is quite nice. I occasionally check other Montreal hotels for comparison and nothing else comes close. Overall, a quality hotel, excellent value and well-deserving of the high Trip Advisor rating.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property!”
Reviews.Author: dds60
Reviews.Content: Stayed at ES Montreal for 3 nights with my 3 daughters. The staff are super friendly and accomodating and the location is perfect. The buffet breakfast ( including made-to-order omeletes) is delicious. The Metro (subway) is right accross the street. I have stayed in many hotels around the world, I can't remember the last time I was so impressed with the staff and rooms. The only downsides would be that there is no pool and that many rooms look out on to a back alley. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern room.”
Reviews.Author: mfaghih
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites for 3 nights. Overall it was a great experience with nothing bad to say. The room was very modern with granite countertops and nice appliances. The fridge was a good size, much better than most places, so you can actually fit groceries in it and not one take out box. We had a queen suite so it had a living room area, bedroom area, kitchen, closet up front for coats, and a big bathroom. The bathroom was very nice with a huge spa tub but a smaller shower. It even had a vanity mirror with a seat to apply your makeup or style your hair. The bedroom and pocket doors opening to the living room which was a cute touch and it had 2 flat screen tv's throughout the suite. They had a great free breakfast buffet in the morning which would accomodate anyone's tastes. Lots of choices including omelets, cereal, pancakes, fruit, pastries, etc... The location was great if you want to be close to Old Montreal. It is right around the corner with great restaurants and shops. Notre Dame Basilica was just a 2 minute walk which is a must see. Also, the Chinese District is 2 blocks away which has amazing food! I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a nice place to stay in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place stay in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: CanadianFlatlander
Reviews.Content: I had to stay overnight in Montreal for a business meeting and chose the Embassy based on its location and the fact that it is part of the Hilton brand. There is on site parking (cost of $21/day) with in and out privileges. From the front desk to room service to the restaurant the staff was exemplary. Breakfast (buffett or made to order) was included in the room charge. I will choose this hotel again on my next visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfty bed, good location, nice helpeful staff”
Reviews.Author: majeo
Reviews.Content: I got a suite on te 9th floor #921 clean cofty bed roomy, it got jacozy in the bth. room and fire place in the lvng. room, got good breakfast(egg omlette can be better). The gym is ok , you can get fair workout. staff were very nice(you can ask 'em for more coupons for the free drinks at happy hour, (the quantity depends on how many people in the room). the hotel is about half hour from the main airport YUL, depends on traffic & theres always traffic. The hotel is in old town Moreal, its waking distance from china town old church Norte dam(must see) and other attractions which located at st. cathren st. good place to eat(la misa) brasilian$30 a person. and show bet. 8-9 pm. They charge $23 if you park your car at the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but the restaurant is lacking”
Reviews.Author: DougNix
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites MontrÃ©al for three days on business. The location is great, within easy walking distance of Basilique Notre-Dame, Vieux MontrÃ©al, and Chinatown. The room was excellent, very large, well appointed with a small kitchen, full sized refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave and small coffee maker. The living area had an (electric) fireplace, and a large flat-panel TV with external connectors for video, and computer inputs. The bedroom had a very comfortable king-sized bed, good sized closets, a flat-screen tv and a large bathroom with a Neptune massage tub and a shower. The room was very quiet and I had three very good nights sleep. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Absolutely no complaints there. The room came with coupons for two free alcoholic drinks in the bar each evening at the Manager's Reception, and a free hot breakfast each morning. My only disappointment was in the restaurant. The food was lack lustre, not nearly what I expected in a Hilton property and especially one in MontrÃ©al. The service was very slow. The restaurant was also exceptionally noisy and poorly lit. It was very difficult to get a healthy meal, so in good weather I would recommend going out into the neighbourhood. Room service doesn't start until after 11:00 am, and you can't even get a pot of coffee in the morning unless you go to the restaurant. Since the room service comes from the restaurant, all those comments apply, except the speed of service, which was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, incredibly nice staff”
Reviews.Author: underthemilkyway6
Reviews.Content: Very nice suite with jacuzzi, fully fitted kitchen (included cooking stove, oven, microwave, dishwasher), very spacious and one of the comfiest beds I ever slept in. Two TVs, coffee machine, huge fridge, very nice buffet breakfast and complimetary drinks each night. Location excellent, 5 minutes walk from old Montreal and 1 minute walk from Palais des CongrÃ©s (underground Montreal and metro). Nice gym! What was extremely nice was the staff's attitude. I cannot say how friendly and helpful they were, all of them. Always smiling, always ready to accomodate you. They made a mistake by charging my credit card when I asked them not to yet the whole team (I mean 4-5 of them) were as quick as possible to fix things for me. I heard a lot about Quebec friendliness yet they were even nicer than what I heard! Very professional and all bilingual (French and English). This for the reception staff. As for the cleaning ladies, I asked for coffee a couple of times during my 10 nights stay and they stocked up my suite kitchen with coffee every following day (with big smiles Quebec style of course :)). I really recommend it and I would definitely go back there next time in Montreal. The suite itself was super clean and spacious but professional staff like this with big smiles on their face is something I don't get to see often in Europe. Thumbs up for them! Plus the fee I was given was extremely reasonable for the service and comfort of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous HOTEL - NIcer than my house”
Reviews.Author: Juanita_PEI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful - wow, free hot breakfast, complimentary drinks from 5 to 7 - suite is beautiful - kitchen, juccuzi, make up table in large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - affordable, spacious, and dare I say somewhat luxurious hotel in the heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: neimanmarxist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights with a friend. I was actually surprised, coming into the room, how spacious the suites are. I remarked that I wouldn't mind if it were my apartment! There was a small closet/dressing area right by the door, and then there was a full kitchenette with a large refrigerator, microwave, shelves, cupboards, and a dishwasher. Opposite the kitchenette was a full-size bathroom with whirlpool tub and vanity. There is also a sitting room and a separate bedroom with a door that shuts. There was a fireplace in the living room area. The bath amenities are very nice at this hotel, Crabtree & Evelyn. Maid service is prompt and they deliver water in the evenings. The fitness center is not as good as in some other Hilton properties, but it is good enough. There is only one treadmill, but there are 2 ellipticals. Breakfast is very tasty and there is plenty. This was the only area where we had problems, the breakfast staff can be super rude! we were there on a very busy day , though, I imagine they are not normally so unpleasant. I had a sandwich at lunchtime one day in the same restaurant, when it was not so full, and they were perfectly pleasant. There is a manager's reception in the evening where you can have drinks and snacks on the house.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sewaterman
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with large, nicely decorated & very comfortable suites - bigger than many condos today - with a very comfortable bed & good shower water pressure. Very clean & well maintained and check in staff were friendly & helpful and are happy to speak to you in English [not the case everywhere if you're an Anglo visiting Montreal] Location is excellent for convention centre & old Montreal + subway is across the street. Buffet breakfast is good - usual cereals & pastries and they make great omelettes - and there's a very busy happy hour which sadly I was too late getting back from a meeting to really enjoy. Nice business stay hotel with a good atmosphere that seems to attract 30 something crowd

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Krista Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on our way to Quebec City. The hotel is very nice, and is located within walking distance to Old Montreal. We received a free upgrade, and our room (a suite) was huge! Pretty much the same size as my one bedroom condo. Free breakfast the next day was your basic buffet, not fantastic but good enough for sure. Unfortunately we got in too late to enjoy our 2 free (per person) drinks during happy hour, but they gave us our tickets for them anyways to use if we were in the area still the next evening or on our way home.

Reviews.Title: “Easy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: noarmchair
Reviews.Content: In May 2011 we stayed in Old Montreal for several days.Embassy suites had a full hot breakfast and also had a restaurant for dinner. I was travelling with 2 teenage boys so the breakfast was great, busy during the week because of a convention but never waited more than 5 minutes for a table. We didn't eat in the restaurant at night but did order room service dinner one night and it was good.Rooms were large,clean and quiet. We could walk everywhere china town, museums,restaurants. The cafes were reasonable to eat at in Old Montreal with lots of variety.The metro was close,car rentals across the street, and a $6 cab ride to the train. We had taken the train from quebec city.It was an easy,comfortable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay, Terrible Job by Hotel and Hilton”
Reviews.Author: lyonskj
Reviews.Content: I checked in as part of a group sending students to a trip abroad. I drove from New York State with a Thule box on the roof to fit my daughter's luggage for her three month trip. Upon arrival, I discovered I could not fit into the hotel's underground parking garage due to the low clearance. Since I was going on a camping trip after my hotel stay, I had items that needed to stay in the car and thus I needed a secure place. I went to the front desk to explain the situation and I was recommended to a nearby parking lot. I decided to check again with the concierge about indoor parking garages where I might fit. At that point, I was again given the recommendation of the nearby outside lot. I later learned that the hotel offers guests to park in their secure courtyard area. So, I parked my car in the recommended lot. When I arrived the next day to retrieve something from the vehicle, I discovered that my back window was smashed in and the vehicle was ransacked. Aside from the expense and hassle this created, when I went back to the hotel to inform them of this, they then told me I could park in the courtyard! AFTER this incident. They also demanded I pay them for parking. When I questioned this further with a manager, this was dropped. However, the recommendation for parking was terrible, but what was more terrible was the fact there was available secure parking and two different employees failed to notify me of that. When I wrote Hilton corporate to report this matter, I was met with indifference.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Maude B
Reviews.Content: The room is great with the bedroom apart, a small kitchen and a large bathroom. There are 2 tv in the room - awesome. We got two complimentary drinks for each person on the day of our arrival and complimentary breakfast too the next morning. Awesome. Great location too for the hotel, near the old port of Montreal. Very close to the subway. Only problem: the baby crib. I called ahead of time in the morning to ask them to add one in our room but it still wasn't there at 4:30 PM when we arrived. I asked for it at the time of arrival, for the 2nd time that day. Still wasn't there at 6:15 PM. I called back and said we had to put the baby to sleep soon. They said the person in charge had been very busy and would do it soon. It's no excuse for me since I had asked for it around 9:00 that morning! We had to call back at 8:00 PM!!! We still hadn't received the baby crib. It finally got there at 8:20 PM, 2 hours past my baby's bed time. Baby was exhausted and the parents were cranky!! That's the only very bad service we received. Aside from that experience, it was a very nice hotel to stay to.

Reviews.Title: “luxury private jacuzzi + free wifi + great comp breakfast = awesome choice”
Reviews.Author: baldtomato
Reviews.Content: We were in Montreal for 3 nights for an event at the Conference Center (Palais des congrÃ¨s de MontrÃ©al) across the street. We were traveling with our 2 year old, and were a bit apprehensive about it all: getting to the event on time (and on foot), potential "Canadian winter" outdoor temperaatures (in November), the need to access food (milk, yogurt, pastries) at all times... and were delighted at the end of our stay. The Embassy Suites (by Hilton) meets all our expectations. - Location: the hotel is situated near what looks like the financial / business section of downtown - it's not close to the main shopping or dining drags, but it's perfect for us because our main goal was to be close to the Conference Center (which I could have sprinted to, toddler in arm, without taking more than 3 breaths). One evening we walked back from the main shopping area (where H&M is, you get the idea) - via the awesome Montreal underground network, and remained indoors all the way into the Conference Center. We walked very slowly, with a tantrum-ing toddler, and the walk only took us about 20 minutes. You'll spend longer if you end up walking into any of the thousands of shops, of course. The hotel is also little more than 2 blocks away from the Basilica Notre Dame - and the rest of Old Montreal. Walking distance (even with stroller) to many bistros and cobblestone streets. Many bistros though, only open after 5 pm - but that's not the hotel's fault! The hotel is also walking distance to Chinatown, where restaurants open late and you can get decent food relatively cheap (and up to 10 pm). - Room: this is the most spacious room we have ever gotten for under $200. All the rooms in this hotel are suites - with a kitchenette, extra sofa bed in the "living room", very large bathroom, and a entry foyer / closet area. The kitchenette has a real-life sized fridge with ample freezer space for a few gallons of ice cream if you wish. There's a full function microwave, a kitchen sink that i want for my own home, and a very basic coffee / tea brewer. What perplexed us was that there was no stove or cooktop / heating element - not a big issue since it's not like we were gonna actually cook... but why the huge freezer and fridge if we weren't gonna be storing groceries to cook?? We filled up the fridge with milk and yogurt we get from the complimentary breakfast buffet instead, so that our toddler can eat all the yogurt he wants even at midnight. The large two-person sized (square shaped) jacuzzi tub is the best i've seen inside an individual hotel room. It's conceivable that some lesser hotel would have called that a public jacuzzi in the basement floor for all to share - it's that big. and clean - very important. - Food and Drinks: We were offered complimentary breakfast buffet for each of the 3 mornings we stayed there, and on the weekends it lasts till 10:30 am (9:30 am for weekdays). Selection was decent. We were also given complimentary beverage coupons (covers even alcoholic drinks) to be used each evening between 5:30 pm to 7:30 pm. We filled ourselves up with cocktails before dinner. - Service: Front desk staff were all Francophone, but all speak decent English. They were very friendly when we stumbled in at 9 pm with our toddler - immediately giving our toddler a goodie bag to keep him occupied while we sort out rooms. Our booking was a conference-special rate, and only entitled us to a room with a Queen bed (plus the sofa bed in the living room), but they spontaneously offered us a King bed suite when they see us scrambling with a kid. Conceirge is helpful. There is also self-served coin-operated laundry in the building (basement) - bring your own detergent. All in all, we were very happy with our choice. Not sure if we were stay here if our main goal was to sight-see, but then I never gotten around to do research for the sight-seeing type of Montreal trip. I have a feeling that the "downtown" hotels that are close to all the shopping will all be in older buildings and less spacious. All the hotels around the Conference Center are posh and new: the Embassy Suites, Westin, Intercontinental etc. We would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Disconildo
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife in a suite for 8 eight days. This is a very good hotel with free wi-fi, breakfast included, happy hour with 2 free drinks at the bar, daily. No free parking.The suite is spacious, quiet, clean and has a mini kitchen (coffee maker,fridge and microwave). Very comfortable queen bed with a big closet, but the bedroom is a little bit small. Friendly front desk and efficient housekeeper. The subway station is across the street, and you can walk to many interesting spots, like restaurants, touristic points (chinatown, St catherine street, old port) and stores. You don't need a car in montreal. The subways covers all the city and itÂ´s very safe and efficient. We'll definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Take a suite, not the non-suite”
Reviews.Author: GinJose
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times, but on my last trip I thought I would save some money and take one of the non-suite rooms that are on offer at this Embassy Suites location. I won't do it again. The room was adequate and it has the kitchen that all suites here have, but when they did the renovation for these smaller rooms, they should have eliminated the kitchen and made the bathroom adequate. The bathroom must be the smallest one I have ever had in a major hotel. One cannot turn around in it and there is no place to put your toiletries. Otherwise this is a great hotel and, like all Embassy Suites, you get a great breakfast and good drinks in the evening. I also must say that the staff here has always been very friendly, efficient and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; good location”
Reviews.Author: fluffybinks
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one week as I attended a conference across the road at convention centre and other meetings. This hotel is well-located if you want to be near the convention centre or anywhere downtown as it is a short walk to Rue St. Catherine for shopping. For a selection of resturants or the Vieux Montreal it is a longer walk or a short taxi ride. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful, I cannot describe how good they were! The reception desk helped us greatly with the best tips for where to shop for what... etc. Most of them remembered us and our names even though there were so many guests and the hotel was full - they made us feel special. We were given what appeared to be a suite that was a bit larger than the normal as it was in a corner. The suite was well appointed with very nice furniture and fittings. The bathroom was quite large with a corner spa bath, my only complaint is the seperate shower was a little narrow since they took up a lot of room with the spa. They had nice body products. The bedroom area is a bit cramped with two beds in it but if it was only 1 king bed it would be ok. The beds were incredibly comfortable. The living area and kitchen were HUGE; we had a 3 seater couch and 2 single seaters, a desk, fireplace and a huge fully appointed kitchen with granite benchtops. Very spacious. Manager's reception between 5.00 - 7.00 pm a hit with cocktails/wine/beer and some nachos etc, jalopeno poppers etc. The breakfast was reasonably good considering its complementary, there was plenty of variety and there is a place to order omelettes, fried/poached eggs etc. We ate at the restaurant on the 1st night. The menu was unappealing and uninspiring however the food was quite nice and we were pleasantly surprised. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - fabulous rooms!”
Reviews.Author: dcoleman28
Reviews.Content: The room was more like an apartment - 2 rooms, full kitchen area, bathtub big enough for 4, granite, flatscreens, full size stainless-like fridge, fabulous bed. 2 free drink coupons every night, decent complimentary breakfast in the morning. My only complaint is the wifi was spottier in some rooms than others. But totally worth it otherwise!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: 822traveler
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest Embassy Suites we've stayed at. Most of them are identical in style and a little "tired". But this one was like walking into a nice Hilton with a very large, modern lobby and open restaurant concept. Very nice check-in experience, with friendly front desk. The room was extremely nice with a fireplace, huge bathroom, and ample kitchen area. The only negative was the size of the separate shower. I'm 5'2" so it wasn't an issue for me, but my 6'2" husband did complain a little about feeling cramped inside the shower. Great location, just a two block walk to the heart of old Montreal. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay near the restaurants and shopping that old Montreal has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and happy hour”
Reviews.Author: principalman
Reviews.Content: This embassy suites follows the same general plan that the entire chain does, but with some nice advantages. The location is perfect for vacationers, sitting right on the edge between the shopping district of downtown and the old monreal and waterfront area. An easy walk in either direction gets you to plenty of things to do including museums. The rooms are very comfortable, include a significant kitchen space, and a bubble tub. The carpet was a bit worn, but all else about theThis is not the more current set-up with a central indoor courtyard, but more of a standard hotel arraingment. I think it therefore is not as many rooms as most embassy suites we have stayed at, which might explain the more relaxed breakfast set-up without the huge crowds that others have. The breakfast is pretty standard for the chain but with the added twist of some very good pasteries (perhaps the French influence of the city). In most embassy suites the included free drinks happy hour is a line at the bar. At this one, waiters bring your free drinks. You are limited to two drinks for free, but that worked out very nicely as a warm-up prior to our short walk to a gourmet french restaurant in the old montreal section.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel steps from Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Iam2cold
Reviews.Content: This trip combined business with pleasure. The hotel is located very close to old Montreal which is a great site seeing opportunity. The great feature about this hotel is they give you a full buffet breakfast for each person every day you are there, and two drinks per person per day for the bar. The room was very quiet and comfortable. We found that it was a little odd that there was a full fridge in a room with no stove, but c'est la vie! The only complaint is that there was no counter space in the bathroom (major complaint for my wife!!). The desk staff, and concierge were very pleasant and helpful. The concierge put us on to a executive transportation service (24\7) for our trip back to the airport. This was slightly more than a cab ride but you are riding in style with a very pleasant driver for about $7 more than a cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fiona229
Reviews.Content: stayed here whilst attending a conference at the palais de congress across the road. Staff very friendly when we arrived. The room was nice and came with a well equipped kitchen. Very good size bathroom with jacuzzi. Breakfasts were good especially the made to order omelettes. The manager's reception was a nice touch and the staff providing the service at it were extremely pleasant to us. The location is very good both for the ocnference and sightseeing round Old Montreal and a nice experience Overall very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: summitsvs
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Embassy Suites. Consistent product that they are - the rooms are large and clean, BIG refrigerators, gym is nice and 24 hours, cocktail hour with sidewalk seating to watch passers-by, good breakfast. Staff here is very accomodating. Great location right across the street from the Palais de Congress and two blocks from parts of Old Montreal, the Basilica, and the Waterfront. Bus to airport is about three blocks away and $8.00.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in some regards....with a few very minor shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: ChuckLubbockTX
Reviews.Content: Overall our suite was very nice and comfortable. The personnel were very cordial and accommodating. The free full breakfast and the free drink at night were nice touches. The suite's kitchen, however, was very sparsely furnished in terms of supplies. There should be at least two cloth tea towels and a roll of paper towels. There are tissues in the bathroom, but it would be nice to have a box of tissues in the main room.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal Gem”
Reviews.Author: TXDavid937
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, comfortable beds, clean and quiet with week night drinks and snacks at happy hour and very good breakfast included--this is an excellent spot for visiting the sites of Montreal. Staff was very responsive. Train station a mile away, underground a block away, old Montreal behind the hotel--location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iloveart53
Reviews.Content: We just got back today from spending 4 nights at this hotel. It and the staff were simply wonderful. First, the room was nice and large, very clean, with a very comfortable bed. The small kitchen had a large fridge with freezer and Microwave. We had asked that plates and utensils be already in the room when we arrived, and they were. We had asked to be on a top floor, and we were. We had requested early check-in, and they did. I had mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary and next night they surprised us with a bottle of wine! Very nice indeed. Breakfast was included with the room, and there was plenty to eat, including an omelet station. The chef new my wife by the 2nd morning and had her omelet ready for her! In the evening you were given a coupon for 2 drinks each at happy hour(5:30-7:30), and there was free snacks. Chips, salsa, et. The hotel itself is in a great part of the city. To the right is Old Montreal, and to the left was Chinatown. The subway was one block away, and took us everywhere needed. We walked most of the time. We had dinner at two great restaurants, both with Jazz. The first one was Modavie, at 1 Rue Paul. Very good service and wonderful food. The 2nd restaurant was Jardin Nelson (www.jardinnelson.com) , also in Old Montreal.They are now closed till May. Again, the staff was wonderful, the Jazz great, and the food delicious. We did eat twice at the Embassy Suites and found the food very good. Nothing to complain about. The staff could not have been nicer, and would do anything for you. My wife and I would highly recommend this hotel while staying in Montreal. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: isobretatel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. +Nice, modern room with kitchen. +Jacuzzi for two in the room. +Good bed. +Quiet. +Nice buffet breakfast - included. +Location - right next to the tourist attractions. No swimming pool:) - I guess you can not have everything for such low price. Very good value for the price ($105).

Reviews.Title: “Room upgrade... Free Drinks.... Amazing food... Fantastic Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Easy_eddy_85
Reviews.Content: Went there for two nights. Was impressed to have two complimentary drinks per guest per night... in addition to receiving a free upgrade to a presidential suite. Plenty of space for the two of us... Great bathtub (With Jets)... 10 min walk to everywhere in old Montreal! Great romantic spot... Will stay again!!! Oh... and staff were very friendly and able to give directions to some great location attractions

Reviews.Title: “Wow wow wow! AMAZING HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: leemoreau
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and I've stayed in a lot. My friend and I won a contest and stayed at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth for 2 nights and then I extended my stay and stayed here another couple nights. Before going, I expected the Fairmont would be mind blowing and ritzy, but it was a big disappointment, very average and the rooms were $410 a night. I used my Hhonors points to stay here and I was blown away. The lobby is really nice and modern but the room is what was so good. I booked a suite with a king bed, that's all I chose. When I got to the room, it was a corner suite first of all that was probably twice the size of my condo. It was a 2 bedroom suite with a queen bed in the other, massive bathroom, and down the hall a huge living area with giant kitchen with fridge, stove microwave and dishwasher. It had a fireplace, a huge table with seating for 6 people and other couches and chairs. I couldn't believe how nice it was. You could honestly have 5+ people comfortably stay in this place it was that big. I kept forgetting there even was bedrooms as I'd be in the living room mostly and the rooms were down the hall. The room comes with 2 free alcoholic drink tickets plus breakfast buffet. Location is great, it's right across the street from Place D'Armes metro and you can even walk to Eaton Centre without stepping outside from there as well as most other places downtown too. I highly recommend this hotel definitely at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lexcyn1
Reviews.Content: While on vacation in Montreal last week I stayed at Embassy Suites in downtown Montreal. Conveniently located, this hotel has a no nonsense facade and common areas but boasts comfortable and compact suites with well used space. We stayed on the sixth floor near the elevator, usually not a great location for a room but we didn't notice any elevator noise at all. Entering the suite, a large closet with iron and board were to the right. The bathroom had a huge whirlpool tub, vanity with shelves and storage space, a granite dressing table and a shower. The bathroom opened into the entry foyer as well as the bedroom. The kitchen had a built in microwave, more than adequate cabinet space, large fridge/freezer, coffee maker, sink and dishwasher, though we couldn't get the dishwasher door open. Two comfortable bar chairs provided seating for meals at the granite counter top.There were also numerous garbage cans, though all very small so it was tough to fit anything into them, and a recycle bin. The work desk was spacious and in the corner of the living room near the window with free high speed internet. Both the living room and bedroom had TVs and the bedroom had a closet with shelves, two nightstands with drawers and a small chest with three more drawers. The king bed was comfy and the bedroom could be closed off for privacy via pocket doors. We were thrilled to find the windows were functional and enjoyed fresh air on warm nights. The hotel offers free breakfast with made to order omeletes and a buffet and a manager's reception each evening with two free drinks per guest and snacks. The hotel also served full meals in the same dining area and offered room service. Staff at reception were very friendly and helpful as was housekeeping. Major attractions like the Notre Dame Basillica was a two minute walk and old Montreal and the port were all within a very easy 10 minute stroll as well as many restaurants, coffee shops and bistros. Underground parking is also available at a fee. The only downside to my stay was construction in the alley between the hotel and the next building so there was early morning noise from trucks and construction crews. Also, one curiosity was the hotel's choice to install a very small Euro style shower in the corner of the bathroom. There was room for a larger stall as the bathroom was huge. Luckily the shower looked brand new and spotlessly clean but my long arms kept banging into the somewhat claustrophobic glass walls. The entire suite and lobby was fresh and clean and overall, this hotel provided a great experience. I would recommend Embassy Suites Montreal for business colleagues, friends, couples and solo travelers on an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: KKSStLouis
Reviews.Content: We had a king suite which was huge, with a refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave etc. As usual it was very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was great. It was also within a few easy blocks of Old Montreal and the metro, it is also fairly well located. Some downsides: it is not an atrium hotel like many Embassy Suites and the lobby area is fairly small and dark in decor--not particularly welcoming; the rooms on the south side (mine among them) look into offices across a courtyard perhaps 50-60 feet away; there is no drive in entrance visible from St Antoine (you turn just before the hotel into what looks like an alley, which takes you around back). All in all though, this is a good value in a good location in Montreal. While it lacks some of the warmth and features of other Embassy Suites, the large rooms make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are more like a small appartment”
Reviews.Author: HJFHJS
Reviews.Content: Not your typical Embassy Suites, no inside courtyard. And rooms are more like a small appartment. Breakfast and reception each day although both appeared to be a bit short on staff. On the edge of Old Montreal..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: WendyM58
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night, at the end of August for a business trip. I was very impressed with the suite - everything looked brand new and beautiful, especially all the fixtures and fittings in the kitchen and bathroom. The front desk seemed a little disorganized, there was only one person there most of the time and the waits were long. I arrived fairly late in the evening and just wanted to relax, so ordered room service, and it was great. The location was perfect for my morning meeting, and thanks to express check-out, that was a breeze. All in all, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Embassy Suites Montreal, September 2010, and 2011. I was in town for a triathlon. All races are held on ÃŽLE NOTRE-DAME, the beautiful man-made island in the St-Lawrence River created for Montreal's EXPO 67'. The magnificent facilities of the OLYMPIC BASIN were the site of the Olympic rowing events during the 1976 Olympic Games. The hotel had a great location about 4 miles from the race site and Montreal Casino. Check-in: Flawless, the bi-lingual staff are eager to help, knowledgeable, and friendly. Each night of your stay comes with two free drink coupons for the managers reception, and a breakfast pass. Room was ready as promised, stayed on the 8th floor. My room was a king-size bed, pull out couch, desk area, front closet, with a large tub and shower, full refrigerator, micowave, and plenty of cabinet space. Parking: They have there own, which is under the hotel. Parking is $25.00 USD including taxes. This is the going parking rate. Like most Montreal garages, it's tight, be aware of the parking posts as you pull in. Elevators on each level will take you to the lobby and upper floors. You do have to swipe your hotel room key, to gain access to the upper floors, this is a security measure. 24 hours access to your car and the garage. Location: The hotel is located on: Embassy Suites MontrÃ©al 208 Saint Antoine Ouest MontrÃ©al, QuÃ©bec H2Y 0A6 Local Phone: 1-514-288-8886 A busy street, but with great acess to the convention center (across the street) and Metro (public transportation). Inside the convention center are multiple shops and food options. You can gain easy access to the major highway, by taking a right out of the hotel garage, traveling 3 blocks and enter Rt. 720, on your left, this will bring you to Rt. 10 the major route thru Montreal. The hotel is located on the edge of "Old Montreal", an easy walk, highlights include the Notre-Dame Basilica ( a must see) quaint shops and restaurants. St. Patricks Basilica. St Catherine St./McGill University, would be a hefty walk, better to take the Metro, or taxi. Manager's Reception and Breakfast: Both are included with your stay, they take place in the lobby of the hotel. You are issued two drinks coupons for the manger's reception, and a pass for the buffett type of breakfast, both are well run. The weekend breakfast can be crowded but the staff does its best to clear the tables, as other guests leave. Conclusion: You can't beat the location and value of this property, I plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Big room,Nice Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night with reward points. We arrived early and were able to get into our room. The woman at the front desk was very friendly. Our room was huge. We had a corner room with lots of windows. I wondered if the hotel was originally supposed to be apartments.The managers reception was crowded, but it was a Friday night and it was free. This hotel seems to be popular with familys probably because the rooms are so large. Breakfast the next morning was less crowded. The food was good, nothing great, although I didn't have the made to order omelet.The convention center is right across the street. There are a few fast food type restaurants there. Overall this is a nice hotel with nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: vipod
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here at the end of a longish family vacation - and what a wonderful way it was to end a vacation. The hotel is about 3 years old and has held up very well. The rooms were just gorgeous, the service impeccable, and the location is great (close to Old Montreal and just a block from the Metro). It certainly isn't quaint, so if that is what you're after there are better choices in Old Montreal itself. But if you want a hotel with all the amenities, built-in kitchen, and all the bells and whistles, you can't go wrong. Clearly better, in my view, than either the Intercontinental or the Westin, its neighbours and competitors. Not cheap by any means, but you gets what you pays for (in the best sense!).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice rooms, chaotic bar/breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DCBiztraveler
Reviews.Content: A great location in old Montreal. Very nice, large, comfortable, well-appointed rooms. Extremely helpful concierge. The complimentary breakfast and tea seem like a nice idea, but in August these were quite a mob scene. It was somewhat difficult to get a seat (or coffee) and so chaotic as to be unpleasant. There were a lot of kids here when we stayed and it's a good place for families with one exception--no pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for convention center business”
Reviews.Author: texastech
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites Montreal is directly across the street from the Palais de Congress, which is the big convention center in Centre Ville. The location can't be beat, and it is also a short walk to the old town area. The room is nice and has lots of updates. However, the carpet was quite stained and worn. The bathroom was a bit odd in that the bathtub was ridiculously large and the separate shower was tiny. The complementary breakfast was fine and the evening reception was standard Embassy Suites fare. All in all, this is a fine choice for a Centre Ville hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: jwilson1897
Reviews.Content: Great stay: huge jacuzzi bath tub, full kitchen, free full breakfast, 2 free drinks per adult at Happy Hour!!!! Right in the heart of the city and steps from Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: citygalSTL
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this place! The hotel was reasonably priced and it was awesome that the Happy Hour, hot breakfast and internet service was free. Everyone was extremely friendly, especially Mario--our Happy Hour waiter. The rooms were very clean. I also liked that it was really close to Old Montreal and a subway station. I would recommend this to everyone and I'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel service is awful and their front desk is so rude.”
Reviews.Author: Reza_Omrani
Reviews.Content: I staid at this hotel for a family reunion. I expected much better service for the price I paid for this hotel. Their service is so bad and their crew are so rude. They even refused to clean the room in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nay22
Reviews.Content: Suites are spacious and just what we needed travelling with a child. She slept on the pull out couch in the living area so it was great to be able to close off the bedroom door and watch TV. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on and the kitchen area was very handy for eating snacks or take-out food. I'd say all the other appliances were almost too nice (huge fridge, dishwasher, microwave, granite countertops) given there isn't a stove. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast each morning and went to the evening reception a few times as well. It was an excellent place to have a drink before heading out to dinner. The hotel is in a fantastic location close to everything...Chinatown, rue St Catherine, Old Montreal, subway, etc. The Wifi signal was very poor and sometimes cut out completely. The bathroom was huge and had a nice vanity area but the potlight was right above the head so it wasn't much use for putting on make-up, etc. Everything was nice and clean but the carpet had some pretty bad stains. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly very nice”
Reviews.Author: MauiBear
Reviews.Content: I've never been an Embassy fan but the rest of my group stayed here so we fell in line. We were VERY surprised. First of all, the service at check in was great. Our room wasn't ready as we were early, so they stored the bags and then gave us excellent information as to what to do in the meantime. The concierge was very helpful and friendly. They give you 2 drink coupons/person and free hors d'oeurves in the evening so that was very convenient. They also were able to recommend a very nice restaurant nearby. The hotel seems to be in a business area and yet the old town is just a few blocks away. You'll feel like you stepped into Paris. The room was HUGE with an almost complete kitchen, living room and VERY large bathroom. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: toobusytoday
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location to visit all of Montreal. We were only up for two nights and just one full day. We were able to easily use public transportation to get to Mount Royal but it was also a very pleasant walk into Old town. We were upgraded to the Presidential Suite and it was amazing. Full kitchen including a dishwasher, huge main room that included a two sofas, a dining room table and a fireplace. This was a corner room so it also had views on two sides. The staff was very helpful, especially Chris the concierge and the Managers reception person. Coupons were handed out but not really needed. Avoid the eggs on the buffet table and ask for them to be made by the person who cooks the omelets.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fabulous room”
Reviews.Author: TravelingRetireeNC
Reviews.Content: The location of the Embassy Suites in downtown Montreal is great. It's within easy walking distance of the ND Cathedral, Old Town and Chinatown. The underground station is right accross the street which gives you easy access to most of Montreal. A daily bicycle rental station and dedicated bicycle lane are literally right in front of the hotel. The lobby of the Embassy Suites was dark and nothing special, but check-in was very fast and efficient. They had everything ready for us, our Hilton Honors room upgrade, activated room keys, breakfast and drink vouchers, and a parking garage pass (self parking $$). The whole check-in took about a minute! This positive first impression of the staff held true throughout our stay as we found all of the hotel's staff to be efficient, helpful and friendly. Our upgraded corner room was bright and fabulous! It was huge, with two fireplaces, a full kitchen, a dining area, work station, and a living/sitting room. The bathroom had both a separate shower and jetted tub. Both the bedroom and living room had large flat screen TV's above the fireplaces. The suite was beautifully decorated and sparkling clean. Our stay in Embassy Suites Montreal was wonderful and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: gmjj
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at Embassy Suites Montreal, the rooms were spacious and clean and the service was impeccable. We booked three nights with different awards and had to change our keys everyday; the staff had our new keys for us every morning without us even asking. The concierge staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Bobby, the concierge supervisor and Mike, the concierge, had great suggestions for restaurants and attractions within walking distance from the hotel. They even managed to secure a table for 10 at L'Original for us. The location of the hotel is perfect for families and couples who want to have easy access to the waterfront and old Montreal. We could not decide whether we should stay at Hilton Garden Inn at Sherbrook or Embassy Suites, and we're glad that we chose Embassy suites. It is located in a very charming location. There are lots of restaurants, unique shops and landmarks within walking distance around the hotel. Only negative was the weak Wi-Fi signal. We did not have good reception in our room on the 11th floor, but the reception was much better at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: darknstormy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights mid-August and loved everything about it! From the complimentry 'happy hour' and breakfast, the spacious and comfortably appointed corner suite, friendly staff, and the location. A fifteen minute walk to St. Catherine Street and the Old City. We were pleasantly pleased at how great this hotel turned out to be. This hotel will be the only one I will stay at on my next visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Managers Reception and free cooked to order breakfast are awesome”
Reviews.Author: RiverEddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a bachelor party. Room was nice and big. And the daily manager's reception is great- basically a bunch of free drinks (with coupons) and daily free cooked to order breakfast is good when getting over your hangover. When paying for drinks at the bar it's a little pricey ($50 for six drinks) and parking is not free. Other than that, this was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Travelling with a family in Montreal? Look no farther.”
Reviews.Author: voegelin
Reviews.Content: I really can't recommend this hotel enough. Great service, a warm welcome eveytime you pass the front door. Huge, modern, well appointed room. In our case we had a full size fridge, micro, sink, etc. Beds so comfortable we couldn't extract ourselves from them. And the location is 3 blocks to Notre Dame. And, in our case, free hot breakfast for 4, and two free drinks per night, per adult at happy hour. Really, this is a top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Marianna2008Toronto
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, stayed in the one bedroom suite for 2 nights; we had a very good experience with this hotel! Great location: walking distance to the Old Montreal, Chinatown, convenient underground parking. The suite: large and clean living room with a sofa bed, a TV, and a kitchenette; the bedroom had a very comfortable king-size bed and a TV, Not a great view of a busy street, but we asked for a higher floor and were not bothered with a traffic noise. The bathroom: modern and clean, with separate shower and whirlpool tub. Complimentary breakfast and evening reception- each guest receives a coupon for 2 free drinks. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Bellow Average Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Tsubasa99
Reviews.Content: The upside : The hotel is in a prime location for old Montreal and the other entertainment areas. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. They helped to arrange a number of complex reservations for our group. The rooms were large and comfortable, however there was a very limited selection of "English" TV programming available. As with all Embassy Suites free drinks during the evening was nice, and they have outside seating so you can people watch. The downside : The lobby was in pretty sad shape. It felts run down and tired. Between the check in and the first floor lounge the area feels crowded and in need of renovations. Due to the constraints there was capacity issues in the lobby and elevators when a large group checked in, causing significant delays to access the rooms. The food quality during the morning buffet was relatively low quality. Also as space seems constrained the flow of the buffet is best described as anarchy. Its certainly much less than I would have expected for this brand and at this price point. Overall, if the price point was a bit lower it would have rated a bit higher. Resolving the lobby issues would be a big plus for this property.

Reviews.Title: “We Switched Hotels”
Reviews.Author: LajaVirginia
Reviews.Content: We're just home from a 5 night family trip to Montreal. We arrived at the hotel at 3pm (check in time) and our room wasn't ready. They said it would be at least an hour before our room was ready. We spoke to a manager, who offered us drinks at the bar while we waited. Everyone we dealt with was very nice and apologetic. We had a 2 bedroom suite, which was huge, and included a full kitchen. ( We wished that the second bedroom had 2 twin beds rather than one queen, so our son and daughter could have shared to the room. But, there's room in the living room on the couch to sleep.) We were told that the 2 bedroom suites are only on lower floors. Ours was on the third floor. We didn't realize it until we went to bed, but the street noise was extremely excessive to us, and we couldn't sleep. I will say, that we're sensitive to noise at night as we live in a very quiet area. In the morning, we went to the front desk and asked if there were any room configurations that might work for us on a higher floor. The woman at the desk was very helpful and nice, and took us up to see a room on the 5th floor. Unfortunately, the noise level was about the same. Ultimately, we decided we couldn't stay there, and switched to a hotel up the street. They must have much thicker windows, because there was no street noise. The staff at the Embassy Suites were all very nice, and tried to be helpful. If you're sensitive to noise, however, stay elsewhere. If you're not, this is a good choice. It's a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Old Montreal, not fabulous, but easy”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl830
Reviews.Content: We travel to Montreal frequently as our son is a student at McGill. We have stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn and Omni Mont Royal on Sherbrooke, and both have been fine, but we found the Embassy Suites has been a good choice as we can park the car, then walk to Old Montreal for the rest of the stay - the rooms have been fine - no view, but modern and clean, and the breakfast allows us to do things at our own pace - the made to order omelets, etc are very good - you just need to figure out the system.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was filthy, beware of this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: robin_ru
Reviews.Content: Our small family checked into a 1 bedroom suite at 4pm on a Saturday night. The room was not yet ready, so we waited. Within a few minutes we were told to go up. The room, although large, and somewhat newly furnished, was so filthy that I was gagging as I walked on the carpet. The problem was with the carpet and tile surfaces. The carpet had been so stained and spilled-upon, that apparently even carpet cleaners cannot clean it. Looks to me like it should just be ripped out. Needless to say, no one would want to walk on it in bare feet. The kitchen and bath tile surfaces had not been mopped since the previous occupant, whiich was disturbing. There were two light bulbs out in crutial light fixtures. The bedroom reading light was more of an "ambiance" light, with not nearly enough light to read in bed. In addition, the toilet seat was barely hanging on by a thread, apparently some screws needed to be tightened. I called the front desk, and they agreed to send someone to "freshen up" the room. That person used a dirty mop and swiped a bit at the kitchen floor and by no means gave it a good cleaning. Then he took a small carpet cleaner and ran one or two passes over the worst stains in front of the TV area. In taking the carpet machine back out he managed to leave black tracks all across the some-what clean kitchen floor. In disgust, I finally went down to the front desk to talk to the manager. She was very agreeable, offering us some compensation via parking fees, and hopes to move us into a cleaner room tomorrow. I have trouble believing that there is a clean room in this hotel, but I remain optomistic that tomorrow night will find us in a less disgusting environment. I willl update tripadvisor with results when they happen. Note that these rooms seem to have no drawer-type storage. It's all hanging storage.One of the two bathroom doors does not lock. Also note that, despite having a nice kitchenette, there is no utensils/serving ware. Apparently one can ask for them if needed.

Reviews.Title: “You will love the suite”
Reviews.Author: KdotRdot
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the one bedroom suite and the amenities were the best we have ever seen and we travel a lot. The breakfast included although a little crowded. The staff was friendly and the hotel was well maintained. The location is very central and close to tourist attractions. The room had a fire place, a huge bathroom with a Jacuzzi bathtub, a kitchenette with a full size fridge, a microwave and a sink. For a family, it had everything a hotel could offer. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding location and service”
Reviews.Author: stltravellers
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Embassy Suites and enjoyed it very much. The location was perfect- near the "Old Town", China Town, and Subway. We had a minor issue with our air conditioning, and had a maintinance person in our room within five minutes of calling the desk. The breakfast is nice with all the fresh fruit, but make sure you get downstairs before 8:00 if you don't enjoy a crowd. Of course the happy hour was lovely, and the restaurant had al fresco dining which we enjoyed morning and afternoon. We ended up coming back to our room late one evening without having had a chance to get supper, so we were served some nice burger/chicken in the dining room, which we really appreciated. The front desk and concierge services were exceptional-they greeted us every time we entered the building and were very helpful answering our various questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: oscart77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 2 nights in early July using Hilton Honors reward points. The large king suite was well appointed with more room than we expected or needed.
