Everything was clean and well maintained, even though the hotel obviously has a lot of traffic. We seldom had to wait for an elevator and had easy access to our car in the garage anytime. Mike, the conceirge, was very helpful any time a problem arose. We attended the cocktail reception only once but received a very generous pour of Jack Daniels. Very surprising for such a large hotel. Breakfast was held in the same area and was always crowded but well organized. Made to order omelettes were offered to everyone interested. The hotel is in a very good location, only a block from Notre Dame and Old Montreal. We also took a walking tour of central Montreal up to McGill University, back down Crescent and to the hotel one afternoon. Great city. Mont Royal and the Plateau were only a 10 minute drive away. We didn't use the public transportation system. We really enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites because of the staff, large and comfortable suites, and convenient location. We will most certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: sdstingray
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located directly across the street from the convention center Palais de Congres. The rooms are very large and clean. I loved having the hot tub in the room and the kitchen is a plus. The complimentary breakfast each morning was delicious and the nightly managerâ€™s reception was an extra treat! We miss you already, Mario! It is an easy walk to Old Montreal were you can find numerous restaurants or for something quick the convention center has a few little cafes inside. My husband and I rented bikes to tour the city. The Embassy Suites was a great value for the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Should be better!”
Reviews.Author: souza63
Reviews.Content: I reserve a suite with kitchen to my family. Plates and cutlery was not in the room, I need to ask. When I try to use the dishwasher it's loked. I ask why and they said me that is the regular procedure. I ask all 3 day about the dishwasher and it continue loked, maybe until now (15 days before). Every day they remove the plates, cutlery, etc, but don't put a new one clean, so I need to ask again every day. Why I'll rent a room with kitchen and dishwasher if I can't use it ? I ask 3 times to change a bulb at the room and nothing, maybe continue not working. Usually I went to Marriott Residence Inn and I never had this kind of problem, this time (and last time) I try this Hotel but I not happy with it. The only good thing to say is that the girl at reception (with short hair cut, sorry I don't remember the name) is very educated and try to solve the problems, but the others services don't work very well for me. (p.s. sorry for my english, my first language is portuguese).

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: wander78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Embassy Suites for our first wedding anniversary. The hotel was very modern and clean. I loved the idea of staying in a suite but didn't think it had a "romantic" feel. It seemed more like a business hotel. Two great perks are the free breakfast and evening reception. We didn't get to the reception( each guest gets tickets for free cocktails), I did pass by one evening and it looked a little chaotic. The hotel is a great location to see sites in the area. The subway is nearby and we walked to the Old Port and Notre Dame Cathedral. There are several food options in area from different price ranges.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: rtar
Reviews.Content: All good things to say about this hotel only. From check-in to check-out we had a wonderful stay. Location was fantastic as you could walk easily to Old Montreal, get on the metro system or be at the conference centre in five minutes. The hotel faces the back of the conference centre so there is easy access into the building and to the metro. The breakfast was lovely and had everything you would need from cooked to order eggs , fruit, cereal, etc. The dining area is nice and bright and looks out on to the street. Also the free drinks were a great bonus (2 per peson per night). You can sit at the outdoor patio and even take your drink to your room if you have to. The hotel is surrounded by buildings so there is not a great view but the rooms are lovely. Good size with the kitchenette. Yes, you will have to ask for cutlery if you plan to eat in a lot. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would not hesitate to stay here again. A very good value and just down the road from other more expensive hotels which do not include the breakfast or drinks. Try the Steak & Frites restaurant just up the road with excellent steak and unlimited fries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: miko789
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night on our way back home. The hotel is in a central location . Across is the Palais de Congress and is at the entrance of Old Montreal. It is also a 3 minute walk to Chinatown. Service was fine although it could be improve so that they can be more attentive. They provide you with two tickets for drinks in the afternoon upon arrival. There are also some appies to go with it. This was chaos as during the busy season (like this time around) it was filled with people and there was a line up in the bar and the appetizer section. Breakfast buffet is serve and not to be miss is the omelet cook according to your wish. Food consist of scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, fruits, yogurt, cereal, oatmeal, coffee, juices, bacon, sausage, hash browns, bread. We stayed on the 9th floor and the room is very clean , spacious and well designed and bed and sofa bed is very comfortable. There is a sort of a kitchen (no stove though). You cannot manually control the airconditioning and thus the room was a little bit warm. View wasn't great as we were facing a building that is being demolish. Parking cost $25 (incl tax) and parking space is tight. There's of course a business center and fitness center. Service is fine although they could do more by being more attentive to customers. Overall, a good stay although we find it a little bit pricey for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: monte94
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location; itâ€™s within walking distance of Chinatown, the Notre Dame Basilica, Old Montreal, Place Jacques-Cartier, etc. and only a couple of blocks from the Metro, so you can easily get to any place else that you want to go. The rooms are wonderful; full kitchen, living room (with sofa bed and flat screen TV), a nice bedroom (with another flat screen TV) and an awesome bathroom; it was large with glass shower, plus a separate over-sized tub with jets â€¦ The bathroom was even accessible from both the bedroom and the kitchen. The hotel staff was exceptional; everyone was professional, helpful and spoke English. And housekeeping did a great job of keeping my room clean! Complimentary breakfast was offered every morning, along with complimentary drinks (two per person) and light snacks in the evenings. They also offered WI-FI, baggage storage and concierge services (including free maps of the city and the Metro system). The negatives â€¦ The sofa bed in the living room wasnâ€™t very comfortable (Thatâ€™s pretty normal though) and the breakfast buffet wasnâ€™t as good as Iâ€™ve had in other Embassy Suites â€¦ both very minor criticisms. I donâ€™t have any REAL complaints. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good!”
Reviews.Author: kekbaldw
Reviews.Content: A great hotel - especially when you consider that it is an Embassy Suites. Great location - right in old Montreal and near the Metro station. Breakfast was okay - nothing spectacular - your average hotel breakfast. It included happy hour cocktails, which was great! The room itself was beautiful - full kitchen, huge bathroom. But one thing struck me as odd - there is a dishwasher in the room, but it does not work or open. Almost like its fake. Room service provided us with hand soap to wash our dishes. Very odd. Look out for the parking lot though - VERY tight, and the lanes switch the the middle of the road. We don't have a very big car, and it was very easily the tightest space we've ever parked in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MAGM0m
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, steps away from Vieux Montreal but also close to Chinatown and the shopping district. The suite was very large and very clean. The bedroom was a bit cramped with two beds, and the thermostat seemed to be stuck on a temperature that was too warm, but those were the only negatives. The service in the hotel was wonderful from the breakfast staff to the concierge. The underground parking lot was a self-parking lot at 21.95 per 24 hours but reasonable compared to parking we have encountered in many large cities. There are also bike rentals right in front of the hotel - the city is very cyclist friendly. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Weezie01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found the staff to be friendly and helpful; a very comfortable mattress; bathroom, linens, etc were very fresh and clean. We were on the 9th floor and the windows open for fresh air, but the front of the building had a lot of traffic noise so we weren't able to sleep with them open. It's nice having a suite so you can close the BR pocket doors - there were TVs in LR and in the BR. The only complaint is that our rug had some black stains by the bed and the couch, but I didn't notice them until we'd unpacked, so we tried to ignore them; in hindsight, I should have asked for another room. Parking is $22 US per night under hotel with elevator up to lobby & rooms, which makes it easy to come & go no matter the weather, and we walked everywhere. The hotel is a short walk from Old Montreal, the Port, Notre Dame Basilica, Chinatown and more. Tips: If you plan to eat in your room, you'll need to bring dish soap & sponge and request utensils, napkins and dishes as soon as you arrive or when you make your reservation (the kitchen had a keurig-type coffeemaker, micro, fridge/freezer). Breakfast is included in your stay; there was a nice buffet of eggs, sausage, bacon, fresh fruits, cereals, yogurt, store-bought pastries. Be sure to take advantage of the omelet station, which is separate from the buffet area: you choose your fillings and hand them to the chef who prepares it fresh for you. We did not use room service, but the menu had a nice selection and was reasonably priced. Also, each guest receives a coupon for 2 free drinks at the bar every day between 5:30-7.

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful...”
Reviews.Author: Fallbrook
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous and generous place to stay in Montreal. The rooms are laid out like small condos, making it different from the normal Embassy Suites. It is modern, clean, and gorgeous, and steps away from most of the sites and restaurants in Old Montreal. We were particularly impressed with the concierge, and, indeed, all of the staff. They went out of their way to help us when my husband hurt his knee a few blocks from the hotel. A young staffer actually got a wheelchair and walked with me to rescue him and deliver him to the door of our room. Additionally, the wait staff in the food and bar area were generous to a fault. Free Internet! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel with a one star toilet”
Reviews.Author: sugovicm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites for four days and ended up using the toilet in the lobby every day! The reason: because maintenance and front desk staff were incompetent at handling our issue - a toilet that wouldn't flush, would clog up, and overflow without fail. We called the front desk multiple times a day, only to get a snippy agent that would hang up as soon as a complaint was uttered. Luckily, they'd send a maintenance guy with a plunger to do the dog-and-pony show, leaving us with a lingering bathroom disaster. Finally, on the last night, after serious complaints for days, a maintenance guy spent over an hour taking a toilet apart. Glad we watched that romantic ritual! No surprise - he failed to find any issues which meant we were finally offered a new room at the end of our stay. Too little too late! Best of all, they treated us like idiots and came up with excuses like "our sewage system is complex, hence why you are having issues." Really? Itâ€™s a toilet in 2011! Finally, upon checkout we asked for compensation. They offered us a generous 25% off OUR LAST NIGHTâ€™S STAY! My advice â€“ donâ€™t pay a penny for this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Not your Fathers Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: bobsyouruncle77
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a large number of Embassy Suite hotels and this is by far my favorite. This hotel doesnâ€™t have the standard configuration of most ES hotels where the rooms are around a large open atrium. The rooms aren't standard ES type rooms and feel more like a small condo with a granite kitchen bar and full sized refrigerator. If it had a stove it would be a complete kitchen. The bathroom is huge with a 6 ft Jacuzzi tub and separate shower. My room also had a fireplace which would be very nice in the winter. My only complaint about this hotel is the breakfast only starts at 7:30 am on the weekends rather than 7:00. I was here for business and used room service a couple times when I had to get work done in the evening and couldnâ€™t make it out for dinner. I was very impressed with how quickly (less than 10 minutes) the food arrived at my suite. By the way, try the mega burger with the goat cheese â€“ it tastes fantastic. Prices for room service were much more reasonable than many other hotels. The staff at the hotel was very friendly right from the front desk to the housekeeping. The location of the hotel is great as well. It is just a short walk to old Montreal for sightseeing and close to the Metro and right across the street from the congress center. I can highly recommend this hotel when you need to stay in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tdl119
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights on business at this hotel. The rooms are large with separate bedrooms, sitting rooms and kitchenette (microwave, refrigerator/freezer, sink). The bathroom has a separate walk-in shower and jetted tub. My only complaint about the room is that the A/C labored (loudly) trying to cool the room down to 75 degrees. A buffet breakfast is included. I would rate the food as "fair". Do not get eggs from the buffet, as they will cook them to order for you if you ask. There is a "happy hour" from 5:30-7:30 each afternoon, which includes 2 free drinks and minimal snacks (chips and salsa, veggies and dip). They are not many restaurants really close to the hotel. However, Old Montreal (Rue St. Paul) is an easy walk (less than a half mile). There are numerous restaurants and shops there.

Reviews.Title: “good overall”
Reviews.Author: NadChicago
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The suites are very nice: very spacious , nice kitchen, great huge bathroom with a big Jacuzzi and a separate shower. Everything seems to have been remodeled recently. I loved the fireplace , the two TV's ( one in the bedroom and one in the living room). just a wonderful space! The hotel location is ideal, very close to Old Montreal and few blocks from the Shopping district. The breakfast buffet was very good and offered a lot of variety . The only thing that was a disapointment was the Fitness Room. both treadmills did not work properly and the other equipment was in need of replacement. We mentioned the treadmill problem to the staff first day we got there but nothing was done . Overall still a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: USALoveTraveling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this facility with our 20 year old son. He appreciated the divided bedroom that provided him with some privacy in the evening (he slept in the living room on the fold out couch). The bathroom was spacious. The only criticism was that the kitchen did not have any equipment (dishes, pots, pans). So, if you plan to use the kitchen for more than keeping you soda cold and popping microwave popcorn, this is an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: spinard
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a few different hotels all around Montreal and this one is by far my favorite. The room was great! Very clean with a kitchen and a comfortable bed. The hotel looked to be either brand new or completely renovated because it was beautiful! I really liked staying in the old Montreal part of town. I prefer this area over the St. Catherine street area which I have always stayed in the past. Breakfast was very crowded, but good. The drinks at night were free and good as well. Some minor complaints are that our view from our window was a not very appealing ally behind the building and that our bed was a queen, they wanted about $75 to upgrade to a king. Our bathroom was tiny and after a shower became a sauna with all the steam. Overall this is a great place to stay in Montreal and will be the first place we check in the city for future reservations!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a friends weekend. Easy choice for a Montreal Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bana6969
Reviews.Content: Large suites with more than enough room for four people. Pull out couch was fine and the bathroom was very large. Hotel provided 2 drink tickets a night per person. Easily equates to roughly $25 value a night in drinks. (Tips would be extra if you wish.) Great location right beside old Montreal and the subway. No complaints...clean and friendly staff. This one is a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: goonybones
Reviews.Content: Everything was as expected from an Embassy Suites hotel. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, and the service was friendly. They also were very accomodating to the extra people in our room, which was very nice of them.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY UNREAL!”
Reviews.Author: BigWesNASTY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel back in May 2010 when I went to a Montreal Canadiens playoff game.â€¨ The hotel was unreal! There was tons of room, huge bed, Jacuzzi tub, two flat screen TV's, couches and a kitchen (with counter, fridge, freezer, sinks, etc.). The only complaint I would have would have to be the shower - It was very small and it wasn't very easy to move around. â€¨ Other than that - The hotel staff was very friendly; they provided vouchers for free drinks at the bar and two vouchers for a free breakfast. Another bonus to this hotel is that it is in a great location - Was only about a 10 minute walk from the Bell Centre and it is situated right in Old Montreal.â€¨ Overall - This hotel was absolutely unreal! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody who is planning to stay in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Great place Central location”
Reviews.Author: NanEdKirkland
Reviews.Content: We took a wonderful trip with our granddaughters. A perfect hotel to start our jouney. The suite was spacious and the staff was helpful. The girls (11 and 9) were disappointed that there was no pool, but the spa tub was a great substitute. We all enjoyed the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: MrsTBHB
Reviews.Content: Location was great for a couple experiencing Montreal for the first time. Close to Notre Dame, the Old Port, shops & restaurants. For what we spend, having the complimentary full breakfast buffet (from 6:30 am - 9:30 am) was a bonus since there's a wide selection of food. The only thing we'd suggest is that they extend the time for the breakfast til 10 am. Also the complimentary manager reception was a great addition which is actually two free beverage per guest per night and vegetables & dip between 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm. The room had a kitchenette with a fridge (good to store drinks & food), a microwave & a dishwasher. Yes, there is no stove. Parking was extra for $21.90 per day but it's come & go as you want. If you're interested in seeing the city or going around by bike, there's a BIXI (Public Bike System) station right in front of the hotel. Check out their website (https://montreal.bixi.com/) for fees.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious suite”
Reviews.Author: JGinWI
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites for 4 nights and was very impressed. The suite was large and comfortable, and included a kitchenette and whirlpool. The location is even better: the hotel is across the street from the Palais des Congres, a couple of blocks from the Old Port area, and a couple of blocks from the metro. Unlike most Embassy Suites, there's no center atrium and so no loud noise echoing through the hotel all day. The concierge was helpful and friendly, and found a bar/restaurant for us that was showing the NCAA tournament games (not easy on a night that a Canadians hockey game was being shown).

Reviews.Title: “Wow - I'm impressed”
Reviews.Author: SukiJamma
Reviews.Content: When we walked in and saw how small the lobby is we were a little concerned but the rooms were awesome! Great beds, lots of space, a kitchen, and relatively quiet for being in a big city. The managers reception was more then generous and the staff were extremely helpful We compared our stay with other people staying at hotels around town and we seemed to be the happiest with our accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: canadiantravellady
Reviews.Content: Great Stay at the Embassy Suites! Comfortable clean room with very convenient location across from the Convention Centre. The only problems I had were the TV just randomly turning on at 5am - two mornings in a row (so I unplugged it from the wall). I tried to see if an alarm was set but everything seemed normal - was very strange. My other problem was that I was staying for 7 nights and for the first few days they kept changing the shower soap everyday after one use. WASTEFUL! I asked them to stop and they did so promptly. I just wonder why change it daily at all? Who needs a fresh soap daily and if you do ask for it. Anyway - nothing wrong with the hotel/room just something that bothered me. The room itself was very well maintained - furnishings are in good shape, the full kitchen is fantastic as was the giant bathroom. Room service food was adequate. As always the big perk is the complimentary breakfast and evening reception.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovestotravelSK
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for our honeymoon and let the staff know this when we checked in, nothing was done or offered by the staff even though other reviews indicated they had been upgraded and received baskets and robes in their room. We booked this hotel because we thought it had a complete kitchenette, note that does NOT include a stove or anything to cook with. If you would like anything for the kitchenette you have to call guest services to have dishes sent up, but you can't get a toaster or anything to make any sort of hot meal. There is a microwave, dishwasher? and fridge included but ended up being useless. Everything in our room was faulty, the doors didn't stay closed because the room appeared to be on a slant, the chair at the desk didn't go up and down, the shower head in the bathroom was leaking and because it could be used as a handheld constantly tipped forward so you had to hold it in order to shower. We had a view of the garbage bins behind the hotel and our room was right next to the elevators where we had to listen to drunk Canadians fans come and go all night. One highlight is the breakfast is the best complimentary breakfast I have had with lots of options but listen to other travellers and get there early or face them running out of things. The location is also quite convenient for sightseeing and getting around on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: cocodesbois
Reviews.Content: This is a amazing Hotel ,all hotel rooms should be like the one in this great hotel. I travel alot and could not believe the quality of service, confort, breakfast and everything finally. All i can add is Bravo a 300.00 a night plus hotel but at half the price!

Reviews.Title: “NICE STAY”
Reviews.Author: Snufflenox
Reviews.Content: Positive: Clean and spacious room, good buffet beaskfat in the morning (included in price), hotel looked fully booked and NO noise heard in room, about 100m to MÃ©tro Place d'Arme, Congress Center and foodcourts, about 2 min walk to get into Old MontrÃ©al and 10 min walk to the Old Port. Negative: Gym is only Ok, no pool

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: kayehm
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights over the Canadian Family Day weekend. We had a spacious King suite with Kitchen and Jacuzzi tub. We attended "manager's reception" each night and received two free drinks per person, per night. The drinks were definitely generous, guessing each was close to a double. The included breakfast is plentiful, but can get very crowded on weekends. Come early (during the first hour) to avoid the crowds and food shortages during the last half hour of service. Staff were very friendly and service was great. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappointed"”
Reviews.Author: salayna
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of this hotel and I am still just as impressed with it now as I was two years ago when I did my first review. This hotel has now become the getaway spot for my husband and I when we just need a short break from the kids. The staff from management, to cleaning staff, to wait staff are always accommodating and friendly. The rooms are always so well maintained and they are always prepared to go that extra mile to make you feel welcome. Two days ago on our visit there I had to call room service at 4:00 am to get sugar and more blankets (awoke with a cold) and they were so very obiliging. I truly cannot say enough about this wonderful little haven and the people that make it what it is.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: bmobanker
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites Montreal has been my home away from home for 3 years. All staff are friendly and fun to deal with!! Service and accommodations are exceptional. Andrea and Denny at the front desk always make my stay memorable. I know all of my colleagues agree. The hotel is ideally located between St. Catherine shopping /Chinatown Districts and the Old Port of Montreal. Walking distance to the Bell Centre for Habs Games, Ultimate Fighting and Concerts. Fabulous restaurants abound. Convention Centre and Metro/subway access across the street. It's got everything!!! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place for business stay”
Reviews.Author: Ronley01
Reviews.Content: My work brings me to Montreal about twice a year and colleagues have recommended this hotel. It is conveniently located with a 10 minute walk to work and a slightly longer walk to the old port area of Montreal for all the post meeting activities. The main shopping area of Montreal is also within walking distance (if you don't mind a return trip of 20-30 minutes). A metro station is right across the street for the longer trips. The first time, my stay was upgraded to the suites, which basically is a large four room suite with one of the larges bathrooms I had in my travels. This time, I had the regular room. Not as spacious as the suites, but still comfortably large. The rooms certainly cater for all my business travelling needs; a good bed, good bathroom and workspace with internet facilities. Specific highlights of this hotel for me are: the inclusive buffet breakfast with eggs cooked to order and a large choice in cereals, fruit and bread and the happy hour between business hours and dinnertime. People serving in the restaurant area in both cases are very friendly and helpful. Certainly happy hour is a nice way of relaxing and continuing the business meeting in a more relaxed environment. Staff at the reception are very friendly and helpful in solving all your questions, either hotel or the city of Montreal related. Only minor negative issue is that during both my visits there were some problems with one of the elevators, which could make the waiting time to go down or get up a bit long.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay to enjoy Montreal”
Reviews.Author: GTOttawa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and enjoyed it immensely both times. We stayed in suites which were roomy, well appointed and immaculately clean. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room includes free cocktails and munchies in the early evening, which we found were delivered by staff who seemed to really want everyone to have a good time. Also included is a buffet breakfast which is not spectacular, but good quality and quite satisfactory. The location is fantastic, on the edge of Old Montreal, across from the Palais des congres, an easy walk to Place des Arts, and a slightly longer but do-able walk to the main shopping areas, museums and landmarks. And within easy walking distance of many excellent restaurants in Old Montreal. We found it overall very quiet, but on our second visit we were facing the Palais des congres and unfortunately had to deal with the noise of forklifts moving crates down the sidewalk in the middle of the night. However, this is likely an unusual occurrence. Overall we found this hotel an excellent place to stay, and very good value if you go, as we did, on a weekend in the slow season.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but don't be fooled by waiters! Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Cupcakekb
Reviews.Content: Our hotel was amazing, perfect hotel, perfect area ( right by old Montreal and downtown) but the service was horrible! The head desk was amazing but the waiters totally ripped us off for over 100 dollars! When they send out the bill you have to write your info so it charges to your room. We didn't know this and signed but also paid cash! Why wouldn't they tell us this? It happened twice and now we had to pay double for our two dinners ... Horrible waiters , def just took the money as a very large tip

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...small glitches”
Reviews.Author: TravelingKat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites hotel on New Year's eve, and it was booked to capacity. The room was excellent as is the location. It was a non-suite, but had a kitchen space with a full fridge (empty) and microwave. We just needed glasses, and there were not very many available, but we made due with the paper cups and bathroom glasses. The bed was comfortable, and the decor was nice. The view was terrible, but we weren't there for a view. Bathroom was well stocked- nothing fancy, but toiletries were available, and the space was clean. The hair dryer was a full size- not the usual dinky ones that hang from the walls and make more noise than blow air. The alarm clock didn't work, but they came and fixed it the moment we called to complain. Within 5 minutes the problem was fixed, which was impressive considering they were booked to capacity. The elevators were slow- there were only 2 and at capacity, it was a long wait to get one with space. Breakfast was included in the package, but ended at 10:30 am. I thought that was really early for New Year's morning. I can't comment- I didn't make it in time. I requested late check-out, but my request was not accommodated. Parking was a little steep. All in all, it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Room was great , clean modern! Didnt want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Bal97
Reviews.Content: we had a 2 room suite that was excellent in every way , decor , Size, and location. it had a sofa bed as well as 2 beds it was ideal for us and Id stay here again happily

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, mix of service”
Reviews.Author: enjoytravelling_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two different times in November. I can't fault the room, ideal having separate bedroom and sofa bed in living room travelling with friends. Bathroom is large and good amenities. You ask for paper plates, etc. if required for kitchen. I had room with fireplace each visit and nice touch. My problem was the inconsitency of staff. At one of my check in the staff, although young, were professional in their manner. The other check in the two girls on reception were unprofessional in their manner. Trying to get someone to assist with luggage on arrival was non-existent. The night duty manager assisted us on one of our departures and was very helpful. We arrived one of our visits about 10:30pm and the restaraunt was about to close but we were able to get a snack and the girl working in the bar was very good with service. I left a necklace on my last visit and housekeeping were wonderful in returning it to me via mail. The hotel rooms are fine, it was the hit and miss of service that was annoying and for this reason I would not return. Certainly staff not up to the professional standard of other Hilton hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable suites with jacuzzi bath”
Reviews.Author: Travellinggirl2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times before and the reason that I go back is because you get a nice roomy suite with a big bathroom and jacuzzi bath. If you pay for a custom suite you also get a fireplace, which is great if you're there during the winter months, as Montreal can be exceptionally cold. Be warned though, parking is self-park only which is about $22.00 per day and the car lot is very narrow so if you have a large car you will need to be prepared for some tricky maneuvering. Breakfast is included in the room rate, but it can be a bit of a bun-fight, and it could be improved. You get a buffet but it is limited, and there is no service, so you just help yourself. The suite also comes with a kitchenette, but there are no dishes so it is a complete waste. Internet seems fast and efficient, and there is also turndown service at night, where they will refresh the bathroom for you. Overall - very good and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, really good price”
Reviews.Author: DanusBoy
Reviews.Content: In my observation, hotels in Canada tend to be a little worse than their american counterparts but this hotel was way better than its counterpart in US. Very nice and upscale hotel, good breakfast buffet and nice rooms. The rooms are suite style and very tastefully designed and decorated. If I am going to Montreal again, I will probably stay here again. Staff was very helpful too. Walking distance to Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: sens1992
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice stay at Emassy Suites Montreal. Fairly new building with large rooms and comfortable beds. The room was extra clean. Great location next to Old Montreal and the congress centre + interior acces to the underground city and metro accross the street. I would not hesitate and book this property again when in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Terrific Staff”
Reviews.Author: Leefa
Reviews.Content: Our Suite was immaculate, spacious, and clean, while the bed was luxurious with great linens. The jacuzzi tub was clean and perfect at the end of a long day of walking. WHAT WAS MOST unexpected though, was the incredible unobtrusive friendliness of the staff - from check-in to the restaurant/happy hour/breakfast buffet staff, and even the Room Attendants when we stepped off the elevator. Great city to explore with a terrific "home" to return to, at the end of the day!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in montreal”
Reviews.Author: cmcp610
Reviews.Content: We chose the Embassy Suites due to the location and the price. We couldn't have asked for more! Location: Perfect. 2 blocks to walk to Old Town for great sight seeing. Lots of restaurants and other hotel bars nearby. Rooms: Impressive. The rooms are all suites, so you get a full but small kitchen. There is a HUGE bathroom with jetted tub and a seated area for makeup etc. Also a double couch living room with separate desk/workstation and a gas fireplace. The beds were comfortable and good quality linens etc. This is one of the few places where the photos online are actually representative of the "standard" room. Amenities: Great! There is a full buffet breakfast included for each day and it's well worth it. There is a basic "made to order" omelet station and also pastries, sausage, bacon and fruit/yogurt etc. Beyond continental but not a full "Sunday brunch". You ALSO get 2 drink tickets for each night you stay for the "managers/happy hour" daily from 5:30-7:30p. There are complimentary snacks (although very basic) the real deal is the bar is full and the pour is generous (except for beer which is draft in half glasses) . We met Mario the waiter when we asked him if he spoke Italian(and he did, so my hubby was very happy with that) What a great waiter, he gave us all the best places to see. Needless to say, considering the room price is less than the other 5* hotels nearby, it's great to have those little extras included! They did have free wifi in the lobby only. Overall: Highly recommended for All travelers. A hearty breakfast daily, friendly socializing included each night and the rooms really are incredibly comfortable and spacious. Service was always friendly and accommodating. Parking is about $21 a day in the underground. Not out of keeping with other major hotels. They do have a few spots by the back door and they let us keep our car there which was nice so when we would get back from our site seeing my husband would sit on the bench right outside to smoke a cigar. All in all, A GREAT HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb for business/conferences”
Reviews.Author: CrazyKath
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Palais des congrÃ¨s de MontrÃ©al (conference centre) and chose the Embassy Suites due to the location and the "middle of the road" price point. I couldn't have asked for more! Location: Perfect. Literally across the street from the conference centre and it's 2 blocks to walk to Old Town if you want to do some sight seeing. Lots of restaurants and other hotel bars nearby and you can easily walk to the main street (Catherine) in about 10minutes if weather permits Rooms: Impressive. The rooms are all "apartment" style so there is a full fridge, microwave etc but obviously no one uses them because there are no supplies haha! However it's great to throw a bottle of wine or some beer/snacks in the fridge for a midnight snack. There is a HUGE bathroom with jetted tub and a seated area for makeup etc. Also a double couch living room with separate desk/workstation and a gas fireplace. The beds were comfortable and good quality linens etc. This is one of the few places where the photos online are actually representative of the "standard" room. Amenities: Great! There is a full buffet breakfast included for each day and it's well worth it. There is a basic "made to order" omlette station and also pastries, sausage, bacon and fruit/yogurt etc. Beyond continental but not a full "Sunday brunch". You ALSO get 2 drink tickets for each night you stay for the "managers/happy hour" daily from 5:30-7:30p. There are complimentary snacks (although very basic) the real deal is the bar is full and the pour is generous (except for beer which is draft in half glasses). Needless to say, considering the room price is less than the other 5* hotels nearby, it's great to have those little extras included! I also used the fitness centre which is open 24hrs and has 2 treadmills, 2 ellipticals and some freeweights/total gym. Clean and bright and better than most hotel "fitness centres" Overall: Highly recommended for business travellers. A hearty breakfast daily, friendly socializing included each night and the rooms really are incredibly comfortable and spacious. Service was always friendly and accommodating. Con: Parking is about $21 a day in the underground. Not out of keeping with other major hotels, but just FYI

Reviews.Title: “Just Average But Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Steph2727
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in early October. When we arrived around 6pm we were told our twin room with 2 beds was not available but that we would be in a room with a King and a sofa. This was unacceptable. Dominique at the front desk seemed rather inexperienced. We left a message for the manager and went to the King room. It was terrible. The closets did not open and the sofa bed was rock hard. We had a 7:00 pm dinner reservation so we left hoping when we returned we could change rooms. Luckily when we got back they "found" a twin room with 2 beds. We had contemplated staying only one night and moving to the Westin or another place for the second night. The second room was better but the hotel itself was just average. I am not expecting a lot for an Embassy Suites but we were underwhelmed. Lots of people in the lobby drinking. I guess it was the free cocktails. We drink but that is not a draw for us. It kind of seemed like a party scene. Perhaps over the weekends the crowd is different. The beds were very comfortable but the view outside the window was of an office building where you could see papers and computers. The free wifi worked pretty well but it does work in the lobby. The location is perfect as we could walk to Old Montreal. I tried to find a pharmacy nearby you we had to walk about 20 minutes northwest. Hotel breakfast was good with fresh omelettes. Emilie, the hotel manager did apologize to our room problem the next day when I was outside trying to get a taxi. Overall I would chose another place for a future visit to Montreal. We stumpled upon Le Crystal Hotel when we were looking for a restaurant. It was beautiful and more our style. My main reason for booking the Embassy Suites was to acrue my yearly qualification of 4 separate hotel stays for my Hilton Honors Silver VIP. I still need 2 more stays before December 31. Overall our stay was ok but very average.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice service but room issues”
Reviews.Author: 77skidoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in ES Montreal for a vacation. The room was very clean and had a full refrigerator/freezer in it. However, the couch was very hard and the shower was very small! Bed was fairly comfortable but moved easily. Staff was very nice. Close to Notre Dame Cathedral - 3 blocks walking. Parking was kind of expensive. View from room was not good - side of another building. Breakfast was OK but not anything better than normal ES breakfast. Computers in business center were very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: tea_thyme
Reviews.Content: Completely enjoyed our stay in a large, luxurious suite in this well-located hotel. I was able to walk to everything of interest to a tourist in Montreal. The staff was exceptionally friendly. The free happy-hour drinks were a great surprise. The breakfast buffet wasn't the best ever but it was more than adequate. Best of all, my big, beautiful suite was SO comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is in an excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: Jmml37
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, around the corner to Notre domme church, walking distance to the water, and between two metro stations! The rooms were spacious, clean, and free wi fi in the lobby. My husband and I stayed 4 nights and we enjoyed it very much!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pre-cruise destination”
Reviews.Author: capomom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in Embassy Suites before and chose this one based on our previous experience. We were not disappointed! Although this Embassy Suites does not have the center atrium, it does have a complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast and nightly manager's special with drink vouchers. This hotel is in a wonderful location, a very short walk to Notre Dame Cathedral and surrounding places of interest. It is also possible to walk to the cruise ship. This section of Montreal was very interesting to see and learn about. As we were only here a day and a half, we didn't get to explore any further than we could walk. The hotel itself is very clean and the rooms -- I believe they are all suites -- very well appointed. Our only disappointment is that there is no in-room safe but a lock box is available at the front desk. We arrived here after a long travel day and were greeted by a very warm, friendly and knowledgable reception staff who were always happy to answer any questions or requests we had.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to Impress”
Reviews.Author: OnDemand
Reviews.Content: Have grown to like this hotel a lot and has become my destination of choice for Montreal travel. The hotel impressed me again today when I arrived at 8:45 AM to see if I could check my bag and they checked me in to a room - WOW! Also great is the included breakfast and Managers Reception offering 2 free drinks between 5:30 and 7:30 PM. If you like Suites hotels and good value, suggest you give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minneapolis_MNRocky
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of Embassy Suites over the years, and this was right up there. I would not recommend this hotel if you staying with kids. Our room was spacious, but not all that sound proof from bathroom, to bedroom to "TV room." Staff was gracious, rooms are clean and we were upgraded to a jacuzzi suite, which was fun. The location is handy for Vieux Montreal, but I think next time we would be inclined to stay closer to Mt. Royal. I found the Old Port itself a bit over rated (maybe due to the nonstop rain) and did not spend as much time there as I thought. The Metro is quite close and we were able to walk to the train station to catch a train to Quebec. All in all, a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, spacious base for visiting Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Loquita23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 5 nights in September, and enjoyed most aspects of it. The main reason we chose it was for the space. The room was very well appointed with extremely modern fittings. A few of the lights did not work for a start, but maintenance came to fix most of them. It was useful having the small kitchenette, but we found it weird that no cutlery or crockery were provided with it. On arrival, we had to ask for simple things such as spoons and saucers. When we asked reception why this was, they said they don't provide anything in the room and that you just have to ask for what you want. It worked fine, but we just expected that these simple items would be stocked in the kitchen. The bathroom was extremely large and well-lit, with ample mirrors (from experience this is useful when more than 1 person is trying to get ready!!). It had access from the bedroom, as well as the living room. There is a large jacuzzi in the bathroom, but we did not use it. There was also a self-service laundry in the basement, which was very useful. The lobby had a small business centre with 3 computers offering free internet and a printer. I was able to check my email but noticed that the hotel's server had blocked some sites like Facebook, which was kind of annoying. The internet speed was also pretty slow, but since it was free and I only used it for 10 min a day, it was bearable. The restaurant on site was very nice. Although on some days the breakfast was a complete shambles. Part of our stay coincided with the Labour Day long weekend, and on those days it was just like a mass feeding frenzy and really quite disgusting. LOTS of kids running around, food thrown on the floor etc. Not enough room to sit and lots of people ended up taking their trays up to their room. Once the weekend was over, it was noticeably quieter, however. In terms of the food itself, they offered the standard mini cereal boxes, toast, fruit, omlettes to order, fried eggs to order...one day the chef was able to do me poached eggs as well. The manager's reception from 5.30pm-7.30pm was a nice touch. The food normally consisted of corn chips, salsa and celery sticks, and certain beverages were also available for free. We also used the restaurant for dinner and found it to be nice most of the time. We did have one incident where the dish was not satisfactory and had to be sent back, but all in all, it was ok. Over the stay, I tried the salmon, chicken, steak and toasted sandwich. Huge serves, good quality in general, and good value for money. And it also stayed open til quite late, which was great when we arrived from the airport hungry at 10.30pm. The hotel's location is excellent. About a 5 min walk to the Old Town, and about 15 min or so to St Catherine street where the shops are. There is a convenience store inside the train station about 2 min down the street (you have to go into the conference centre, so it's a bit hard to find). We didn't try the metro, but it was also close by. The concierge in the lobby helped us arrange a half-day tour of the city and a full-day tour to Quebec City. If we did ever go back to Montreal, we would almost certainly stay at the Embassy Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: WildCommonwealthBoy
Reviews.Content: We love to come here 3 or 4 times a year. We used to stay at other hotels until we found the Embassy Suites. This is a great hotel with a perfect location. The staff are excellent, front desk, conceirge , bar, all super...

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotels in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: RiverSwim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Embassy Suites Montreal for two nights to compete in a Triathlon. The check-in experience was quick and the front desk attendant was friendly and helpful with directions etc. The room looked modern and clean in our two room King Suite with a Jacuzzi & fireplace. The kitchen area was a nice touch with the fridge and microwave. You will need cutlery. The included breakfast Buffet had a nice selection, terrific coffee, including a cook to order omlet stattion. Two complimentary drinks each, per evening brought people together & added to the already friendly atmosphere. Location is ideal with only a five min walk to Old Montreal or Chinatown & a 10min drive to the Casino. The only negative to the weekend was the parking fees of $25 per night (incl taxes). We will go back to this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: frosty1231
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the embassy suites in Montreal in early September. We were traveling with our 20 month old toddler and had no problems with the rooms or the service. Dominique at the front desk was very helpful and a great employee at Embassy suites. In fact all the other employees were always trying hard to please you and make our stay as smooth as possible. The only thing we would have liked to have is a stove in our suite so that we could prepare the baby meals easily. The microwave and the large fridge are a huge plus when traveling with a baby. There are great restaurants around the hotel within walking distance in the old Montreal. The best way to explore the old Montreal area is to rent one of the BIXI bikes (the stand is right in front of the hotel) for approx $5/hour and ride it along the streets of old Montreal. The breakfast is a huge plus. On weekends, it can get really busy and they should try to come up with a way to manage the make to order line better. But the staff is working hard and I could see that they were going on full steam. The only disappointing part of our stay was the room service. Please dont order from the room service menu. The nachos we ordered were worst nachos I have had in my life. Overall, we had a great stay at Embassy suites and would highly recommend it if you are traveling with family/children.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, with great location”
Reviews.Author: googoo4
Reviews.Content: We arrived around noon on Sunday and the receptionist said our room would be ready in about an hour and suggested a nearby restaurant for lunch. Posted Checkin is 3PM, When we came back our suite was ready. It was a large corner suite with many windows. We were very positively impressed. Each Evening the manager offers a reception with each of us getting two complimentary drinks and vegs and dip and tortillas and salsa. We also received complimentary full breakfasts for our two day stay. In addition,, the concierge was helpful and always available. The Location was within walking distance of several shopping areas, museums and other attractions. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nk416
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel and was perfect for us! It was easy to get to Old montreal but it was far from Crescent St. not a big deal tho. The room had a mini kitchen in it and the bathroom was pretty big. The only complaint I do have is that the shower was way too small, the bed wasn't has comfortable and they charged 25$ a day for parking other than that everything else was perfect. The breakfast was good and the free cocktails were great perks! Enjoy your stay here the front desk does everything they can to make sure you are happy with your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for our family”
Reviews.Author: barnhok
Reviews.Content: We are a family with two teens, a 17 yr old girl and a 14 yr old boy. Our family needs 3 different beds, at least one of which must be a queen or king (my husband and I don't fit in a double!). Montreal did not have a lot of options that would accommodate us in one room, but the Embassy Suites offered good-sized rooms with a King & sofabed and a rollaway could be ordered for an additional cost. There was a kitchen area with a nice frig, dishwasher, etc... but no dishes/utensils/pans, etc so it was somewhat useless. The unit was quite upscale with granite counters, nice bathroom fixtures, etc.. It appeared to have been built for another purpose: perhaps a longer-stay hotel or a an apt building. The kitchen area was really just wasted space, since there was no way to use the appliances unless we brought our own dishes. The King bed was separated from the rest of the unit with sliding doors, so it offered a "private bedroom", which was nice so we could use both TVs. The room was quiet, even with a full hotel. The breakfast offered a full range of items, some better than others. My primary complaint is that on the weekends, it was chaotic, with long lines for the grill blocking the other items and things ran out regularly (butter, coffee, OJ, steam table items). On the weekdays, the atmosphere was calmer and more orderly. They appeared to offer the same items every day, but there were so many choices, it was okay. I loved the small croissants! In the evening, the hotel had a cocktail hour with 1 drink coupon per person per day provided at check-in. Everyday the snacks offered were tortilla chips/salsa; pretzels, and veggies with ranch. It wa susually busy and the bar also was open to the public. There was a business center which was nice since there was not free wifi in the rooms. No pool. The lobby had very little sitting space other than the bar/cafe but was attractive and modern. The hotel location was great for us...across the street from the convention center, just blocks away from the Catherdral and old town and very near City Hall and Chinatown. It was pretty convenient to take the metro but we also walked a lot of places. We enjoyed our first trip to Montreal and would stay at Embassy Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel, Friendly staff, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Raybeam76
Reviews.Content: The suites are spacious. Nice televisions, comfy beds and furniture. Rooms had a fridge with freezer and microwave (no stove). Concierges were all very knowledgable and took the time to map out your route. Would have been nice if the front desk staff had some knowledge. Dominique did have the knowledge of a concierge and was extremely helpful to my wife and I. Hotel is on the edge of Old City. Easy walk to all Old City sites and waterfront. Metro Station across the street. Hotel provides you with breakfast. (eggs are powder) but you can get an omelet, bacon, sausage, fruit etc. They also have a happy hour where you get 2 drinks per person per day.. We really liked the suite. It did rain for one night and one day of our stay. So we did spend some time in the room. The staff who worked the dining area during breakfast and happy hour were amazing. They worked so hard. Amber was incredibly friendly. Housekeeping staff was excellent. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “POOR HOTEL MANAGEMENT”
Reviews.Author: voyageuradvior
Reviews.Content: How many things can go wrong with one hotel stay? Apparently A LOT!!! I am a long time member of the Hilton Honors. This is by far my worst experience!!! Upon checking in, I asked for HH Diamond member amenities, the staff said it is in the room. I did not quite understand what that implies, but I was too tired to further investigate and just wanted to get to the room and rest. Then I realized they made a mistake with my reservation. The excuse I got was that they have trouble accommodating to HH Diamond members. How is this acceptable? The front desk manager said I should have called the HH Diamond line 24 hours ahead to request the type of room I reserved online two weeks prior. This is a first!! How was I supposed to know that THIS hotel has trouble accommodating to my reservation ahead of time? After being on the phone for over half an hour, he finally accommodated and gave me what I have asked for in the first place. THIS hotel throws in a complimentary breakfast for all guests which is a nice touch, but the restaurant was terribly under-staffed. Tables were unclean, dishes were piling up everywhere and utensils were dirty. Needless to say the eating experience was quite pleasant. The night prior to leaving town, I called reception to request a late check out. The evening staff rudely told me to call back the next day because it cannot be done. This, in my mind, is someone who either does not want to be bothered or is not properly trained to do his job. To top it off, my invoice came back with over $50 additional charges. I was not the only guest with billing issues as there were a few people I saw with corrected bills in their hands. When I requested the front desk to amend it, it took a long time to finally get it resolved. During this time, I looked around and it became clear to me that all the problems I encountered throughout my stay at THIS hotel were attributed to extremely poor hotel management. This is quite sad because its location and prices are one of the best in town. I would NOT believe that this type of hotel management is meeting Hilton's world renowned reputation. It deserves some investigation and definitely improvement all around. To be fair, I would return to THIS Embassy Suites if I hear of significant improvements. Otherwise there are many hotels in the area, particularly the Intercontinental and the Westin that are of the same value.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated-”
Reviews.Author: travel_i_adore
Reviews.Content: I am rather disappointed with this property. I've stayed at a few Embassy Suites in different cities but this property disappoints for very many reasons. I primarily chose this property because of positive reviews on TripAdvisor plus the breakfast that is inclusive with the rate. I compared with Le Westin (which is next door to Embassy Suites). Breakfast --- DISORGANIZED! Food were set-up all over the place plus there were flies all-over! It was rather disgusting (there was also a fly in my hotel room, by the way!). Like I said, I've stayed at other Embassy Suites in other cities but this property has the the least organized set-up and least selection of food. Room --- It was "clean" but again, there was a fly in my bedroom! Where it came from, I do not know. The maid took my towels but did not replenish the stock. My room overlooked the backyard where I overlooked a huge garbage dump. Elevator --- Only two elevators available for a hotel full of guests. Not to mention that it was slow. Restaurant --- Mirrors their breakfast.... not a place for foodies to enjoy. Location --- This is a plus factor as it is across the street from a Metro stop - Place d'Armes. A skip hop and a jump away to Notre Dame Basilica, Old Montreal and China Town. Manager's Reception - Great plus as you are given two coupons for a beverage of choice plus a few nibbles to enjoy. Overall, this is a family friendly place due to the size of rooms, amenities in the room (ie kitchenette, fridge, microwave). I would not recommend to single-travelers or couples who are on a romantic get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons of the Embassy Suites Montreal”
Reviews.Author: DLO1975
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Embassy Suites in Montreal. It is very highly rate on Tripadvisor, and although we generally enjoyed our stay my wife and I think the Embassy Suites is a bit overrated. I'm going to break this review into sections, as I believe that will be easier to follow and may be more helpful to others. Location: The location is decent, not great (as others have stated). It's a moderate walk (about 15 minutes) to the main area of Vieux Montreal (Old Montreal) on Rue Saint Paul and a long walk (25+ minutes) to the main area of downtown towards Rue Saint Catherine and Rue Crescent. If you are looking for a hotel close to View Montreal (which is the area we preferred in Montreal), the Saint Sulpice is probably your best bet. If you are looking for a hotel near downtown, look to the Loews. I should note hear that the Embassy Suites is located on the same street as the Westin and InterContinental....and fairly close to the W. The Embassy is better located and less expensive than those three in our opinion. Front Desk/Concierge: The staff at the Embassy Suites were outstanding. One of the concierge (Frederik?) was particularly helpful. While we're not 100% sure of his name, he definitely resembles Hugh Grant in terms of appearance. All the staff were friendly, helpful, and efficient. Breakfast/Cocktail Hour/Room Service: The breakfast was complimentary, but was less well organized than other Embassy Suites we have stayed at. There was an omelette station, bacon, sausage, and some croissants, but there were no pastries, pancakes, or other items we're used to seeing at an Embassy Suites (at least the two days we went down for breakfast). I should also note that during the week breakfast ends at 9:30AM, which is early for some people that are on vacation. The cocktail hour was nice and the service was good. You get two drink coupons a day, but many guests that are departing will offer you more. The service was good. Room Service was fast and the food was decent; however the menu is a bit limited. There's no stand alone restaurant at the property, which would have been nice a couple of the days for lunch. Rooms: We were first placed in a corner King instead of a Custom King (which we had reserved). The staff were completely up front about this and said to come down if we were not satisfied and they would place us in a custom king. We did end up switching to the custom King, as it was much nicer and roomier in our opinion. Our room was on the 3rd floor facing the street. Please do yourself a favor and do not accept a room facing the street; definitely not on on the first five or six floors. The traffic outside was very loud at times and would often wake us. Yes, we could have moved our room. But we had already unpacked everything and didn't want to go through the hassle...which was a mistake. The Embassy Suites could certainly invest in some thicker glass, which would definitely improve its guests experience. The custom king itself looks exactly as pictured on the website. It's a nice room, but for almost $200/night (including all the taxes and fees) we expected it to be a bit more taken care of. There were stains on the carpet and some of the furniture is starting to look a bit worn. The bathroom was also large, but the shower is tiny and the water pressure is not great. Parking: The fee is about $24/night + tax and the garage is very tight and difficult to navigate in. I'd recommend parking elsewhere. Overall: It's a mixed review for us. Probably a solid B if we were giving it a grade. I would have no problems recommending the Embassy Suites if the rate is under $200; and would note the actual location and the traffic issues. However, we would probably stay in Old Montreal at the Le Saint-Sulpice or another hotel if our travels take us to Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is infested with spiders...”
Reviews.Author: Bennyblanco111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is infested with spiders everywhere. I could not believe my eyes. Spiders the size of my fist!!! I was in the gym and a hugggeeee spider fell on my shoulder when I was on the bike and I fell of the bike. If you are a spider lover this is the place for you, if you're not, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Tinygoat
Reviews.Content: The suites are huge, the staff was great AND you get two free drinks every night (per person) at the Manager's Reception in the bar. Not to mention breakfast (real one with eggs, omlettes and bacon) is included in the price. Location-wise it is a few blocks from shopping and the main heart of Montreal, but it is close to a metro line, and it is in Old Montreal. All-in-all, I would live in this hotel if I could. It was modern, friendly and a great deal. Only downfall are the SLOW elevators. There are only two, and everyone waits forever for them.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: LenaCecilia
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my husband while he was doing business. The suite was very spacious and had a jacuzzi in the bathroom. I appreciated the contemporary design. Breakfast was very yummy (made-to-order omelettes) although the line got pretty long at times. Free drinks in the afternoon were a bonus! Having a kitchenette (fridge, microwave, dishwasher) was good but there weren't any glasses, silverware or plates. (We did "borrow" some stuff from the restaurant however... maybe we could have gotten glasses etc if we had asked though). Extremely comfy bed and sheets! The hotel has a great location for sightseeing in Old Montreal or shopping on Ste Catherine Street, and is right across the road from the conference center. Despite being downtown, it really did not get too loud at night as it was a few blocks away from the party streets. There seemed to be a bix mix in terms of clients - business people , families with kids, and young adults.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: DomTor
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel for two nights and nice and roomy queen bed suite. The room was really big, with large kitchen and living room area and awesome bathroom. Nice Jacuzzi bath tub and very nice shower with good shower head - so it was nice to relax after a long busy day. There were two tv and a fireplace. It is ideal for a larger group or family - it will make a very comfortable and pleasant stay. Nice touch was the evening reception - were you could have 2 drinks and some snacks. The location was also very good - very close to the old part of MontrÃ©al and walking distance to most of the MontrÃ©al attractions. The buffet breakfast was also very good with large selection of food. Drop me a note if you have any questions. Thx

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Viajero-Colombiano
Reviews.Content: Suites are excellent with a modern and warm decoration. Also have small kitchen and jacuzzi. Perfect for all kind of plans. Breakfast buffett is also abundant and managerÂ´s reception in the afternoon is perfect for relax. You can stay in the tables on the street talking in a very nice landscape. All staff is kind and warm. Finally location is fantastic. And of course, Montreal is a very beatiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Very large, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: BrettWheeler
Reviews.Content: The two-room suites at Embassy Suites are always nice, but the rooms at the Montreal hotel are larger than average, and ours even had a fireplace. The bathroom was very large, and the living room was very inviting. The hotel is within walking distance of most of Montreal's sights.

Reviews.Title: “All good.”
Reviews.Author: 29cents
Reviews.Content: Location, staff, services, room comfort, food and again LOCATION made this stay a wonderful one. We try to choose Embassy Suites wherever we go and this hotel confirms that choice. (One annoyance, in the mid-hours of the morning, each day, the phone blinked a new message signal,a directive which was probably left over from a previous occupier. This was alarming but there were no messages. The front desk could not help to alleviate this problem. and the message menu on the phone was circular.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: Anna L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated between the old and new city centre. Room had a separate bed- and living room. Each room had a flatscreen TV. The living room also had a fire place and kitchen area. On request pans and plates are available if you want to cook yourself. The kitchen has a big fridge. Bathroom of our rooms was very spacious and included a shower and whirlpool. Breakfast was free in the morning. Very crowded though and with all the families with younger childern quite messy and noisy. Holiday season. Breakfast of very good quality and eggs of your choice fresh prepared. Managers drink at 5.30 pm. You recieve 2 coupons per person (only adults over 18) that allow you the order every drink you want free of charge. Also some vegetables and snacks to nibble. Staff is very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: Travelfor4orMore
Reviews.Content: A great hotel when travelling with the family. Super location, friendly efficient staff, comfortable rooms. The kids used the sofa bed and said it was fine. The king bed was very comfortable and the whirlpool bath was great. The room has a kitchen, no dishes- just ask- but no dishwasher detergent. The bathroom could use a couple of hooks for towerls by the shower and a makeup lit mirror. There is also a laundry in the parking level with 3 washers and 3 dryers (1.25) per load. Very handy if needed. The fitness centre was fine but no air conditioning - stuffy place in summer heat. We had one issue on the last night with a smoker on a no smoking floor but was quickly dealt with. If you wish to take in breakfast it is quite busy as the morning progresses but the staff will find you a place! The selection is fine. Upon packing up we noticed the inside of the sofa bed (where the bed folds into) had not been hoovered- cereal and beer bottle cap left behind - room for improvement note!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: 60PlusAdelaide_SA
Reviews.Content: A real gem in a very busy city. And the location is wonderful as it is on the edge of Old Montreal and can be easily accessed by public transport or driving. Well worth considering if visiting Montreal. Has full kitchen facilities within the room but ensure you stop off and collect some supplies before arrival as supermarket is a long way to walk! And no cutlery or crockery in the room - you need to ring Housekeeping to deliver it which is not a problem but unusual! I felt awkward having to do this on two occasions on one night when I forgot something in my first request! Must say that the chair furniture in the room is extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in late July with my boyfriend, just after visiting Ottawa. The hotel provides lots of underground parking, which is nice. The only downside is that it's $21.95 for it. After parking, we went to check in and the front desk girl was very friendly. Each guest gets 2 free drink coupons for the manager's reception every night. Breakfast is also included and it was HUGE! Lots of food, much more than a regular continental breakfast. The only issue I had was that it was SO, SO busy during both the manager's reception and breakfast. It was hard to find a seat, we had to take one as soon as we could! The location was unbeatable. It was within walking distance of Chinatown, Old Montreal, and the Port. The concierge was SO helpful, and knew everything about everything! The room was AMAZING! I had asked for a complimentary upgrade from a non-suite, and they gave me one to a one bedroom suite. It was absolutely gorgeous, and huge! Full sized stainless steel fridge, microwave, new modern coffee makers, stainless steel sink, jacuzzi bathtub (big enough for two people), pull out sofa bed, two TV's, and more! The bed was probably the comfiest I've stayed in. We were facing out onto the street, but could not hear any of the traffic. I can't comment on the price (if you've read any of my other reviews, I can never comment on the price) as I get extremely discounted rooms at all Hilton brand hotels. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “very user friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerrellP
Reviews.Content: Great location- convenient walk to old Montreal, Chinatown and main shopping area. Spacious modern, clean rooms with full kitchen and whirlpool bathtubs. Easy in/out parking garage below hotel. Hotel staff very accomodating. Choice of buffet breakfast or cooked to order breakfasts. Again, very user friendly hotel and will be our first choice in return trips to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Really glad we found this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: F1FanCanada
Reviews.Content: I would unreservedly recommend this hotel and its facilities. Both my husband and I have different requirements for medical reasons. We found the staff brilliant, helpful and willing to accommodate all our needs. Shopping is within walking distance which was particularly helpful from a food perspective for us. We stayed a week and would have loved to have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: a visitor from ireland
Reviews.Content: From start to finish our 2 night stay at this hotel was perfect. The location is great, everything of interest to us was within walking distance. Check-in was efficient, the reception staff were friendly and could not have been more helpful. The room was spacious, couldn't believe how big it was for the money we paid! Clean (and cleaned very well each day by housekeeping), bright and airy. The 2 free drinks each night were a nice touch and the bar area and outside tables were buzzing each night which gave a lovely athmosphere. Breakfast was tasty with lots of choice, a bit busy but everybody managed. We had room service one night and it was prompt, tasty and very good value. Top Marks Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “I WANT to love this place totally, but I need to be realistic!”
Reviews.Author: trishDerwood
Reviews.Content: How can you not want to love a hotel chain that gives you a free full breakfast and 2 free alcohol drinks every happy hour? Well, if my rating were just based on that I would give this well located Montreal hotel all 5's! However, I have to rate the room which in my recent hotel stay, brings those ratings back to normal. Our room was modestly large with separate sleeping quarters. Burned out Light bulbs and a broken lamp were all over our room. In addition, the first day of a 3 night stay the girl making up our room missed leaving at least 6 different fresh items in our bathroom. When I caught up to her in the hall to get the missing items she appeared overwhelmed. If you stay here, hope for the best, but expect the worst!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, ideal for extended stays”
Reviews.Author: msn58
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations, compared to other Embassy Suites I have stayed at. I stayed 5 nights, and I would say the best part was the suite -- really felt like I was renting an apartment rather than a hotel room. Its central urban location is ideal, directly across the street from the convention center, and on the northern edge of old town. It's really an easy and safe walk to most places you are likely to go in the central Montreal area. A metro station is one block away. Unlike most E Suites, there is no atrium here. The lobby is small and efficient, not lavish. This building used to be condos (I think) and so each room is really a small apartment, with a separate kitchen, living area, bedroom and bathroom. The bathroom is huge by hotel standards and mine included a large whirlpool tub plus a walk-in shower. There were two LCD TVs. My room on the back (south) side was very quiet, but it was off-street and the view was limited to the office building across the courtyard. A room on the north (street) side will be more scenic (and probably more expensive), but you'll likely get some street noise. Also should mention that I was visiting during a heat wave in early July, and the air conditioning worked great. My room was very comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful in the usual Canadian way (ie, more European than American), and I encountered no problems. There is the standard manager's reception and hot breakfast like at all E Suites; it's nothing spectacular but it is complimentary. It does get a little crazy in the lobby/dining area during those times so consider arriving early. Internet is $10/night in your room, but free in the lobby area, so you can easily check your email while enjoying a complimentary beer each evening and not have to pay for it in your room. There is parking underground, but presumably expensive. In short, you'll give up a bit of luxury (say compared to the Westin or Intercontinental, both just a block down the street) in exchange for a very comfortable and functional room. If you're seeking an opulent lobby or creative restaurant, this isn't the place. But if you are looking for a comfortable room to enjoy your evenings in, it will fit the bill well.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best choice for Montreal”
Reviews.Author: roadtripper747
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after a careful search through tripadvisor and other review resources, and are very happy that we did. Like similar situated hotels--and there are many--the location is hard to beat: a stone's throw from Vieux Montreal and the touristy Ste. Catherine street with its shops and underground malls, and if you like to explore a new city by walking, you can get to Mont Royal and the Latin quarter on foot. Access to the subway for more distant places such as the Biodome is within a block's walk. What makes this hotel a real stand-out is value for money--a great, friendly crew; free cooked-to-order breakfast plus evening drinks and nibbles (take a break from that frantic shopping and museum gawking, people, before freshening up for the jazz and nightlife!); spacious suites; clean bathrooms; and at a reasonable price for the location (weekend travelers may even get half-rates for Friday and Saturday). If you want to wake up in the middle of old town, this may not be the ideal place for you (look a few blocks away), but otherwise, this place is hard to beat. It would be nice if the hotel were to open up the stairwells to guests on the lower floors so as to lessen the wait for the elevators in the mornings, but this is a minor quibble re. an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! My husband and I would stay here again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: SunshineGirlPenelope
