Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from vacationing in Montreal. I'm a pretty picky person when it comes to hotel accomodations, so I used the previous reviews from this site to choose between three different hotels in Old Montreal. This hotel won out, and I must say that my husband and I were pleasantly surprised. The inside of the hotel has a modern feel and decor style to it. Our room was a nice size for the two of us, we stayed on the fourth floor, and though our view was only of the construction courtyard, the room got a lot of natural light and sunshine, which is always a plus. The bathroom was kind of small, but clean, which mattered the most to me. The kitchen area was nice, and featured a modern fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Though, as another reviewer stated, it could of used some cutlery and plates, especially for those times when you want to re-heat something you've brought back from one of the local restaurants. The room carpet could have used a cleaning. The customer service that we received from the entire staff was just wonderful! That is generally a very rare thing these days. Our stay was during a pretty hot and humid period, so it was nice being able to come back from long days out and about to a very nicely air condtioned room. Unfortunately, the hotel restaurant and lobby did not have the same type of cooling. The food at the hotel restaurant is great, and that surprised us as well., but hot evenings and lack of air did force us to eat elsewhere for dinner a couple of nights, and order room service (from the restaurant) on a another night. Upon check-in, you are given free coupons for free daily drinks and breakfast (the valid times are listed on the coupons). Overall, this hotel is a winner! We enjoyed our stay so much that we stayed an additional night, so that we could hang out and do a few more things around the city. Hope this review helps someone!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here in the summer”
Reviews.Author: brdennis
Reviews.Content: If the heat is on this is not the hotel you want to stay at. Arrived at 10:00 PM and the lobby was near 90 degrees. The air conditioning in the lobby/dining area simply can not keep up with high temperatures outdoors, especially if it is humid. When I expressed my concern to the general manager I was told by him that he knew that the air conditioning simply was not able to keep the hotel cool during heat waves. He went on to say that the building was not originally built as a hotel and that with the doors constantly opening and closing the air conditioning could not keep up. He said revolving doors had been approved to help with the situation, but had not been installed due to the high costs involved. They had dual doors, but the inner set was always open, which just served to exasperate the situation. Same heat wave, same day we had lunch and dinner respectively at the Westin and the Intercontinental which are next door, their lobbies and restaurants were cool. This hotel may be fine in the winter, but as to summer - stay away. To expect to be paid competitive rates to stay in a hotel were the heat makes leaving a necessity is wrong. Bruce Dennis

Reviews.Title: “We were thoroughly impressed”
Reviews.Author: glyster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively new. My husband and I came for the International Rotary convention along with 11 other Rotarian friends, Considering the price we paid and the product we received, this was the best deal of all. Not only were the suites spacious and well decorated, the free breakfast cooked to order and the free drinks they give us in the evening were like icing on our cake. The room comes with a huge jacuzzi tub, fireplace and kitchen. Some of our friends were staying in Westin next door or Hyatt, or at Nelligan Hotel, paid almost twice as much as us, but all they got was a room, not a two room suite and, of course no breaskfast and no free drinks. On top of all that, the staff was very helpful. The location is conveniently located along the orange line. Metro stop is only a couple of blocks away. It is within 3 minutes walk to the Basilica and 5+ minutes walk to old Town Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cowtownCalgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the 5 night minimum during F1. Enjoyed the Manager's drinks in the evening and the included breakfast. Didn't expect our room to be ready when we arrived before noon, but was. However, we didn't like the view from the 2nd floor into the central construction pit and asked for a different room. Desk couldn't promise anything but suggested we do come back in a couple of hours - which we did and got moved to 6th floor. View not much better; just higher. I do think the first room had a jetted tub, but couldn't be bothered to ask to change again. Location ideal for us as we used the metro directly across the street for going where we needed. Bought snacks at IGA couple blocks away; it is also metro accessible. Room contained full size fridge, microwave, kitchen area. Only negatives: no cutlery or plates etc provided in the kitchen. And, our particular room could have been cleaned more diligently (ie: use the vacuum). Please partition an area for cigar smokers separate from others who would also like to sit outside, even though it's not the law, it woud be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: seniorscots
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very enjoyable two week stay at the Embassy Suites in Montreal. We chose this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappoointed. The hotel, facilities and staff were excellent. There was a brilliant friendly atmosphere throughout and this added to the enjoyment of our holiday. If we return to Montreal we wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: AVR41
Reviews.Content: My visit to this hotel during my visit to Montreal was very comfortable. I felt like I was on a business trip. There was a incomplete renovation project in the building opposite our room so this was the total view (from our window (not good) . This hotel offered a social hour with drinks and orderves for the guess which I though was great. The room included a fireplace and free internet for the guess i was happy with that also.

Reviews.Title: “They Go the Extra Mile !”
Reviews.Author: cornish24
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three-day stay with my husband and son at the Embassy Suites in Montreal, which most definitely exceeded our expectations. Sometimes, a hotel's website paints a picture that is far from reality, leading to a disappointing experience. Not the Embassy, however. What they say you will get, you will get â€¦. and more! All the staff we encounteredâ€”in particular, the front desk staff and concierge--went out of their way to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The suite was clean and comfortable and included a kitchen with large fridge, microwave, and dishwasher. The living room had a fireplace and pull-out bed, which my son used. There was a separate bedroom and huge bathroom, accessible from both the bedroom and the living area, with shower and Jacuzzi. The breakfast was wonderful, offering a huge selection of cereals, yogurt, pastries, fruits, pancakes, bacon, sausages, and made-to-order eggs--something to suit every taste. Another bonus, as previously mentioned, was the nightly manager's reception that offered each guest nibbles (veggies and dips, tortillas and salsa, and pretzels) to accompany the two free drinks. Now, one might expect that because the drink was free, it would be small or somewhat diluted. Not so ... my red wine glass was filled to the brim, and there was no skimping on the liquor in hubby's mixed drink either. My only complaint (well, not really a complaint) was that I didn't sleep at all the first night (<nuit blanche>!) because of the traffic noise, which could be heard from our sixth floor room that faced the street. In all fairness, this was not the fault of the hotel, and I am a particularly light sleeper. I asked if another suite was available, and they would happily have moved us to another one had it not been for the fact that they were fully booked for the weekend. I understood that it wasn't possible but really appreciated their trying to accommodate my request and providing me with some ear plugs, which helped me to sleep well for the rest of our stay! Apart from that, the room was quiet with no discernible noise from other guests in the corridor, surprising given that we were right across from the elevator. The location is perfect, as has been said before, being so close to Vieux Montreal and in easy walking distance to the metro. I think the fact that the management takes the time to read and respond to most of the comments in these reviews speaks for itself. It reinforces the fact that they really care about their clients and go all out to ensure their comfort and satisfaction. Merci beaucoup! If you are planning a trip to Montreal, do yourself a favour and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “They should clone this hotel and put it in every city I do business in”
Reviews.Author: waygup
Reviews.Content: Once I pulled my car up after a stressful montreal drive, the helpful bellhop insisted on helping me with my bags. I told him I didn't need any help, but after I checked in it became plainly obvious that I had more baggage than I could handle. Without having to ask the staff noticed and Fredric came back to help. That was the first among many exceptional service experiences I had at this hotel. I would have appreciated the option of valet parking. The hotel parking was confusing and stressful. The hotel rate includes breakfast. It is not a continental muffin and bad OJ. Cooked to order omelette done quickly and professionally. Lots of fresh fruit. The hotel has a manager's reception. They put out a veggie tray and serve you a few free drinks. For what it must cost the hotel compared to the good buzz and active scene that happens in the lobby I can't understand why other hotels don't do the same. The staff stayed pro even though it was so busy for them. I've had worse bottle service! The rooms are amazing. Huge premium jacuzzi tub in the spacious washroom with a separate glass shower. The kitchenette needs to be stocked though for it to work for long term stays...can't be going down to the lobby or waiting for housekeeping every time you need a wine opener. Living areas are well decorated and trendy feeling. The one problem was the sewage smell evident in the hotel. If this is a known issue, as it is in a big city in the older section of town, someone who is particularly sensitive to smell would have a bad time there. The location was perfect for Old Montreal and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “4th stay this year---My new favourite in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: WildCommonwealthBoy
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay this month. Management and staff do a really good job. Rooms are very nice and comfortable beds. Location is perfect. I can't say anything negative, Very good once again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Highly Recommond It”
Reviews.Author: Illusion2005
Reviews.Content: Pro: 1. Location, Location, Location (Close to Old Town & Down Town) 2. Clean and Nicely Decorated. 3. Fridge, Microwave and Dishwasher included 4. Good Size Room 5. Comfortable Bed 6. Good Breakfast Variety 7. Helpful Staff All Over Con: None

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: yybgal
Reviews.Content: I have booked this property in the past for my co workers who travel to Montreal and I wanted to try it out for myself with my own family. It was more amazing than the reports I received from my colleagues! I had no idea how big the rooms were and the bathroom was huge! We (hubby and 17 year old daughter) had a suite with a separate bedroom for the adults, daughter on the pull out couch in the living room/kitchen area. This was a great set up as we had our privacy with sliding doors, our own TV and she had her own TV in the living room area. Not that you're in Montreal to watch TV but it was just nice to have our own space at the end of the day and unwind. You could seriously have a party in the bathroom and the jacuzzi tub was great after 2 days of walking! The location is great, so close to the old town and close enough to the downtown area too. Notre Dame is just around the corner. I liked that you could easily walk to the downtown area almost the entire way via the underground pathways! That is really cool, especially when it was raining. Just ask the concierge for directions. The room was spotless too. That is so important to us. I am so tired of going to hotels, only to be disappointed by a dirty room or those inconspicuous hairs (UGH!) you find hiding in bathrooms. I never felt like i was going to be surprised with something nasty on the toilet or under the sheets. We do a lot of travelling and I've seen some pretty gross things! Even the kitchen area was spotless, the fridge, cupboards and sink immaculate. Breakfast was included and it was good. There was something there for everyone, as far as our family is concerned. We had such a great time In Montreal and would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone! You won't be disappointed. And let my finish by saying it was soooo quiet for sleeping. Nothing worse than going to a noisy hotel when you're trying to relax and enjoy your vacation. Never heard a peep ever from the hallway/neighbours! It was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “The bathroom was bigger then my first apartment !”
Reviews.Author: Pink029
Reviews.Content: Great place quiet, great staff, the best breakfast ever and different every day, the pub is rockinâ€™ place to be. Staff go out of the way to be their for you. The bathroom was bigger then my first apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suite. Will stay next time in MTL.”
Reviews.Author: slipstatic77
Reviews.Content: Very spacious and well appointed room. We only spent one night, but this room would be appropriate for much longer stays. The bed was quite comfortable. The tub was huge, but the jets didn't work. Since we were only there for a night we didn't bother to ask for a new room. The manager's reception was a nice touch but seemed very hectic. Based on the reviews on this site we went to breakfast early and had no problems, in fact, it was delicious. The reception desk staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful, but you could sense the bar and kitchen staff felt overwhelemed at how busy it was. The parking garage has very tight corners, but we felt safe leaving the car in there. In this location, there is no need for a car anyway, so close to everything. Parking was $25 with in/out. Overall a very enjoyable hotel and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Amazing service great touches -STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Downroad
Reviews.Content: After scouring trip advisor to plan our last minute travel we chose embassey suites, I felt a lot of confidence with a quick look at the trip advisor ratings. We have a custom suite on the 9th floor, service is fantastic, location is great opposite metro and with a BIXI rack right out front. Managers reception in the afternoon is amazing and the room is HUGE. Pool sized jacuzzi and really comfortable soft sheets on the KING bed. Location is 2 blocks from the old town and metro is a short walk away. BIXI rack right outside for convinient travel all arounf Montreal. First class no regrets whatsoever

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: raobrien
Reviews.Content: We loved the location for walking to Old Montreal. Evening drinks and snacks were a bonus. Morning breakfast, while a bit of a confusion, offers wonderful choice and great cooked breakfast. Parking is clean and safe if a little scary on the sloping drive down and going up and out is even more exciting. Room was great with a full kitchen and huge fridge. Do not forget to ask for dishes and a pot would have been a nice addition. Very, very clean and comfortable. Like a mini apartment.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: tw0t0nes
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week-end in a custom suite, all was great, nice staff, nice big clean modern room, delicious cook to order breakfeast with all you can drink espresso, excellent free drinks in the evening prepared by Francis the barman, downtown location couldn't be better, we felt like home but with a luxury touch, go ahead and reserve you won't regret it

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and functional”
Reviews.Author: capegirardeau
Reviews.Content: Complimentary cooked to order breakfasts and evening drinks a nice bonus. Beds were excellent; pull-out couch not so much.

Reviews.Title: “I'd be pleased to live in this suite!”
Reviews.Author: Freyjas-star
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently chose Embassy Suites for a 3 night getaway to Montreal. I began my search, as I usually do, by looking at charming B&Bs, but this hotel seemed to provide a great value. It turned out to be even more wonderful than I had hoped. The suite was spotless, well-designed, stylish and comfortable. Every member of staff we interacted with was sincerely friendly and helpful. The breakfast and manager's receptions were well-done and added much extra value to our stay. And I thought the bed was especially comfy. The location was wonderful for Vieux Montreal, Chinatown and for access to the Metro and underground city. I'll definitely be attuned to the presence of Embassy Suites for future travels!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay in an almost Perfect Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: PCAN17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Embassy Suites in Montreal in August 2009. We were celebrating our 6 month anniversary, and I have to say this is one of the best hotel rooms we have ever stayed in. We had booked the 2 room suite, with a separate living room. Both rooms were large and tastefully decorated. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was amazing. The shower had a strong spray, which I like. The bathtub/jacuzzi was a delight after a long day walking in downtown and beautiful Old Montreal. The hotel is located ideally close to Old Montreal, and downtown is not too far off. We especially liked the made-to-order breakfast, which was delicious. Similarly, the evening reception was a great place to relax, have a couple of drinks/snacks, and meet fellow travellers. The only one downside to our stay was the contruction that was going on in the building next door. Consequently, the view outside the window wasn't the best, but it wasn't too much of a concern for us. Overall, we had a wonderful stay in Montreal thanks to the staff at Embassy Suites. We are planning to visit Montreal again at the end of this month, and will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: scientistmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Embassy over President's Day weekend for 3 nights. Having 2 teens and one tween, we generally book 2 suites. Both suites were terrific. We had a king suite and the kids had a 2-queen bed room, so the teenage girls took the bedroom and our son had the pullout sofa and living room to himself. The kitchens and bathrooms are great: kitchens have good size fridge, microwave and sink, bathrooms have showers (kind of small) but really nice jacuzzi tub. A really nice touch! We stay at Embassy Suites wherever we travel, in part for the breakfast and the manager's reception in the evening. With three growing teens, having the breakfast thrown in the mix saves a bundle of money. We were not disappointed here. Plenty of choices, from fresh fruit and yogurt, to made-to-order omelettes, eggs and pancakes, and yummy pastries. And all the bacon an 11 year old boy could eat. :) Do not miss the little croissants with chocolate! My only comment here was that there was no decaf coffee or decaf tea, but after all, you are in Montreal! Manager's reception was also nice, plenty of snacks and tasty cocktails. Location is all important as well. Our intention was to park the car on Friday when we got there and leave it in the parking garage until departure on Monday. You are a very short walk from Old Montreal, Notre Dame, Montreal Science Center, and Planetarium. Chinatown is also just a short walk away. Need to explore something further away? The metro station at Place' de Armes is just across the street--make sure to hop on it and zoom to the Underground City. Montreal's Metro is very fast! The concierge on duty that weekend was so very helpful, from guiding us to family friendly restaurants that had kid's food that picky eaters would eat, to directing us to where we might be able to look at some fur coats, to providing us with all the maps we could possibly need. Minor complaints: the parking garage is fairly difficult to find on Saint Antoine. Even my husband, who has travelled many times to Montreal, had to make several loops around until we finally found it, with all the one-way streets. Also, this particular weekend, the hotel was very packed (perhaps for Valentine's day) and one of the elevators was not working on two separate days, which created some congestion in the lobby. Overall, you can't miss at this Embassy Suites for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: pmac boston
Reviews.Content: What a find...walking distance to Old Port, Chinatown, and even downtown if you don't mind the excercise. The breakfast and afternoon/evening drinks are a great way to actually interact with people while on vacation - what a novel concept! The quality of the food was just fine, and the bartender Francis makes a mean Cosmo! He deserves praise for his efficiency, chatter and good humor... We had a room with a full kitchen, but nothing to eat on, drink from, or use to eat with...a bit odd, especially since there was a dishwasher included. My wife saw other rooms with fireplaces, and they seemed very nice. Next time... Overall, this is a great place to stay and use as your Montreal hub.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: sometimeadventurer
Reviews.Content: Having looked at the reviews and photos on TA decided to book and VERY pleased we did so. Great location (<10 mins to main station, old town, downtown). Good breakfast, lovely room (especially the jacuzzi!). Being modern, lacks the charm I expect is present in some Old Montreal hotels, but for comfort and function, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Value”
Reviews.Author: StrawberryPicking
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. We stayed here for New Years Eve and this was possibly the best one we have ever had. I usually am the person that will look around on hotel websites for the best deal and value. This hotel by far surpassed every other hotel for best value for the best price. This hotel is more so self-serve, meaning that you park your car, serve your own breakfast, and get your own luggage. Personally, my boyfriend and I kind of liked it, because it meant that we don't have to worry about tipping and waiting. The room was amazing, it was very trendy, clean, and spacious. The only wish I had was for the kitchenette to be a full kitchen. Also, the location was kind of out of the way, so in order to get into the city and shopping areas, you would more than likely have to drive. Since it was out of the way, we didn't really have the best view, but that's okay because the bed was amazing and I'm pretty sure I had thee best sleeps for a long time. Other than that, the staff was great and patient. The conceirge was perfect and was able to direct us to a restaurant named, Bijou Lounge, which is now our favourite Montreal restaurant. We can't wait to go back to Montreal, but we might try to go to a hotel that is closer to the downtown core and more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: KirafromWinterpeg
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister and I stayed at this hotel last week for a girls getaway and were not disappointed. The fact that the Embassy could accomodate 3 adults in one room was the reason we chose this hotel. The room was very spacious and allowed us our own space. The kitchen in the room is very impressive, although we didn't use it (who would with all the amazing dining in Montreal). The bathroom was probably the biggest I have seen in a hotel room, although, we found it difficult for 3 girls to get ready in the morning. They really should have an outlet by the make-up desk in the bathroom so two people can do their hair at the same time. Otherwise, we were very happy with the room and the comfy beds. The most value added bonus of our stay was the manager's reception. We each got 2 free drinks a night as well as chips, veggies and appetizers. We were under the impression that they would only give us wine and beer, but they will make basically any cocktail you ask for. We had cosmopolitan's a couple of the nights, which cost us about $12/martini at some of the restaurants we had eaten at. Definitely an excellent deal! Overall, we were very pleased with our stay and would return to this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Location, value, comfort”
Reviews.Author: gazell56
Reviews.Content: First stay in an Embassy Suites. Very nice room design, very comfortable, huge well appointed bathroom. Quiet even though on busy street. Great location for exploring Montreal. Parking under hotel, left our car and walked everywhere. Easy accessibility to restaurants and old Montreal. Staff friendly and very helpful. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “A WOW Hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: OttawaFans
Reviews.Content: We've had the pleasure of staying at the Embassy Suites Montreal several times in the last few years. It has always been impeccable in every aspect. This year, we decided to do our annual Family New Year Eve gathering at this hotel instead of our usual one in the Dorval area. We booked a presidential suite along with two custom one-bedroom suites and everyone in our party was impressed with the high quality of service, the excellent accommodations, the delighful manager's complimentary cocktail hours and the cook-to-order breakfast. Although the hotel appeared very full, every staff member that we dealt with was courteous & professional. This is what makes this hotel so special - the staff members are true Ambassadors!!! Special thanks to Mr. Desjardins from the Sales Department for handling various requests from us. Although I am a Platinium Starwood Members, this Hilton property gets my attention each time I stay in Montreal. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: NorthstarTravellers
Reviews.Content: We went up for a three day weekend and stayed at the Embassy Suites. Very nice and extremely helpful staff. The room was huge but had an odd layout (I would have used more space for the bedroom and less for the kitchen area; it's a tight squeeze to walk past one bed to get to the bathroom). We had one maintenance issue that was promptly repaired (the pocket door between the living area and the bedroom was off its track). Breakfast was nice, no problem getting a table on any day. Location is fine (2 blocks from Vieux Montreal). Good value and would recommend and stay again. Our first trip to Montreal and I can't wait to come back this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Where is my recognition? Aren't the French supposed to know how to cook?”
Reviews.Author: jdealman
Reviews.Content: I am an Hhonors Gold member. I was surprised when not welcomed with my water and newspaper. The rooms are nice and location good. The big gripe I have is the LOUSY breakfast! The chef needs to be sent to culinary school. Unlike every other Embassy Suites, the buffet line has all the omlette fixings out for customers. The chef takes them and mixes them in with his " prefab" omlette. He does not grill them first. This means you have raw onions etc in your "flat" omlette. Such a shame since I looked forward to the great French cooking!

Reviews.Title: “Best.Embassy.Experience”
Reviews.Author: jsmoove
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I just planned a one night stay in Montreal as a weekend getaway and we were not disappointed at all. Service was friendly, room was amazing, location was prime and close to everything that you would want to look to do and if not... ride a rental bike or take a cab, both which are right at the steps of the hotel. that's right... rent a bike! AWESOME! As for the hotel itself, beautiful lobby where we enjoyed complimentary drinks and hors d'oeuvres in the evening after a long day of walking the beautiful streets of Montreal and taking in some culture and complimentary breakfast after a great night in a gorgeous room. We contemplated a second night stay and take another day off from work :P But we didn't... we are going to make our way back again though. and stay longer. Thank you Embassy suites and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Merci for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: s0607427
Reviews.Content: Just returned for a four night stay at the Embassy Suites Montreal and had a very excellent stay. I was there with my girlfriend just to get away from home for our college break, and we enjoyed the complimentary manager's reception and the free breakfasts immensely. This hotel really is in the heart of everything Old Montreal, and if you're up for a walk you can get to the Sherbrooke/Ste-Catherine side of town in about 20 mins or so (longer if you'd like to follow the underground routes). Francis at the bar and Marc-Andre were especially helpful with our questions about the city, and they were both extremely gracious. The only complaint I have is that the maid service here was especially slow...we would go to breakfast around 830ish and we would see them begin to work, but we came back at 5pm to find that she would either be in our room or a few rooms away. Not a big deal though, we just went to the bar and grabbed a tea or soda.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at for all around experience”
Reviews.Author: jdat11
Reviews.Content: While I have stayed at some very nice hotels, The Embassy suites montreal was amazing. Normally I don't feel the need to write reviews, but after our 3 night stay we just returned from an hour ago, I feel that this hotel is worthy of a review The room was great as we were all able to fit, as it was a huge room, with a sofa bed. The breakfast was absolutely great, maybe the longest I had to wait was 3 minutes max. The staff through out the hotel did everything to accommodate. The evening managers reception was a nice touch, and Mario who was our server at the reception last night was probably the nicest and most helpful hotel employee I have ever encountered. He gave us some great restaurant tips, and was just a great guy to talk to. The concierge desk was really helpful in giving in giving directions. There is not one complaint from my whole stay. I will definitely return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: binaworldone
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicer places I've stayed in Canada. The hotel and their staff were very good to us, and worked around our schedule for cleaning. They were very accomodating about our pets as well, we brought our small dogs. The size of the rooms were decent, and they didn't have fake sheets! we were able to comfortably fit our family I didn't have an opportunity to use their bar/ eating area by the lobby, but it was absolutely beautiful. The location was great, we were able to walk most places, (also due to a spot of good weather) and there were cabs right outside the door for any other bit of travel. An overall great experience .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: GrisGrisNewYork
Reviews.Content: Great accomodations; the most beautiful room I have stayed at an embassy suites. The room feels like your own home. It didn't have the feel of a hotel room. The location was perfect right across from metro station and walking distance to china town and Saint Catherine St.-30 mins walk from hotel). I do agree with the other reviews regarding their breakfast service. on our last day, Sunday, it was not organized and the staff caters more to the local french and will remove tables make you move a couple time to accomodate them. If you want to avoid the crowd get up bright an early to eat your breakfast. The shower in the room was too small, they should expand them all the way to the wall that would be plenty of room. Also, they need to reapply caulk on the shower, our shower leaked on the floor and created a pool of water. Besides that we enjoyed our stay and would return to this hotel on our next visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: amanda78
Reviews.Content: Went to Montreal for a weekend getaway with my husband. Stayed at the Emabby Suites and was not disappointed. When we arrived we received a warm welcome and a quick check in. All staff are bilingual and will gladly speak to you either in English or French. In fact everyone we encountered in Montreal was completely bilingual and were happy to speak English. Truly the most friendliest people we have ever met. This hotel is centrally located and just a short walk to old Montreal or a go a few blocks in the other direction and you are in the heart of downtown shopping! The Hotel room was very clean and well maintained. Although the bedroom was a bit small the rest of the room was quite spacious and made up for it. We had a kitchen that was equipped with a fridge, microwave and lots of cupboard space. A large living room and huge bathroom with whirlpool tub. We never had trouble finding a parking spot in the underground spot that they will provide (for a fee) and you have in and out prvileges. The Manager's reception was held each night and oferred complimentary snacks and two complimentary drinks each night of your stay. We were also provided with a complimentary breakfast with a large spread of bacon, eggs, omlets -prepared on the spot for you, sausages, cereal, and your standard fruits and morning pastries. This hotel was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Gem”
Reviews.Author: salayna
Reviews.Content: Last fall while on a business trip to Montreal I stayed at the Embassy Suites and was pleasantly surprised with the outstanding quality of the room and the buffet breakfast. So, this year when it came time for my husband and I to decide where to go for our anniversary I suggested that we stay at the Embassy Suites in Montreal. A couple of hours drive from Ottawa and a nice getaway. His preference was one of the more pricey hotels but having been to the Embassy Suites I knew it would not disappoint. He of course remained skeptical until we walked into the room. The room had a jet tub, king size bed, two flat screen TV's, full kitchen with stainless steel appliances... He was won over. The fact that a wonderful hot breakfast buffet to order was included with your stay and that it is a 5 minutes from old Montreal were just the icing on the cake. We had a fantastic weekend away and a big part of that can certainly be contributed to the great service we received, and the fantastic room. My husband commented all weekend about the fact that he could not believe what we had for such an amazing price. The one drawback to this hotel is that there is no valet parking but if this is not a big deal for you, don't hesitate and don't let the fact that it is not terribly expensive fool you. If you rely on this review please write and let me know about your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Luxurous Room with So Many Perks”
Reviews.Author: PharmAlex
Reviews.Content: The front desk service was excellent. Check-in was a breeze and personnel were very friendly. Concierge kindly recommended suggested running routes for me. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The twin jacuzzi in my room was a nice bonus. The location of the hotel itself is practically at the heart of the city. Steps away from Old Montreal and Chinatown and walking distance to the rest of downtown. There was also great perks: included hot breakfst and drink tickets during happy hour. That was a very nice bonus and the bartender is extremely kind. She was able to coerce the kitchen into making pizza even though it was not on the menu. That is going above and beyond, because she was very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked better”
Reviews.Author: tvordlj
Reviews.Content: We were staying in Montreal for a week and planned to book a suite type hotel. We actually had a different hotel booked when a deal came through on Travelzoo for the Embassy Suites by Hilton that was a little cheaper than the original one we'd booked so we switched bookings. I'm glad we did. The square where we would have been staying was bogged down with construction and it would have been noisy and dusty all week. Embassy Suites is on Rue San Antoine right across from the Convention Centre, Palais de Congress, which includes a Metro stop and gateway to the underground network. You walk up a short incline beside the hotel and you're standing across from Notre Dame Basilica and have Old Montreal at your feet, with shops and restaurants and all the old streets and buildings. You're spoiled for choice! On the other side of the hotel, you're a block or two from Chinatown and Only a few blocks from St. Catherine's street going north and the Bell Centre going west. We walked most places and only took the Metro a couple of times. The hotel itself was clean and the staff were always helpful. The suite was a King suite with the bed in a seperated "room" that you could close off with sliding doors. The bed was quite comfy and the pillows awesome! I think the living room couch was a sofa bed, as well. The bathroom was large and it had a jacuzzi tub. I couldn't figure out how to turn it on but hit the control by accident so that was sorted! Plenty of hot water, lots of towels and soaps. They brought up some dishes and cutlery but you do have to ask for that. We didn't bother getting the dishwasher unlocked because we weren't planning on cooking, just using the microwave for reheating and we washed up coffee cups by hand. Having read the reviews, I already knew to bring my own dishcloth and towel for that.We didn't see a supermarket nearby but there is a convenience store in the convention centre and a couple in Old Montreal as well. Breakfast was included and it was a full cooked breakfast if you wanted. You could have your eggs any way you wanted and if you want omelets, you put the ingredients you choose into a little bowl and hand it to one of the chefs. There is fresh fruit, croissants and pastries, bagels, toast, cereal (a couple of choices, in little packets), juices, coffee and tea ( though my partner thought the coffee was a bit on the weak side). Every night there is a "manager's reception" and they give you vouchers for two free drinks per adult guest. We took advantage of this a couple of nights. Only one caveat, though, the only beer that is covered by the free vouchers is Keith's draft on tap. Other than that, all mixed drinks and, I think, glasses of wine are included. We had a couple of cocktails that would have cost $12 to buy so I don't know why they won't include bottled or other types of beer in the free drinks but it doesn't really matter. As i said before, the staff was always helpful and friendly and any questions asked were cheerfully answered. The concierges were great help too, though one did direct us to a restaurant in Old Montreal that was only open at lunch on that particular day. Oops! There's free wifi in the hotel lobby and i was able to get it in the suite once or twice if i was still connected from being in the lobby but usually it wanted a log in password. I didn't bother calling to get that because i only have an iPod touch anyway, not a laptop so it wasn't a major consideration. Apparently there is a temporary fitness centre in one of the suites on the second floor. I didn't see it but i imagine it's pretty basic. I don't think parking is free but there is parking beneath the hotel and there is a laundry facility on one of the parking levels too with coin operated machines. It feels a bit remote though, i am not sure i'd feel all that comfortable using it on my own. There is a small business center that is free for guests to use, with two PCs though some websites are blocked (social networking ones). The restaurant is basic, and doubles as the bar and breakfast room. Room service choice isn't extensive but it covers the basics. We had a very nice burger and fries which was very reasonably priced considering how expensive room service food usually is. I'd recommend the hotel for the location and the great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, kitchen very handy”
Reviews.Author: RandyDellinger
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed having a kitchen, it's so handy to be able to save leftovers in a fridge and keep your drinks cold! We were pleasantly surprised to receive 2 free drinks per day per person. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and quiet. Good locations, just a short walk to Notre Dame. The breakfast buffet was somewhat of a madhouse, but can't really complain since it's free.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service...excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Annieo4498
Reviews.Content: We had a family trip to Montreal to and we stayed in the two bedroom suite at this hotel. The hotel is beautiful. It was very clean and so spacious! The kitchen was very nice...granite countertop too! The breakfast was cook to order and everything was so delicious! We will definitely be staying here anytime we visit Montreal again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: mscallieco
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights pre-cruise and was very pleased. From the moment we arrived the check-in was pleasant and efficient and the concierge was wonderful arranging for our luggage to be delivered to our room and recommending a great Italian restaurant within walking distance. Location is convenient for visiting Notre-Dame and Old Montreal. The RES (underground city) is within 1 block and took us all over Montreal. The hotel was very clean and spacious. More than enough room and the free wi-fi was very reliable. Bed was very comfortable and the separate living room was a bonus. There was a HUGE jacuzzi tub that looked inviting which I did not use. Breakfast was a little crowded in the mornings but was always able to get a table. Check out was also efficient and the concierge arranged our luggage and a taxi for us to the dock and we did not have to touch our bags the entire morning. We would definitely stay here again when we go back to Montreal. The price was less than $180.00 USD and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own light bulbs”
Reviews.Author: khkh
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night pre-cruise. Booked a great AAA rate with corporate website. Family members opted for a bit more pricey room and was that a good decision! Our room was a queen/non-suite and it was tiny! It had a little kitchen and a nice bathroom (albeit small) but it was DARK! There were about 3 overhead lights and a couple dim bedside lamps. We did the best we could. The other folks got an apartment complete with full kitchen, huge bath, and proper lighting in the living room and separate (with door) bedroom. Go figure. The lobby was as dark as the room and the weather was grim and wet when we arrived about 9PM so we stayed at the hotel for supper which okay but we had been so looking forward to finding a nice bistro nearby. Breakfast was a zoo - the weekend we were there was Canada's thanksgiving and the hotel was packed with families and groups and who knows what else. We toughed it out and basically hung around the apartment (not our little cell!) for awhile before venturing out into the area.....we did a bit of pre-cruise shopping then checked out. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel IF you get a big room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: travelrus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days last week. We had a great stay. The location is perfect, 2 blocks from Notre Dame/Old Montreal and 2 blocks from Chinatown. You are able to walk anywhere you want in the city, and the metro station is just a block away as well. The room was perfect. We arrived about 3 hours early and received our room immediately. The kitchen was clean and the living room and bedroom was spacious. The bathroom was enormous. We went for a walk and came back about 2 hours later and requested the crib for our son and it came up promptly. We were ready for breakfast when it opened every day (6:30 during week and 7:30 on the weekend). They opened right on time and had tons of food options. The garage is convenient and as a result we ended up using the car more than we would have (because it's easier than dragging a toddler and stroller on the Metro), to go to both the Olympic Park and Mont Royal. Everyone at the front desk was friendly. The hotel has 3 internet stations and although we didn't use it a lot, we never had to wait for a computer. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful severl days in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Sader75
Reviews.Content: Just a few comments regarding the Embassy Suites we stayed in recently. 1) The room was clean and comfortable in league with other Embassy Suites we have used. It was $188C per night with parking at $19C per night reserved through the chain's website. Very convienient to Old Montreal. Kitchen have all stainless steel appliances and dishes, utensils, for 2 with a modest array of pots & pans (though no sponges, dish soap or kitchen towels). 2) Breakfast was also in line with others in the chain. We saw no lenghty lines nor lack of breakfast items as described in some reviews. Having stayed Thurs, Fri & Sat I think we got a fair sample of both weekday and weekend crowds. Manager's nightly reception was also the standard exemplary Embassy Suite variety. 3) All the staff was friendly and helpful especially the breakfast and reception manager and concierge. 4) We saw no overcrowding at the 2 elevators as someone else had mentioned. 5) The 2 things which puzzled us were the funky room key swiping mechanism in the elevator (never did figure out the function) and the opposite-side- of- the-road traffic pattern in the basement garage (why?). 6) All in all we found the hotel far better than a number of the more negative reviews found by us before our trip. I'd certainly recommend this hotel for a trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , Best service, Brand new hotel,,,Nice very nice”
Reviews.Author: FloridaNikki44
Reviews.Content: Thank you for wonderful stay , at the hotel , much better than some 5 stars hotel listed on here ,,

Reviews.Title: “Excelled in all Areas”
Reviews.Author: Rather-B-travelling
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. I just spent 7 nights at the Embassy Suites and enjoyed every one of them. Initailly I chose the hotel due to it's position directly accross the street to the Palais des Congres in which I was attending a conference. However this hotel is much more than just a great location. The room was marvellous, very large (seperate bedroom, bathroom, sitting/lounge & kitchen). in addition it also included a large spa, electric fireplace and a lot of wardroom space....what more can you ask for? The room was also quiet, very clean and was serviced everyday. All the staff where very friendly, helpful and attentive to any needs. You really can't beat the value of this place with breakfast and other freebies included in the rate. It is only a 2 minute walk to old Montreal and all the wonderful restaurants, shopping and sightseeing locations. Well done Emabssy suites on making my time in Montreal a happy one. If i'm lucky enough to ever return to Montreal this is the place I will choose again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: Picky_Lady_Ontario
Reviews.Content: I just loved this hotel, it's the best ever!!! I have been to many hotels in Canada, the US and Europe and this hotels is just the best! Loved the Suite, everything was perfect! Huge fridge, kitchen, etc. great for someone staying in for a couple of nights like I did. Great location, we had a great time in old Montreal. Parking is not free as all other hotels around but very convenient! I highly recommend it!!! Would go back is a glimpse!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: VTLongTimeTraveler
Reviews.Content: A really enthusiastic five in all categories for the Embassy Suites. Attending a conference at the Palais de Congres, I was closer than I anticipated - right across the street. The suite was wonderful - very spacious with great, full-sized appliances. The only oddity was the coffee maker. We expected a four-cup pot but found a pod-type that brews a cup at a time. We also were never able to open the dishwasher - a puzzle. The manager's receptions and breakfasts were quite generous. The room service menu was limited but the food and the service were great. The bell staff/concierge were very helpful. Self-service parking under the hotel was reasonably priced and accessible by elevator from the room. Wonderful stay for both business (mine) and pleasure (my spouse stored his bike in the room easily and had great rides from the hotel location.)

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room, Great Location, A few cleanliness problems”
Reviews.Author: OshkoshTraveler1
Reviews.Content: We really liked the location of the hotel with easy walking to the old city area, Chinatown, and easy access to subway and buses. They have self parking for $20/day. They were kind enough to check us in several hours early. We stayed 3 nights in a very large King Suite on the 2nd floor. The room was beautiful, with a huge bath w/ jacuzzi tub, marble surfaces, a nice kitchen area w/fridge and microwave, a comfortable bed, and a living room w/ couch, chair and big screen TV. It had a lot of closet space and storage. The carpeting needed to be cleaned or replaced and the glasses provided had fingerprints where someone was picking them up by the rims for all 3 days. The facility has 2 elevators and the wait for an elevator can be long at busy times. They give you tickets for two drinks for happy hour and a breakfast coupon for each person for each day. They put out some chips, salsa and pretzels and a few other things for the happy hour. The breakfast had a steam table with scrambled eggs, fried potatoes, and bacon. The potatoes were room temperature all three days. They also have an omelet station to make you a good omelet with your choice of ingredients. They also had a good variety of beverages, muffins and bagels. The problem was finding a clean plate, we both usually had to search through 3 or 4 to find a clean one. They really need to go to disposable plates and glassware if they can't figure out how to get the dinnerware and room glasses clean consistantly. It is kind of strange because the hotel housekeeping is very good except for the cleanliness of the room glasses, and plates at the breakfast area. It detracts from an otherwise top rate hotel. We liked the hotel enough despite the problems that we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Hotel in Montreal with the Best Staff in Town!”
Reviews.Author: Uncle_Buck067
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Montreal Marathon and had one on the best stays ever! The room was clean, roomy and perfect for family travel. It was a busy weekend due to the marathon and the staff could not have been friendlier. The free breakfast was perfect way to start the day, made to order omelets, juice, coffee, breads, eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. The managerâ€™s cocktail reception was nice as well; two drink tickets plus light snacks. The hotel is convenient to Old Montreal, St. Catherine Street, shopping, and Old Port. We eat at our favorite restaurant, Gibby's in Old Montreal and they did not disappoint as usual. The staff at the hotel was 5-star! I can't say enough hoe professional, friendly and very helpful they all were. The front desk staff was top notch, the breakfast/bar staff could not do enough for you as well as housekeeping. The hotel manager should be extremely proud of the entire staff. As far as some of the negative comments that I had read ... while they may of been legit at the time, ignore them! The elevator was working fine, the breakfast wait time was reasonable, the rooms were clean. I'm impressed that the hotel manager reads the comments and obviously addresses them because the hotel seemed to run like clockwork! We usually stay at the Bonaventure Hilton down the street, but we have found a new home in Montreal. If I had to point out any deficiencies it would be that the HVAC system in the room was on the noisy side and there was no pool, but I would not let that deter you from trying this gem of a hotel. We are looking forward to staying there in the future. Hats off to the hotel manager and the entire staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice; Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: pr123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had to be in Montreal for 2 days getting our daughter moved into university. We were looking for a hotel suite downtown, and saw Embassy Suites offering a reasonable rate. I have stayed at Embassy Suites a few times and have an impression of them as consistent quality but not high end. I found this hotel to be better than I expected. The room was the quality of suite we expected. The location was better than I expected (bordering on old Montreal). The service is what really impressed me for an Embassy Suites Hotel. From the time we arrived in a rental car and needed help with bags, through check-in and frequent stops by the front desk or Consierge asking for information, everyone was extremely friendly and wanting to help. Our rate included free breakfast, and it was good quality, good service ... not what I usually expect from a 'free breakfast' hotel. All in all, I would definitely stay here again next time we travel to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gung_ho_in_TO
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is in Old Montreal and is near Chinatown as well. It's on a quiet street and there are the new rental bikes just outside the hotel for those who want to take a ride. The rooms were very nice and spacious. The furniture was very modern and there were two flat screen tvs - one in the living room and one in the bedroom. The kitchen was helpful as you could take breakfast and drinks back to your room. The buffet breakfast was pretty good and the hotel had a happy hour (2 free drink tickets per guest, I believe with free snacks - veggies, chips etc). There's only 2 elevators which can result in line-ups and/or a wait but not a big deal really. We had a slight communication issue with the front desk (we had left keys for my sibling for his room and they gave him the wrong card key - for my room instead - but not a big issue there either). Overall, a very nice hotel and I would highly recommend going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gibby2007
Reviews.Content: I often stay in Embassy Suites because they are generally set up well for my family of five and I can't beat the value of breakfast and the manager's reception. That said, this is not a family hotel. Why the rooms were beautifully appointed (who needs a dishwasher when there are no dishes in the room?), there was very little space for our luggage. There was a huge bathroom and jetted tub for two that was wasted on us. The pull out couch was extremely uncomfortable ( so was our pull out in Niagara, although the couch in DC was very comfortable). The kicker was that our travel agent had called and verified with them that they had pool privileges at the Hilton Bonaventure (roof top pool) while theirs was under construction. When we asked, after we arrived, they said that the arrangement was only in the winter. My husband had this conversation with the clerk and did not follow up more with management (which I would have). This was one of the main reasons that we chose this hotel. In hindsight, we should have paid extra for two rooms at the Hilton. The location and service were fine. We did experience some waiting at the elevator, but after being at the Embassy Niagara Falls, they felt short. At the buffet, bowls were missing, plates were sometimes dirty and there was no help -yourself soft drinks, which could lead to line ups at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: EzzaC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites. When we checked in we were upgraded from a queen suite to a king suite and also told about the managers reception that was also included (two drinks per adult every evening plus nibbles), a great start to the vacation,. We were very happy with the location, the room and the staff. There was a problem with the AC in our room on the first night so we were moved the next day and given a complimentary bottle of red and a note from the manager which was very appreciated. I would stay there again and recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms; location cannot be beat! Feels crowded in summer.”
Reviews.Author: IndyCarGirl
Reviews.Content: We stay in Embassy Suites very often as they work well for families. The Montreal Embassy is very centrally located just a few blocks from Vieux Montreal and just steps from the Metro (Place d'Arms stop) and the Underground City, which our 9-year-old son loved. Our room was smaller than other Embassy hotels we've visited, but much more luxuriously appointed, with a granite/stainless kitchen with full fridge and freezer, beautiful bathroom with jetted tub and above-mounted sink, and cute pocket doors to the small bedroom. Our room was clean but housekeeping was a bit iffy -- glasses not replaced, stuff on the bathroom counter not straightened. Unlike other Embassys, the rooms are not around a central courtyard, and the lobby is very small and narrow. Some outdoor seating helps, but seating is at a premium at breakfast and the evening manager's reception. We felt crowded most of the time. The two free drinks and free snacks are very generous -- we never used all the drink coupons. Our biggest complaint: the elevator situation is terrible. There are two guest elevators and a staff elevator. Mid-way through our stay, one passenger elevator broke; it was quickly fixed and then the staff elevator broke. We could not find stairs that go to the lobby -- we tried one and it went to the basement (though we never asked, so maybe the other staircase would work). One morning, I forgot my camera, and going back up and then down again took 15 minutes. Another morning, there was a 10-minute line for the elevator. (Yes, a line, like at an amusement park.) Air conditioning was also spotty in the elevator and hallways; our room was fine, though others I talked to had problems with it shutting off. That added to the crowded, cattle-call feel of the hotel. As others have mentioned, the breakfast waits are long, especially on the weekends. On weekdays, go to breakfast before 8:30am to beat the crowd. On weekends, there was a long line even at 8am. The staff is very nice but cannot keep up with demand -- bowls were missing, no milk for coffee, etc. However, the food is very good and much better than the typical Embassy breakfast. And it's included, which is a huge money-saver in this expensive city. The hotel has a concierge desk, and they gave us great advice about visiting a farmer's market (Jean Talon). They seem to know their stuff. The "fitness center" was a seemingly temporary setup in an empty guest room on the second floor; I assume they're working on that. It was awkward and I decided not to use it, but that was no big deal. Overall, the value is very good and we would probably stay here again, but we might also price the Westin or Inter-Continental down the street, since they have the same location advantages.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice in every way except for the view and the free beer”
Reviews.Author: MarylandAnglophile
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites to attend a convention at the Montreal Palais de Conrges (convention center). This hotel is very convenient for that, right across the street. It's also only a few blocks from Chinatown and from Old Montreal. The room itself was beautiful, with a combination kitchen (no oven, but there is a microwave and even a dishwasher) and sitting room as well as the bedroom. Bathroom has a shower and large a jacuzzi-style tub that was great. Two flatscreen TVs, one in bedroom and one in sitting area. No dishes or utensils in the kitchen except for the mugs for coffee. Supposedly, you could ask for them, but they never showed up so we borrowed them from the breakfast buffet. Wireless access worked well in the room; there is usually a charge but it was free with our convention rate. Free full breakfast everyday was great. Free snacks and two free drinks every afternoon but the only beer on the "free" menu was Alexander Keith's, basically Budweiser. Helpful, friendly staff. The view for some rooms was the convention center (not bad, really) but our room looked out on some construction behind the hotel. Some rooms had fireplaces, but ours did not, so ask if you want one. Note that Montreal has great restaurants but not in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: travelmom_8
Reviews.Content: This is a great place if you want to be centrally located and want to walk to many points of interests of Montreal. We have a 7 and 9 year old and it was an easy walk to Old Montreal (only a couple of blocks from the Notre-Dame Basilica), to China Town and maybe 15 minute walk to downtown although there is a subway station one block away. We brought our bikes and we were able to ride to the waterfront (streets are narrow and tricky for the kids but it's not far) and go riding along the Lachine Canal bike path which goes for miles. There is a new "public bicycle" system in place in Montreal where there are bike racks all over the city. You can pick up a bike and you can drop it off at any other location. It costs $5. This is a very "Bike friendly" city. There is a bike rack just in front of the hotel. The rooms were great and the kids loved the HUGE jetted tub with a light in it!! I guess you need to ask to get dishes because the kitchen was empty but we loved the big fridge and microwave to use for snacks. Having a living room and kitchen made it feel like you werent stuck in a little hotel room. It was a great bonus to have drink tickets for every day we were there. We had good drinks, the kids had their Shirley Temple and a plate of snacks before heading out for the evening. Front desk staff was great and everything was done very quickly and efficiently. Free breakfast was good too. There was lots of selection. We never had to wait more than a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaMomof3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best I have ever stayed in! It was beautifully appointed, and the guest rooms had many nice upgrades like granite and flat screen t.v.s. The bed was unbelievably comfortable-- we loved it! Great location right on the edge of Vieux Montreal. We walked to everything! The staff was VERY friendly and helpful as well. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Robins44
Reviews.Content: We just go back from staying at the Embassy Suites Montreal. Great location and nice room/suite; I thought it was a little on the small side compared to other Embassy Suites. There were a few stains on the carpet (rm 715) , but overall pretty clean. As previously posted, my main issue was the hectic pace of breakfast; long lines and not enough tables. We did have to wait in line for about 10 minutes, and then I finally gave up and just wanted cold ceral, but couldn't find any bowls. When a few bowls did show up, there wasn't any milk. Finally, I just had a cup of coffee and a croissant. Overall, nice hotel with good service, but they still have some issues to work out.

Reviews.Title: “Great property with a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: W2IRT
Reviews.Content: I heartily recommend the Embassy Suites to anybody coming to Montreal but, as many reviewers have stated earlier, there are a few problems that really need to be looked after by the corporate head office or the hotel's senior management. First off, the rooms are huge and utterly gorgeous! Simply put, these are apartments, not standard hotel rooms. Floor-to-ceiling windows, central climate control (more on this shortly), a huge in-room jacuzzi-style bathtub -- for one in my room, for 2 in the larger fireplace suites -- and a great kitchen. The most glaring problem is the breakfast situation. It really is as dire as depicted. There is a cafeteria-style lineup that is simply not needed, as its only purpose is for custom-cooked eggs/omlettes. If you arrive after 8:30 for breakfast, be prepared to queue for around half an hour. As you make your way down the line, you are blocking access to plates, trays, cutlery (they are perpetually short of knives, it would seem) and the bowls of fresh fruit. At the end of the line you'll find three chafing dishes (breakfast potatoes, bacon and saussages), two harried cooks managing 5 pans and a pancake dispensary at the far end. There are three more identically-full chafing dishes at the far end of the dining room but they are not signed in any way and most guests don't know of their existance. I would *strongly* recommend they consider ripping out the cafeteria-line, put three large tables for the self-serve chafing dishes and a fourth specifically for eggs/omlettes, as is done in almost every other hotel I've stayed in. My second gripe was the air conditioning. It's on a motion detector and hard-set to default to 20 degrees. Great for energy conservation when the room is unoccupied -- not so great when you need it to be cold to sleep...and since you're not moving around, the detector shuts the A/C off and you wake up in a stuffy hot room at 3am. It took three nights for their maintenance staff to resolve this issue but in the end it was fixed, and my bill was reduced by a fair amount for the inconvenience. The corridor on our floor (6th) wase *not* air conditioned and were very stuffy, also. The next issue was Internet connectivity. There were many times my wife and I were unable to connect, either from her Mac or my XP box, both in-room or in the lobby. Even when connected, it was very slow. Since we were part of a convention whose guests are highly 'Net-savvy, I'd say we maxed out their bandwidth in short order. What few problems we did encounter were more than made up for by the fanstastic staff. EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THEM, from the Concierge to the chamber-maids, were wonderful and made us feel welcome. This is a model staff that every hotel in the industry should strive to emulate, and I compliment whoever in management has set the bar so very high in staff training. You got it right, plain and simple, and we *will* be back! The only thing that would make it perfect for us would be a fitness centre with pool and jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Cliff0rd
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay. We were upgraded to an enormous suite with fireplaces, a whirlpool bath, and full kitchen (not that we used it) with a table for 6. Furniture was comfortable and in good condition. As others have noted, breakfast can get crowded, but we were told it was ok to bring our trays back up to our room, so we did. The manager's reception was a great amenity. We ordered room service a couple times--the food was great and service was quite prompt. Self-parking was a big plus, too. I much prefer it to valet. There are only two elevators serving 11 guest floors and 5 parking levels, so there was sometimes a wait. One of elevators was not working one morning, and the management staff were telling guests they could use the nearby service elevator. That message was not being conveyed to the rest of the staff, however, resulting in some confusion. I didn't much care for the restaurant scene in Old Montreal nearby. The restaurants were crowded, pricey, and very tourist-oriented. On my next trip to Montreal, I'll focus more on the restaurants on Rue Ste. Catherine. Only areas for improvement were that the supplies of plates, glassware, etc. in the kitchen were quite limited, and the TV's, though flat-panel, only received analog channels (no high-def). A DVD player would be a nice touch, too. Overall, we had a great time and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, but many little problems”
Reviews.Author: MerrylG
Reviews.Content: I am currently on day 3 of a 5-day stay at the Embassy Suites Centre-Ville. I booked a room for 3 adults and 1 child. Our room is lovely and modern. The fireplace is all-electric, really more like a picture of a fire that emits heat than an actual FIREplace. The kitchen is disappointing; though it has a very nice refrigerator it's not really a kitchen. It's more of a wet-bar with a microwave and fridge and lots of empty cabinets. Our dishwasher happened to be unlocked when we arrived (others have said theirs were locked). I have not yet tried the lovely jacuzzi tub in the spacious bathroom. The shower is nice; I wish it were a bit larger and had someplace to hang the towels where they'd stay dry, but you could reach them from inside. I've taken to placing them on the rolling vanity chair before I enter. The hotel will bring you dishes if you ask but they really don't seem to understand what "kitchen things" mean. When i first asked, they asked me how many people I wanted dishes for. They brought me 4 plates, 4 forks, 4 butter knives, and 4 spoons for 4 people. No bowls, no extra glasses, no service pieces, no microwave cooking pieces. When I asked again later, they brought me some bowls, a cutting board, and a sharp knife, but said they did not have anything like a colander or service pieces. We have asked for dishwasher detergent twice and still have not gotten any. They do arrive promptly with the items that they are willing to bring. I've just given up on asking. When we arrived, there was a wet spot on the carpet. Soon afterward, we realized that the air conditioning was not working. They promptly sent up an engineer who then had to remove 10 or 20 pounds of ICE from the thing. This left an even WETTER spot in the bedroom in front of the bathroom. Yesterday I asked for someone to come and deal with these wet spots. They tried, but the one in front of the bathroom is still wet nearly 2 days later. Quite annoying to step on in bare feet. They provide only 3 sets of towels for the 4 of us. There are no extra towels for use as kitchen towels. If I call for extra towels, they do not replace them. I must call each day to get enough towels for all of us. While they do arrive promptly, it's annoying to have to keep asking over and over for stuff. I feel like I'm calling them twice every day for something... and it's much more annoying to call for something like extra towels over and over when it would be simple for the housekeeper to replace as many towels as she took away. About the internet: we had to file a ticket with their ISP to get the wired internet working in our room. Internet in the rooms requires a code that the front desk will tell you, but there is no way to know that. (A friend told me the code.) Their website says that there ought to be wireless access (as well as wired) in all the suites, but there is no wireless here in suite 507. When we called the front desk, they told us that the suites only have wired access. You can get wireless access in the lobby. Breakfast is served 6:30 to 9:30 on weekdays and 7:30 to 10:30 on weekends. Don't plan on rolling down there at 9 or 10 and getting fed; if the hotel is full the lines get long unless you get there early. They stop serving promptly at 9:30. If you can't get a seat it's okay to bring the stuff up to to your room. You can get made-to-order omelets and eggs. I saw someone with pancakes but don't know how to get them. There is a separate table with breakfast meat & scrambled eggs if you don't want to wait in the big omelet line. Look behind the omelet line for the fresh fruit. Their chocolate croissant are very good, paw around under the regular croissant to find them. There's a toaster if you want your bread, english muffin, or bagel toasted. There's coffee and juice at the bar. My opinion so far: This hotel could be OUTSTANDING if they examined their processes from the guest's point of view. Some simple things that would make my stay much more enjoyable: - Replacing all the towels instead of just providing a standard set of 3 (in a room that 4 people are staying in. Children use at least as many towels as adults, y'know!) - Providing basic kitchen supplies like dishtowels, dish soap, kitchen tools, basic dishes and cutlery by default instead of by demand. At least STOCKING additional supplies like colanders and service pieces for folks who ask. If I wanted to wash and cut up some veggies, how would I do it? - Reorganizing the breakfast area. I should not have to ask a line of people to move aside so I can get some fruit. There only have to be 3 people in line and that area gets blocked. The hotel is OK. You could probably do a lot worse. If you are prepared for a bucket of minor annoyances in an otherwise very nice place, then this is a good choice. I really wish I could rate it higher.

Reviews.Title: “Correciton of Rating Scores”
Reviews.Author: JoyceofLife
Reviews.Content: Please disregard my rating scores on the previous review. I accidentally checked off the incorrect boxes. The overall rating was excellent. Please refer to my comments in my previous review. They tell the how wonderful this hotel truly was.

Reviews.Title: “Great space for family, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: eggtmt
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 1 night here on our way to Mont Tremblant. I used Hilton points which is a great value for a family of four stay. We got there early and had no problem checking in. We had a king room reserved but they were able to give us a room with 2 queens which was great for our needs. The beds were comfortable and the room had a full sized kiichen and nice bathroom with huge jacuzzi tub. My only complaint on the room was the carpet had stains all over it. I did not complain to the desk but it was weird that it was so stained. It looked like the whole room was new except for the rugs. We enjoyed the managers reception. It was crowded but we found a spot on the sidewalk outside which was great. This is the first Embassy we have been at where we were given drink coupons, 2 each. I am wondering if this is a local law . Every other Embassy we have visited has just had a 2 hour happy hour. We also had breakfast in the morning and there was a decent variety. Never saw any pancakes though. The wait for the elevator was long at times. I could not believe how rude some people waiting for it were. They would push their way in before people got off. Obviously, this is of no fault of the hotel. We brought an I touch and could not get a wireless signal. They had cable hookup though, if only I had brought my laptop. The location was great to walk to the old part of the city. It was also not far to walk to Saint Catherine Street. Parking was about $20. All of the staff were very helpful and friendly. The pool was not open but we knew this in advance. I would stay here again if I got a good deal, espeacially if I needed a suite, but I would also shop around if it were only 2 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great business accommodation”
Reviews.Author: only1kadee
Reviews.Content: Beautiful 1 bedroom suite with kitchen but no kitchenware or cookware. Stayed for 8 nights and would have liked to be able to cook something given I booked and thought it was a full contained 1 bedroom. Restaurant was quite limited in choices but there were numerous restaurants around the area. Location is great, in downtown, short walk to port,metro and plenty of shopping, activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DMS27
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from staying 3 nights in Montreal. The location of the hotel couldn't have been better. Just a short walk and you are in "Old Montreal". Rooms were very nice - we had the "studio" which is a nice size for 2 people. Had no problem with the breakfast buffet - always found a table (we usually got down around 8:30). If you don't want to wait in line for made -to -order eggs, they have scrambled along with hard-boiled eggs, bacon, potatoes, yogurt and fruit salad on another table. If you wait until you get your fresh fruit, then you do have to get in line along with others waiting for the made- to- order eggs. They also have pancakes which you can go up to the left and get them from the chef (this should probably be in a different area). The manager's reception can get crowded but we always found an area to sit - one night we sat on the couches - who needs a table to share a drink and snack (veggies & dip, salsa & chips, cheese, pretzels and mini-bagel pizzas). Every one was very helpful & friendly and no problem with language. The parking garage was very convenient (extra charge of $19/day but you could go in and out). Would definitely stay here again. The only problem with the room was that the carpet was a little soiled in some areas. However the rest of the room was clean - the dishwasher was locked as mentioned in another review -but who needs to do dishes. Just put our used cups in the sink and got fresh ones the next day!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2BEis2SKI
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in this hotel and found staff, rooms and everything to our liking. A big shout out to the staff and management. We had planned a 2 night stay but for reasons unrelated to the hotel, we decided to cut the stay short. Hotel management willingly canceled the 2nd night and honored the free parking rate even though it was a 2 night stay rate. My gold Hilton Honors probably had something to do with this. We remained parked in the garage all day while we walked around vieux Montreal. But, they went one step further. I had a lot of Canadian $$ that I was not going to spend with our shortened visit so they refunded my credit card for the first night (which I had paid in deposit 2 weeks earlier) and allowed me to pay for the room in cash so I didn't have as much $$ to exchange back. They were friendly the entire time I was pestering them with these requests. Our room was very clean and most importantly, quiet. If there is a negative, it is that the morning breakfast room is packed. We went down late thinking we'd miss the rush but instead, I think everybody had our idea. We had to wait in line about 15 minutes and had to eat sitting in the lobby area on couches instead of tables. Was not the end of the world but it might be worth it to go down to eat earlier in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with our Stay. Will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: spygal_79
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed Friday, July 10th for one evening. We stayed in room 813 and were very impressed. Our room was surprisingly large with a great layout.
