The room had tons of storage space. Three closets in the room, with plenty of hangers. The king size bed was very comfortable (I am extremely picky about beds). The bathroom was also very big with a bathtub big enough for two! The jets were pretty extreme, so we quickly turned them off, but enjoyed a great soak before our night on the town. Upon check-in we received 2 tickets each for cocktails in the evening, as well as a ticket each for the hot breakfast the next morning. Drinks were lovely, although it was very sunny and hot in the restaurant at cocktail hour. The next morning we went to the restaurant around 9:30am for breakfast. There was a bit of a lineup for the omelet station, but nothing unreasonable. We had no problem getting a table. Staff was quick to clear tables. I have read some complaints about the breakfasts, and I have to say, I can't really relate to them. Although we have had better breakfasts, the food was good enough to have us leaving feeling satisfied. The location was great! We were in town for cirque du soleil and we walked to the venue as well as to several other places of interest in old montreal. There is also a bixi bike rack right out from of the hotel. This is such a great idea and very convenient for the hotel guests. My Husband and I intend to return to Montreal in the future and I wouldn't hesitate to book with this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling Management and dirty”
Reviews.Author: emisphairs1966
Reviews.Content: People who review this hotel are probably impressed by the gimmicks like flat screen TVs and jet tubs, but in my 20 years of travel I have never seen anything so appalling. On my first night I discovered that broken glass was left all over the carpet. Oviously vaccuming between guests is not part of the housekeeping program in this hotel. As this is a suite hotel with a kitchen I tried to use the dishwahser...no luck there...it was literally screwed shut . I called reception who sent a handy man with a drill to open it. His explanation was that the machines were screwed shut under order of management as some guests had "missused" the machine. Apparently this management thinks nothing of inconveniencing hundreds of guests because of one incident. The second night I came back to my room the bed was not done and the bathroom half cleaned. It took 4 phone calls to reception and 90 minutes of arguing before someone came to finish cleaning the room. The front desk supervisor could not do anything according to her except write a report for a manager for the next day. Breakfast is barely above school cafeteria grade , staff is unavailable and ignores guests waiting for a table. The explanation i was given is that the breakfast service is contracted out to another company and is not run by Hilton-Embassy suites. One advice...stay away, for the price you can do a lot better in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel during the NHL Draft”
Reviews.Author: caneshockey31
Reviews.Content: This was one of the stays where everything seemed to work out no matter what. When I arrived at the hotel i was greeted graciously, and was given a room on the ninth floor corner room (Room 901) This was a great room with full kitchen, living room, dining area, hallway for jackets etc, bedroom and bathroom with jacuzzi bath. The staff was more than able to help in any way that they could during my stay and I was also fortunate enough to see a number of NHL coaches and executives while staying here during the week of the Draft. The only little concern, breakfast time, it seems that the fruits and omelettes are all in one line, so if you want just a piece of fruit you have to wait in the sometimes long line. I just stayed recently at another Embassy Suites in Canada and it made a lot more sense. So to have it seperate would be much more less of a headache. However, this was not a big deal to me. This hotel is located directly across the street from Place De Armes and is very convenient to all the major attractions etc. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could NOT Be Better--Location, Staff, Room, Amenities were PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: MikeLeAngelia
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews and that convinced us to stay here for our honeymoon. Well, all the good things written were GREAT and the few bad things written were not so bad. First and foremost, the location is perfect. We walked all over the Old City, the Latin Quarter, China Town is literally across the street, and the Bell Center/Museums area were all an easy walk. The highlight of our trip was the Botanical Gardens, an easy ride on the Metro, which has a station around the corner from the hotel. The Gardens were extraordinary. Our suite was great with a big jacuzzi, two flat screen TVs and stainless steel appliances. And the staff could not have been nicer. Stephanie, Emily, Benny, Robert and the rest--merci bou coup! A lot of people complained about the line for breakfast. What would you expect when everyone shows up at the same time? I had a perfect, quiet breakfast each day at 7:30 AM. My wife usually arrived later and rather than wait in the omelet line, she got her juice, cereal, yogurt, fruit and crouisant without delay. The other complaint was about the construction noise next door-the Westin is expanding. We were on the front side of the building and other than the ocaisional siren, it was quiet. All in all a perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: riskyman
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. A few steps from old Montreal and modern Montreal. The rooms were comfortable and exceed our expectations. Good breakfast and manager reception. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel by far!”
Reviews.Author: sap328
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in. It is absolutely beautiful on the inside. Not only was the room great but they provided a complimentary breakfast each morning that included omelets, bacon, sausage, etc. Also, every night they had a happy hour where each guest received two complimentary drinks as well as appetizers to snack on. The location is also a plus. It is facing downtown montreal and backs up to Old Montreal. One Block from Rue St Paul. Will definately be staying there on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A place in Montreal I can call home”
Reviews.Author: CdnWT
Reviews.Content: I'll try and make this quick as I usually write fairly extensive reviews. I had the chance to stay a sixth time in less than a year this past week-end at the Embassy Suites in Montreal. Over the past few years, I've tried quite a few other Montreal hotels, including the new Hilton Garden Inn on Sherbrooke, part of the same Hilton family brands and the attitude I got at check-in made me cancel my reservation on the spot and I went back where I should have booked in the first place: this hotel. This stay, once again, proved that this hotel's staff is eager to please and really cares about the guest's well being. The managers I've seen also are ALWAYS on the ball and available. Two of the front desk staff now remember me when I check-in, and by that I mean I don't even need to say my name that they're already typing it in their computers before I even get to the counter. I've never, ever, in my 5 young years of fairly extensive traveling, experienced something like this in a large hotel. Seeing them interact with other guests, everyone is equally well-treated. The service staff during the happy hour are running around on busy Saturdays making sure everyone has one of the free drinks included with all room rates and picking up dirty dishes. The suites are immaculately clean. I won't repeat what everyone else has said about the layout, the pictures speak for themselves. This hotel being relatively new (opened late 2007), there might still be some construction going on behind in the condo tower going up but I've never heard anything during the week-ends. The Westin that was being built next door is also now finished, which should considerably reduce early morning noise on weekdays from now on. Best bet is to ask for a St-Antoine facing suite (if available). The beds are the most comfortable I've found in Montreal. There is just no comparison. Local calls are free, and High speed internet also, if my memory serves me right. Overall, this hotel, with the prime location a mere block from the Notre-Dame basilica and Old Montreal, yet, less than a 5 minute walk from Ste-Catherine, the genuine friendliness of the front desk staff and the competitive rates make this place the only hotel you should consider for your Montreal trip. I've stayed at the Square Phillips, rated #1 in Montreal (last time I checked), but frankly, with the free full breakfast, the 2 drinks per person and much more comfortable mattresses, I'd say this won wins in the suite-hotel category. Give it a try and you'll see how it'll become your home in Montreal (after all, it is like having your own appartment!). Of course, it has some cons, like the kitchen smell that still somehow gets up to the lower floors (although significantly improved situation over last fall) and that promised pool that has been under construction for over a year! now, but the rest more than makes up for it. I rarely do this in my reviews but Embassy Suites management, if you read this, please do make sure you never loose your front desk personel and congratulate them on their hard work. They are by far the best in Montreal and for restaurants recommendations, Julie (I believe is her name) is a book of knowledge! Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and attitude, nice rooms, okay breakfast, lousy happy hour”
Reviews.Author: YourCaricature
Reviews.Content: I think that pretty much sums up all of what I wanted to say about this hotel. The location is fabulous--a stones throw away from major Old Montreal attractions, and the metro is a block away. There is no view for this hotel though, as it is surrounded by other hotels and tall buildings. Our room's air conditioning failed, and the service repairmen came three times to try and fix it, and finally let us know that we would have to open the window. Luckily, it was a nice night. The next morning, he came when we weren't there, and fixed it. They were unfailingly pleasant and helpful. The breakfast is pure madness. I would recommend skipping the omelet station and just go for the buffets (which are quite hidden, look around) or go there as close to closing time as possible. The happy hour drinks were not good. If you are determined to get your free drink, stick to the red or white wine. Those are bearable. But don't do the martini, they'll put ice in it. And the scotch tastes like pipe cleaners. But hey, it's free. Overall, I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel but breakfast was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ozwardies
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel. Just across from the Metro and only a block from Notre Dame in Old Montreal. We were fortunate to be upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite which was absolutely fantastic. The suite was beautifully appointed and very clean. A really good hotel! Our only complaint would be breakfast. The whole organisation of it was a shambles. It was Sunday morning so of course breakfast is busy. But if you want a nice leisurely Sunday breakfast then this is not the place to go! The food was fine but the organisation leaves a lot to be desired!!! Upon arrival we spoke to the waitress who told us to line up for hot food and she would get us a table. We did that, got our food and stood waiting while she frantically ran around doing goodness knows what. So we just found a table for 3 for ourselves and pulled an extra chair to it for the 4 of us. By the time we then got 2 kids organised our hot breakfasts were cold. It would really be better to seat guests before telling them to go and order their hot food! There's no point in lining up guest to order food if you have nowhere to sit them - I saw a few people give up and take the food back to their rooms. Plus they ran out of clean trays and cutlery (probably because people have to leave the restaurant with their food due to the lack of tables)

Reviews.Title: “#1 in Montreal. No question. Best stay, best people!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Traveller04
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights (May 16-19 2009) while in town for the Quebec Poker Tournament League Championships which was held at the Palais Du Congres. This was our second stay as we had been here for a similar event in January earlier this year. The Embassy Suites is located right accross the street from the Palais Du Congres. To give you an idea how close it is, when our tournament went on supper break for one hour, I was able to leave the 3rd level where the tournament was held, and in less than five minutes, I was in my room. It was less than one minute to walk from door to door across Saint Antoine St. You can not ask for better if you are in Montreal for an event at the Palais Du Congres. This hotel is very very modern and clearly has been recently renovated. We stayed in a Junior Suite, which had a seperate bedroom (with King Size), which had french doors that opened up to enter the room. You could access the HUGE bathroom from either the bedroom or the main area of the room. The room had a full kitchen including full size fridge and freezer, microwave, sink, dishwasher, coffee machine and cupboard space that you wouldnt believe. There was no stove in this room though. There are no plates or cutlery in the room, but if you request them, they will supply it all. The bathroom is unbelievable. A two person (side by side) jet tub. This thing is huge and is the greatest addition possible. At the end of the day (or anytime) this thing is so relaxing. It is huge and has an optional underwater light which is also cool. There is also a very nice stand up shower with excellent water pressure. A nice little corner vanity (which the wife loved!) and a very beautiful modern sink and counter area. You will not want to leave. In the main living room area, you have a pull out couch that is facing a large wall mounted LCD tv, which is located directly above a very nice electric fireplace. In front of the bedroom doors, there is a very nice desk and office chair for your business needs. I did not have a computer with me, but all the hook ups for high speed were there. In the bedroom, the most confortable king size bed was situated directly in front of yet another wall mounted LCD tv!!!!!!! Again in here, there was so much closet and dresser space, you could easily move in to this place for good. Would be an amazing apartment for sure. Another thing that we love about this place is the free breakfast buffet. I mean just up the road at the Delta Centre Ville, you pay 22.99 plus tax per person for their buffet. This one is included with the room! You can have custom omelettes made by a group of chefs that are lined up waiting for your custom order. You do not see this at other hotels. The other basic hot buffet breakfast items are all there too, but this omelette makes this buffet extra special. No bill at the end is nice too!!! Oh did I mention that you get two free drinks at the bar per person per day included with your room!!! They have to be used at a specific cocktail hour, which I believe is from 5:30 to 7:30, but if you have ever had a drink in a hotel bar, you know that this is a significant savings, which again is complimentary. Parking is underground and you always have in and out access. Elevators are very quick coming and going from the parking area. The price is 19 per day, but again, for downtown Montreal it is a fair price. At the Delta and Queen Elizabeth, you pay up to 22 per day. At least you have easy access to your vehicle here and the location is secure. I also noticed that there is a laundy centre with several washers and dryers for hotel guests with detergent and fabric softener available at the front desk. The staff here are amazing too. The dedication to customer service starts at the top. The manager, Francois went out of his way to make sure we had an amazing stay. Where else would you actually have contact with a manager?? And the front desk staff were also very friendly and helpful. It goes on and on. From the administative staff to the concierge who is always at your service, to the cleaning staff, I found no weak spots in regards to the staff of this hotel. All in all, we have found our new favorite hotel in Montreal, hands down. We will only stay here from now on. After having stayed at several other downtown hotels in Montreal, we are happy to have finally found the Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy rooms, crowded breakfast”
Reviews.Author: shne
Reviews.Content: This is an elegant and new hotel. Spacious rooms are well-appointed--ours had a huge jacuzzi as well as very comfortable bed/pillows, and a gas fireplace. Lovely hair/body care products. Staff were very helpful and especially friendly with my child's needs. It's a very easy hotel to relax in. The location can't be beat--the Place des Armes metro stop is just a block away, and Vieux Montreal is just a few minutes' walk away. An excellent base for family touring. The only weak area here was breakfast. Other reviews have pointed out that the line for the made-to-order omelets is in the way of the fruit table, and prior to the trip, that didn't seem like such a big problem. But the logistics of breakfast were quite poor. On Saturday morning, between 9-9:30, the line for omelets actually stretched out of the restaurant area and across the elevator lobby, and the seating area was quite crowded. The line was so dense that it was difficult for people to get at the fruit. The tea water wasn't really warm enough to hold temperature in the cup at the table, so my tea would be cold halfway through the meal, and the potatoes were also not really warm enough. The pastries and cereal were great (and easily accessible),but the hotel really needs to rethink how to get guests access to breakfast in a smoother manner. People who want quick and hot breakfasts might do better going around the corner to the very fabulous Eggspectation.

Reviews.Title: “The most engaging experience since 5 years of travels in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: BiblioFusion
Reviews.Content: For all my requests the went far over my expectations: Help to configure my laptop to use the WiFi in my room, information about their projects for a new terrasse, 2 breakfast in the same morning (at 6h30 and at 10h30 when the kitchen was supposely closed) and so on. Staff is really friendly to all clients. I'm using hotels to stay in Montreal since 5 years and I was never fully satisfied, now I stop looking for other places!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed & Memorable Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Lambo-Insecta
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend April 10-12, at Montreal. The drive to Montreal from Toronto was easy and relaxed. The stay at Embassy Suites, which is located in the old city, was very comfortable. The wait for breakfast was very long and not worth it. I strongly suggest to try a local restaurant, as the food is fresh and prepared with style. Notredam Basilica was 2 minutes walk, stunning interiors, a must place to visit. Avoid visiting the basilica when the service is on, this will limit your movement inside. Took a buggy ride of the city. The streets have a European blend, and a great place for walk. It was colder than we expectedAll the restaurants we visited were excellent. Mount royal is a great place to visit, easiest way to get there is to drive up to the mountain. There is plenty of parking, the main viewing area is 5 minutes walk from the parking. It is a great place to spend 2-3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms, Spacious, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: edszr
Reviews.Content: Overall we loved the hotel and will stay there again next time we visit Montreal. Our only complaint was that our room faced a construction site that got active at 6:45am!!! Not the hotel's fault, but a nuisance just the same. See attached pics for our "view." We booked the "Studio" room and it was plenty spacious for the 2 of us. Clean and comfortable, which is most important to us. Hotel is located right across the street from the Place Des Armes metro stop. Biggest plus about this hotel is the breakfast. Cooked to order eggs, pancakes, omelets. Plus a wide variety of cereals and breads. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Look no further, this is where you should stay!

Reviews.Title: “A sweet stay at the Embassy Suites Montreal”
Reviews.Author: rogue_traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend getaway with our five-year old and infant sons. Overall this hotel was a very good value, clean, modern, spacious and in an excellent location. We got a fair deal deal through the Embassy Suites website for $149/night that included free self-serve parking (worth $21 per day). There were a lot of positives. The reception staff was polite, friendly and helpful. Like other Embassy Suites, there is an element of self-serve but this is to be expected. The rooms are among the best furnished and designed of the Embassy Suites that we have visited. The kitchens features a full-size fridge as well as a dishwasher, double sink, coffee maker and microwave. The bathroom features a large Jacuzzi tub and separate shower stall. There was a convenient counter overhang in the kitchen with a couple of bar stools that replaced the need for a dining table. There were two flat screen TVs and other nice touches. The location is excellent with the metro/subway station nearby and easy road access to the sights. The hotel address puts the visitor within walking distance to the sights and eateries of Old Montreal and Chinatown. But there were a few downsides at this hotel. The morning breakfast is ample but chaotic. Service is uneven at best and grumpy at worst. The organization of breakfast is clumsy with long lines for the omelettes and pancakes with shortfalls in the freshly baked foods; e.g. croissants. The lines also block access to the plates, cutlery, fruit and yogurt. Another quibble is with the othewise excellent kitchen in the suite where there is ample cupboard space but no utensils, plates or cutlery provided. This is a city hotel with expected compromises. But on the whole, the Embassy Suites Montreal is worth visiting. My family and I expect to go back when we are next in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, what a great find!”
Reviews.Author: nsober
Reviews.Content: This place was great. Fantastic rooms and it is centrally located place. Everyone who worked there was super friendly. The only problem we found was that the concierge didn't really know too much about the area. They seemed to have to look on the internet for everything (which we could have done ourselves). So don't rely on the concierge for any real tidbits, but other than that the hotel was out of this world. Huge, beautiful rooms, decent breakfast and nice happy hour included. Would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Superb cheap luxury”
Reviews.Author: Frade
Reviews.Content: This venue far exceeded our expectations. Truly five star. The room was lush, and the bed... oooooh. Firm but plush. And the jet bath was perhaps the most comfortable 2-person one we've been in. All of the staff were super friendly and helpful. Not something we expected, being non-French speakers. Right on the edge of Old Montreal, so easy walking distance to the boutique galleries, restaurants and other cute places. However, getting into the Downtown area is a bit further, especially if you walk underground (entrance to the underground city is opposite the front entrance).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing find!”
Reviews.Author: BikemanMtl
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room in another hotel, but when the reservation was lost, I had to scramble and find something at the last minute. I searched for over an hour on the Net, and based on the reviews on Tripadvisor, decided to give the Embassy Suites a chance. I was very pleased! Clean, quiet, spacious, confortable, close to Old Montreal and the downtown core. There's even a decent complimentary buffet breakfast in the morning. I will certainly book there again. One of the best values for the price in Montreal. The only drawback: no utensils, pots and pans or even dishes to go with the otherwise great kitchen... So be forewarned: if you stay at the Embassy Suites for a few days and plan on doing some cooking, bring the basics. Otherwise, everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Can't really beat the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: raveman2001
Reviews.Content: I'd say the pictures say it all. The hotel is less than 2 years old and has a modern feel. Each room is a large suite. Fireplace, LCD tv, basic kitchen facilities, modern bathroom. It feels like a nice apartment. Service is good, not great. It is a 4 star I'd say and the accomodations is the standout part. Location is good, close to areas you may not get to if you stay right downtown and you can walk 10 minutes, take a less than $10 cab or $2 subway to get right downtown. You are by the old port, near chinatown. I'd stay here for any weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - the best Embassy Suites has to offer!”
Reviews.Author: Ricky05
Reviews.Content: Excellent property - well above most Embassy Suites. As a family of five, all suite hotels are our hotels of choice. This Embassy Suites is an outstanding hotel. Our suite was exceptionally clean and modern, with 2 flat screen TVs, wireless internet, a huge bathroom, closets and a full kitchen. We found the people to be warm and helpful, the breakfast standard, and parking easy and underground. The location was perfect - one block from Old Montreal (lots to see, great restaurants), the Cathedral of Notre Dame, Chinatown, etc. We HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: CdnMtnGal
Reviews.Content: Having recently joined the Hilton Honors loyalty program, and having had a good experience at the Embassy Suites Deerfield Beach, I booked at this Embassy Suites for a business trip to Montreal. I was not disappointed. The staff catered to my request for a quiet room away from street noise. I was given room 1103, a two-room suite with a full kitchen. What a bonus for longer-term stays! Room service was prompt, and the serving was generous and tasty. A full buffet breakfast was included in the price. The croissants were the best! The only issue I had was that the jacuzzi tub went through some sort of self-clean cycle around 6:00 am, before I was ready to wake up. I wrote this on the comment card before checking out, so hopefully this problem will be fixed. Since I stayed only one night and did not venture out at all, I am unsure how convenient this is for shopping, etc., but I did notice that it is quite close to Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suite is a very nice hotel and seconds away from Old Montreal and next to the Metro subway system. During my last stay, I was upgraded to an "executive suite" which included an electric freplace and Neptune jet tub. The rooms are modern, well appointed and have enough a lot of space. This room type featured a partial kitchen (microwave, fridge, sink, dishwasher). Dishes are available on request This hotel is only 1 or 2 years old but a few things are already failing: Thermostat in main bedroom, fixings around electric fireplace,... and they are already doing some renovations (restaurant/kitchen) to certain areas of the hotel. Breakfast was included in rate and is ok but I have had slightly higher quality compl. breakfast at this chain before - not very impressive for Montreal. Don't get me wrong, it is a very nice place - good for families or business people, attentive staff,... but something just doesn't feel right, hence the neutral rating

Reviews.Title: “As Nice a room as it gets”
Reviews.Author: rwsdsc1
Reviews.Content: The room reminded me of The Hotel Mandelay Bay Las Vegas. Maybe the funiture was not as nice but so much nicer than a typical Embassy Suites, Brand new, Huge bathroom with 2 person air tub and seperate shower, 2 LCD TVs, very comfortable bed, Stainless kitchen appliances, and a location of a block away from Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than the average Embassy Suites and awesome location”
Reviews.Author: LQGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Oct. 11-15, 2008. We were in Room 912. Lets start with the two negatives and get those out of the way. First negative was the view....interior view looking down to driveway and building under construction (basically, no view). Not a big deal, since we weren't there to look at hotel views. Secondly, one evening, despite the "no smoking" policy, we were waken by the STRONG smell of cigarette smoke. In fact it was so bad, I actually looked out the hallway at 2AM to see if smoke was visable, for fear there might actually be a fire. We never reported it to anyone because we see that as a rude guest problem, and not something that management can control (we did however write them an e-mail afterwards in the hopes that maybe the ventilation system could be examined). That's it for the negatives. The mediocrity was the breakfast buffet. The variety was good. Most of the quality was fairly good to average (frozen breakfast potatoes, pre-mixed egg mix for ommlettes, etc.). After about two days of the same thing, you've had enough and want something different. The rest is all quite positive. First, we would definately return to this hotel if we needed to return to Montreal. It is literally around the corner from Old Montreal, across the street from a Metro station for easy transportation, modern, immaculately clean, and staffed by some amazing people who are so very helpful! One of the front desk staff, Camilla, was just a huge stand-out for us. She made restaurant reservations/recommendations, assistance with picking tours, greeted us by name, and did everything with genuine warmth and hospitality (it was clear that she loves her job and it wasn't just something she "is expected to do." Being about one year old, everything is in tip-top shape. The lobby is a little small for a hotel of this size. The business center was very nice, wih three terminals, printer access, and a private key-access room with which to use the internet. As for the rooms, they were really quite nice. It was more like having a small loft apartment in the city than a hotel room. The faeux fireplace doesn't put out much heat, but it was a nice touch on chilly evenings. Folks complained in previous reviews that the dishwasher doesn't open and that the hotel does not supply dishes/supplies. Had they read the sign in the kitchen, it indicates that, if the front desk is called, they can unlock the appliances and bring a supply of dishes and utensils. Everything in the suite was immaculately clean, in excellent repair. Other than the previously mentioned smell of smoke, we had absolutely no complaints about this hotel! On caveat... The hotel staff like to recommend Bonaparte restaurant (which is down the street and affiliated with a different hotel). We had dinner there...it was expensive, and frankly both of our dishes were a little bland (Filet of Sole, and Rack of Lamb). Even if the prices were not as high as they were, we would not return to this restaurant. In fact, we had a difficult time finding a restaurant that really stood out for us. All of the other ones were good....3-4 stars, I'd say. The best of them was down on St. Paul St. called Vieux Port. All in all, if you can secure a room here for under about $225 per night, this is an excellent value! Staff and rooms are quite nice. And a very good location!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with a few buts . . .”
Reviews.Author: Crooksmeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Embassy Suites Montreal for 6 days in the early part of October, 2008. There were lots of upsides to the hotel, and a few, relatively trivial downsides. First, the good. We found the hotel was in excellent shape, as it should have been given that it was less than 2 years old. Our accommodation, a large one-bedroom king suite, overlooked Rue St Antoine, was light, bright and very spacious, and completely insulated us from any noise in the street. We didnâ€™t look into the rear-facing suites, but they would only have looked out onto the blank wall of a building behind, and so would not have been so light as ours was. Everything in the suite was spotless, from the kitchen (equipped with a microwave oven, a dishwasher and an enormous refrigerator, but no stove) through the bedroom and living room to the roomy bathroom. The suite was equipped with two flat-screen television sets, and there was more than adequate lighting for activities during the evenings. The king bed was simply magnificent, as were the bed linens and pillows. There was an adequate supply of high-quality towels and toiletries in the bathroom. The breakfast (included in the room rate) was excellent â€“ a better than average cold buffet of cereals, juices, fruits and breads, plus there was a person on hand to cook eggs to your liking, from fried through to self-defined omelette. In the hot buffet, there were pre-cooked scrambled eggs available, together with bacon, sausages and potatoes. The lobby was spacious, nicely decorated and spotlessly clean. Overall a pleasant place to sit for a while and watch the world go by. The reception staff were friendly and very helpful. Each evening, a managerâ€™s reception was held in the lobby/restaurant, at which a free drink was handed out and an array of dips and vegetables was made available â€“ nice after a day of trekking the city. The location of the hotel canâ€™t be faulted â€“ less than a 10 minute walk to old Montreal and the old port, and also less than a 10 minute walk to the main shopping area on Rue St Catherine, Chinatown, the Latin Quarter, Museum of Modern Art, the Village and so on. The Place dâ€™Armes metro station (Orange line) is almost directly across the road and from here you can easily get to most of the central area using the Montreal souterrain â€“ the underground network of about 30 Km of walkways connecting shopping areas â€“ perfect if its raining or snowing. For the downsides â€“ not too much. The main problem for us was that despite the presence of the kitchen, and its being advertised as a self-catering accommodation, there was practically zero in the kitchen by way of self-catering equipment â€“ just 4 coffee mugs, 2 water glasses and 2 wine glasses. No cutlery, no crockery, no microwave cooking dishes, nothing. We eventually found out that everything was available from housekeeping if you asked. However, dishwasher detergent seemed not to be available, so the drill was to leave dirty things in the sink and housekeeping would take them away each morning. Big but - housekeeping wouldnâ€™t replace things (including the original complement of mugs and glasses). So, each day you had to ask all over again. This seemed to us to be silly waste of peoplesâ€™ time and effort. There was a deal of building activity going on in the immediate area, and this could be noisy and dirty, though we couldnâ€™t hear anything from our suite. Finally, the concierge function seemed to us to be seldom present, and not very knowledgeable about the city when they were there. We found the front desk to be much more useful. Overall, an excellent place to stay if you have some time in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: mln76
Reviews.Content: I am a huge Hilton Hotels fan, so I was very quick in deciding to stay here for a work conference. I was 50% glad I did and then 50% not glad. The good parts were the front desk service and the room. The bad parts were the construction on an adjacent building and the poor service/selection at the hotels restaurant. If you want more details on my stay, see my co-workers/sister's review. Oh and a side note is that if you have never been to Montreal, be aware that it takes a good 2 hours for lunch and longer for dinner due to their "different" way of providing food service. A european friend said it was like home.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service.”
Reviews.Author: hacmco
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to have a great location and the service was very friendly. Room was large - Embassy Suites standard. Very clean, well lit and modern conveniences. The hotel lacks a gift shop, so don't expect to find items like bottled water, newpapers, etc. There are shops within a block or so from the hotel. Found the food acceptable; nothing special, but again, the service was very friendly. All in all a good value right downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Catsmeow3
Reviews.Content: When looking for a hotel to stay at for a work conference at the convention center, this hotel became a fantastic choice! They had a special on King Suites that was equal to or less than the cost of regular rooms at other nearby hotels. Due to a hotel worker strike at the Fairmont (keep an eye out for strikes!), my boss was moved to a hotel far away from the convention center. Since the Suites were so nice and big, I ended up giving my reservation to him and sharing a suite with my coworker who also is my sister. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The room was extremely nice. Full kitchen with very nice appliances( LG fridge/freezeer, dishwasher, oven...) even some cutlery and a few pots/pans and food storage containers (more could be requested). Sitting area had a pull out couch for an extra bed, LG flatscreen TV, free wireless access. The bedroom had a great King bed and a flatsceen TV. The room could be closed off by sliding wood doors. The bathroom was huge with one entrance from the bedroom and one to the room's entrance hall. It had small glass stand alone shower, a huge two person jacuzzi tub and a vanity area in additon to the sink vanity.The robes povided were OK, but I would have liked something softer/plusher. Toiletries were nice, however we had the small problem of them not being replaced by housekeeping. Once reception was informed, after two days of this occuring, they sent up a nice bag full of extras! A couple comments on room design...The closet locations are a bit odd. The one in the bedroom is tiny with a very small chest of drawers in it. There was not a dresser anywhere. The hall closet was behind the kitchen in a narrow hallway, near thefront door. A room safe was not provided. The only mirrors were in the bathroom. The location was perfect. I only had to walk across the street to get to the convention center. China Town was a short walk one way and Old Town Montreal a short walk the other. You could also easily walk to one of the many underground mall entrances. During my time there, much of Old Town Montreal was under construction, this included the building adjacent to the hotel. I experienced serveral rude awakenings to jackhammers and such right at 7am. Even though we were on the 11th floor, it sounded like they were next door! Good thing I had meetings to get to. The complimentary breakfast was more than I expected. Buffet style, with cereals, breads, eggs, waffles, juices, made to order omlettes....It saved time and money! The evening Manager's Reception was a great touch too, with complimentary selected drinks and some veggies/dip/ pretzels/salsa/chips to snack on. You are given tickets at check-in for both. The one complaint I have about this hotel is their food selection for lunch/dinner. It was extremely limited and not very discriptive...I ordered a ceasar salad for lunch and being vegetarian, was surprised to have it arrive with bacon bits on it. This was not in the discription. Also, the service left much to be desired. Very inattentive. If you wanted anything(to order, your check, refill) you basically had to flag down any nearby waitstaff or manager or go in search of yours. Our waitress mentioned how busy they were as an excuse. It did not make sense. They had two waitresses and a manager working 5 tables (all one to two people, with one larger party). I found this type of service similiar to other Montreal restaruants, but this experience was the most extreme (this is just a brief description). I would strongly recommend against this restaurant for a sit down meal. This was at odds with the attention you receive at the buffet style breakfast or the Manager's reception, but that is probably because those are mostly self-serve and don't require a check. As a side note, I was told other king suites did not have the separate jacuzzi tub, but a tub/shower and there was not cutlery, etc, in the kitchen, so it may need to be requested.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JagMan88
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel last moth for two nights. The location is excellent for both business travellers and tourists alike as it's close to Le Palais de Congres, Old Montreal, Chinatown and also shopping on St Catherine Street. The suites are extremely well equipped with all the usual Embassy Suites amenities including HD LCD TV's in both sitting and bedroom areas. The buffet breakfast has a wide assortment plus an omlette station to satisy anyone and the Managers Cocktail Reception was outstanding with great Martini's!! The hotel isn't cheap but well worth a stay as it's excellent value all round.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Embassy Suites Experience”
Reviews.Author: DumplingBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at an Embassy Suites for a concert for one night using the Hilton Honors award. Overall, the hotel's appearance is wonderful. The check-in experience was wonderful and the front desk attendant was willing to give me some recommendations for some restaurants in the area. The room looked relatively new as we were given a King Suite with a Jacuzzi. The kitchen area was a nice touch with the fridge and microwave along with granite countertops. It almost felt like a 1 bedroom apartment in the city. Area is a little quitet as we were here during a weekend. There is some construction going on in the area, but I'm sure that it'll look nice when the construction is completed. Breakfast Buffet had a nice selection, including a cook to order omlet statation. If we're in Montreal again, we'll definitely go back to this hotel. Nice Job!!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience for the most part”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutMarty
Reviews.Content: Good area close to Old Montreal. Front desk staff was very helpful. We had some mechanical problems with the rooms and had to be moved two times, but each time was upgraded to a better room. For the most part rooms were nice. If you want to participate in the free breakfast go down early as everyone goes down about 9:15 as they stop serving by 9:30.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: AndrewEC1
Reviews.Content: Great location, fantastic value for money rooms. The front desk staff are really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “wish the stay was longer!”
Reviews.Author: breezey103
Reviews.Content: Stayed just overnight on our way back through Montreal. We were extremely impressed with our room, at such a low price! It was very modern - the hotel seems to be brand new. Comfortable bed and very spacious room, with a mounted plasma tv. Huge bathroom, with combined tub & shower. The only downside was breakfast finished extremely early (9am). My partner was able to bring a tray of food up to the room for me though, which meant I was able to have a much need sleep in. There are laundry facilities in the hotel, which came in handy. Location wise, it is very close to Old Montreal and within walking distance of downtown. If we return to Montreal, we will definitely stay here.

HotelInfo.Name: Embassy Suites Montreal
HotelInfo.Address: 208 Saint Antoine Ouest, Montreal, Quebec H2Y 0A6, Canada
